The toll rates will be finalised in accordance with the National Highways Fee (Determination of Rates and Collection) Rules 2008. The NHAI will provide monthly toll pass for daily commuters.

To reduce land acquisition, a staggered toll plaza has been proposed at the site. In ‘staggered’ type, the toll plaza for each side will be in two different locations and will have five lanes for various vehicles.

Overhead rooms will be constructed for administrative purposes. In a feasibility study conducted by National Transportation Planning and Research Centre (Natpac) in 2016, the site between Thiruvallam and Vellar was cited as an ideal location for construction of toll plaza. However, the study had also pointed out that there was a possibility of motorists using the Thiruvallam-Pachalloor-Vazhamuttam route to skip toll payment.

As the Kazhakoottam-Karode project has been implemented in an engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) mode, the NHAI, instead of the contractor, will collect the toll.

Under EPC, the contractor will be paid the construction cost as a lumpsum grant. The NHAI will engage a separate contractor for fee collection. With NHAI shifting to FASTag, more motorists in city will have to switch to the RFID-mode payment.

Title: KVP Ramachandra Rao’s poser on his name in Nereducherla voters’ list
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

KVP Ramachandra Rao

Hyderabad: Congress Rajya Sabha MP KVP Ramachandra Rao on Tuesday said he has opted for Hyderabad as the nodal district and has a right to cast his vote as an ex-officio member from any municipality of his choice in Telangana.

“If I was not a voter in the category of ex-officio member, why would the State Election Commission include my name in the voters’ list in Nereducherla municipality,” he sought to know.

Meanwhile, senior Congress MLC T Jeevan Reddy said it was a pity that TRS Rajya Sabha MP K Keshava Rao was lying on the confusion over his and KVP’s voting right. “Keshava Rao is 80 years old and telling lies at this age is not advisable,” Jeevan Reddy said, while referring to Keshava Rao submitting a letter to SEC officials that he is an ex-officio voter in Telangana and not Andhra Pradesh.

Title: Kochi corporation mulls action against building for CRZ violation
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Choice Marina, an aprtment complex at Thoppumpady

KOCHI: The corporation council held on Tuesday has decided to take action against Choice Marina, an apartment at Thoppumpady , which according to the local body authorities was constructed violating Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ) norms. The council decided to act against the building after the local body’s assistant executive engineer submitted a report pinpointing the violations.

As per the report, the structure doesn’t have a building permit, an occupancy certificate and the approvals from agencies like the fire and rescue services. The building permit and occupancy certificate were not renewed since 2017, the report states. The building also figures in the list of structures constructed in violation of CRZ, which the local body submitted to the coastal district committee last month.

A meeting of the council held a few days ago had asked the corporation’s assistant executive engineer to submit a report on the violations by the builder. When the assistant executive engineer presented the report before the council, the mayor asked him whether any court has stayed action against the structure. The engineer informed her that no such stay order prevails.

“So, action should be taken against the unauthorised structure. The superintending engineer should submit a report on what action can be taken against the builder. The town planning department and corporation council should look at the report and then we can finalize what action can be taken against the structure,” mayor Soumini Jain said.

Councillor Benedict Fernandez, who brought the issue of the reported violations by the builder to the notice of the council several times, said the structure should be razed down like the buildings in Maradu.

Councillor T K Asharaf also aired similar views. Fernandez said the corporation should file a caveat in the court as chances are high for the builder to move the court against the local body’s decision.

According to the report submitted by the assistant executive engineer, the building doesn’t have a valid nod from the fire and rescue department since 2018. The approval from Kerala State Pollution Control Board expired on December 31, 2018. The construction was carried out without following the ‘set back’ norms prescribed in Kerala Municipal Building Rules (KMBR). There isn’t adequate ‘set back’ in the rear side of the structure, the report states. The builder had provision to file application for regularization subject to the government order along with required papers and nods. But he didn’t apply for it, the report states.

When TOI contacted the builder, he denied violating CRZ norms and said there were only a few procedural errors in securing prior NOC from the corporation. “It (allegations that the building lacks CRZ clearance) is misleading. There are no CRZ violations. Prior NOC was required. That’s all. A case is pending before the court in this regard. We are expecting a verdict from the court soon. Then, we will get occupancy certificate as well,” said Jose Thomas, managing director, of Choice group.

However, corporation officials maintain that the builder has not secured a stay order and so action can be taken against the structure.

Title: Light Metro: Info on techies’ mode of travel sought
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Image taken from KRTL

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Urban Mass Transit Company (UMTC), which was engaged by Kerala Rapid Transit Corporation Limit (KRTL) to study the feasibility of including Technopark into the alignment of proposed light metro , is conducting a survey among Technopark professionals with the support of Group of Technology Companies (GTech).

The ‘stated preference’ survey, which includes a set of questionnaires, have been circulated among various companies a few weeks ago.

The questions probe the existing mode of transport of techies, the number of vehicles they own, cost incurred for travel per month, etc. The survey checks whether the techies are ready to switch to light metro and reasons for their answer.

To check the response of techies to feeder services to connect the metro to the IT park, the survey has included the expectation of commuters to feeder service, amount they are willing to pay and maximum time they are ready to wait for a feeder service.

“So far, only 5,000 employees have responded. As we know, Technopark has over 50,000 employees. It will be a good sample size if we could collect at least 25,000 responses. We are planning to push the survey through HR managers of various companies. The survey has to be submitted by February first week,” said Vishnu V Nair, CEO of GTech.

Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan , who is also the chairman of KRTL board, had suggested inclusion of Technopark last year based on a memorandum submitted by GTech. GTech had pointed out that it would be unfair to exclude the large number of IT professionals from using light metro.

As per the initial detailed project report submitted by Delhi Metro Rail Corporation(DMRC), the alignment of light metro is from Pallippuram to Karamana, covering a total distance of 21.8km. Under the proposal, a station would be provided at Kazhakoottam, Kazhakoottam Junction and Kariavattom for Technopark employees.

The DMRC had also conducted a feasibility study to include Technopark for its DPR in 2014. The DPR has suggested an additional station with a proper approach road as a better and cheaper option after finding that providing an arm to Technopark would cost additional Rs 120 crore. It suggested proper feeder options from the light metro to Technopark.

However, GTech and other organisations in Technopark said the project would not be feasible with the exclusion of IT community.

Title: Government block in Bandra-Kurla Complex to be recast as 25-storey towers
Content:
Bandra-Kurla Complex

MUMBAI: Thirty years is a short span in a growing metropolis, so just as the commercial hub of Bandra-Kurla Complex was becoming a hotspot, MMRDA decided it to make it more lucrative, planning a cosmopolitan transformation with taller buildings linked to one another and more green space.The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority is set to prepare a master plan for integrated development of 28 commercial and 10 residential buildings in BKC’s E Block. And in a ripple effect, it will help upgrade of various infrastructure in Mumbai Metropolitan Region, by earning a revenue of Rs 18,000 crore for MMRDA, the development planning authority. Infrastructure projects worth over Rs1 lakh crore—including several Metro networks and the Trans Harbour Link— are underway in MMR.Explaining the transformation plan for BKC’s E Block, which houses offices of several government agencies, metropolitan commissioner RA Rajeev said, “Most of these buildings are 30 years old and some of them have approached MMRDA to seek approval for redevelopment. We will work on a plan to have revised Urban Design Master Plan and architectural controls for BKC.”The plans will include seminal designs for buildings with features such as recreation gardens at podium level, sky garden, upgraded RG (recreational ground) plot, pedestrian plaza and an iconic pedestrian bridge across the Mithi river. “We want to have a master plan with Hong Kong type concept where people can move from one building to the another without setting a foot on the ground. The architecture will be integrated with Metro station and will have ample green space and buildings will have natural lights,” said Rajeev.The total built-up area consumed is 15.9 hectares and the balance built-up area available is 10.45 hectares as per the existing FSI policy. MMRDA officials feel more built up area can be made available if the global Floor Space Index concept is applied.At present, permissible built up area in BKC is computed only on commercial and residential plots after deducting areas under roads and open spaces. However, under the global FSI concept, FSI is calculated on the basis of the gross plot area, including road and open spaces. And when the global FSI concept is applied, MMRDA expects to gain 41.7 hectares of built up area in E-block and 278.73 area in G Block. This is expected to help MMRDA earn around Rs 18,000 crore as a built up area rate of Rs 3.44 lakh per metre.In a big boost for the plan, consumption of FSI will not be an issue. Till now, BKC structures could be 40 metres tall (10 storeys) because of the proximity to the airport, but thanks to the revised height restrictions by the civil aviation ministry, the buildings can rise go up to 25 storeys (80 metres).The plan will bring benefit across MMR. “The revenue earned will be put to use to improvement of infrastructure in BKC and MMR,” the metropolitan commissioner said.

Title: Kerala: Haze over illegal buildings put homebuyers in a spot
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

A view of Golden Kayaloram apartment being demolished using controlled implosion. (PTI photo)

KOCHI: When Valsa B (name changed) came across an advertisement of an apartment along the banks of Chilavannoor Lake, she could not resist the temptation to check out the property. However, she says, “My family urged a rethink. The pulling down of the apartment complexes in Maradu is still fresh in our memories.” But what is definitely a cause of concern is that though months have passed since the Supreme Court ordered the demolition of the flats over violation of environmental norms, Valsa had a tough time checking the veracity of building permits and various mandatory approvals. She said she searched the internet for information on properties that have violated coastal regulation zone (CRZ) norms and other building rules. “It is difficult to verify the credibility of information available on various websites,” she said. The state government has submitted an affidavit before the Supreme Court regarding the buildings that have violated CRZ norms. But details of the list remain beyond the reach of ordinary man. “Where can a homebuyer find information about the legal status of an independent house or an apartment complex? A random check on the internet provides a lot of information. There are reports from reputed media houses as well. However, people do not know which department provides authentic information,” said Abilash KV, an NRI based in Dubai. Sources at Maradu municipality said as the civic body’s online systems have not become completely operational, the details of the buildings that have violated CRZ norms will not be available online. “Those who plan to buy properties within the limits of Maradu municipality will have to come to the municipality office and obtain the necessary information. There is no other way we can help them,” said Maradu municipal secretary Mohammed Arif Khan. He also said public will have to directly contact respective local bodies to gather information details of buildings that have violated norms and rules. Meanwhile, it was being reported that the information about buildings that have violated CRZ norms and building rules were available on the website of district administration. However, when a query was raised with district collector S Suhas, he said the regional town planner would be able to give more information on it.

Title: Kochi student receives NCC Best Cadet Award from PM Modi
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Bhavana S Pai receives the gold medal for NCC Best Cadet (Army Senior Wing) from PM Narendra Modi in New Delhi... Read More

KOCHI: When Bhavana S Pai , a second year BA Communicative English student at St Teresa’s College, Ernakulam, joined the National Cadet Corps (NCC) Army senior wing as a cadet in 2018, her aim was to attend NCC’s Republic Day Camp (RDC), which is considered one of the toughest and most prestigious achievements for a cadet.

A year passed by and Bhavana, who is a Sergeant now, has not only fulfilled her dream by participating in RDC in New Delhi this time, but also gone one step ahead by winning the NCC Best Cadet Award (SW-Army). Bhavana received the gold medal and the coveted RDC baton from Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi on Tuesday.

“My maternal uncle Rakesh Pai was an NCC cadet who attended the RDC in the 1990s and he was my inspiration,” said Bhavana.

“It is a proud achievement for the college, 21 Kerala NCC Battalion Ernakulam and the Kerala & Lakshadweep NCC Directorate,” said Captain Seleena K V, associate NCC officer, St Teresa’s College.

Title: UN director general to visit city on Feb 5
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Jaipur: UNESCO director general (DG) Audrey Azoulay will visit Pink City on February 5. She will be treated as a state guest and a cultural programme will be organised at Albert Hall that will be attended by chief minister Ashok Gehlot.

She has been given the status of cabinet minister by the Centre. However, this visit will not include any inspection from the UNESCO authorities for the world heritage city. Azoulay will arrive in India on February 4 till February 6. She will visit Jaipur on February 5 morning and will leave by the evening for Delhi. She will visit Jantar Mantar, Amber Fort, Rajasthan Handicraft Emporium and Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalay at Jaipur.

This will be the first time Director General of UNESCO will be visiting the city after Jaipur had received a tag of world heritage city in 2019. Jaipur has become the second city in the country after Ahmedabad to receive this tag. tnn

Title: Telangana: Government school teacher uses discarded smartphones to give education a fun spin
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Umarani Chiluka and students use smartphones and VR tools at LalagudaPrimary school

SECUNDERABAD: While several schools in the country are wary of cell phones being used by students, Umarani Chiluka , a teacher at Lalaguda Government Primary School is repairing and reusing old smartphones to aid the teaching process.

Chiluka is one of the two teachers teaching 53 students of class 1 to 5 in a single classroom at Lalaguda Government Primary School. Being a resource person with additional responsibilities of teacher training and curriculum framing, Chiluka could not dedicate enough hours to teaching.

With barely one computer in the school and lack of power supply due to state government’s delay in paying electricity bills, the teacher took it on herself to use smartphones to teach students. It was in 2016 that the teacher started this unique initiative where she leveraged modern technology as a teaching method.

“One day I was watching a video,a student in my class, who has attention deficit hyperactivity disorder was attracted to the smartphone and took interest in the video. That’s when I realised that if he could be attracted to learning through smartphone, the same may be the case with other students of my school,” said Chiluka.

Since she could only accommodate only three to four students on her own phone, she decided to procure more smartphones. “I put up a status seeking old smartphones which were unused with minor issues. Soon, I could procure six units from my acquaintances which I repaired and started using them in the classroom,” said Chiluka.

She installed e-learning apps such as kids spelling learning, maths kids counting, speech to text, ABC kids – tracing and phonics to teach various concepts to students. “I use interactive e-learning apps which are freely available on the play-stores. These apps help students learn in a fun way,” said Chiluka, who recently bagged the National Information and Computer Technology award for Teachers for her effective and innovative integration of ICT in promoting students learning.

At a time when the Telangana government is promoting ICT learning in government schools, Chiluka has raised concerns over lack of basic amenities in schools. “We teach 53 students in a single classroom. Lack of space, poor amenities is a major concern for us. Although I have been able to promote ICT learning through my own methods, much more assistance is required to improve quality of education in government schools,” said Chiluka.

Title: Give suggestions for tweaks in IPC, CrPC: Amit Shah to states
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Union home minister Amit Shah (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Home minister Amit Shah on Tuesday reminded states to submit their suggestions for “comprehensive amendments” to Criminal Procedure Code and Indian Penal Code to make them in tune with the aspirations of a modern democracy and provide for speedy justice.

The reminder, which came at the meeting of the Central Zonal Council in Nava Raipur in Chhattisgarh, follows nearly two months after Shah informed Rajya Sabha that he had written to all CMs seeking their views and suggestions on amendments required in CrPC and IPC to make them more conducive to the current democratic set-up. The meeting was attended by the CMs of Chhattisgarh, UP, MP and Uttarakhand .

Shah has several times in the past spoken of the need to amend the archaic IPC and CrPC to bring them in line with the requirements of modern times. There is a thinking within the government that certain provisions of CrPC and IPC need a relook, including the judicial appeal process for crimes like rape and narcotics sale.

Only recently, the home ministry moved an application in the apex court for modification of its January 2014 guidelines to make such laws “victim-centric” rather than “convict-centric”. It had argued that a time-limit be fixed for convicts to file a curative petition.

At Tuesday’s meeting, Shah exhorted the member-states to expeditiously resolve issues relating to forest clearance and provide brick-&-mortar banking facility within 5 km radius in each village — particularly in Maoist-infested areas. He called upon states to adhere to the timeline of 2 months for completion of probe of offences under Pocso Act. Shah also called for prompt payment to farmers and assured states in the region that their issues relating to procurement of grains and their disposal would be resolved quickly.

Title: Not much scope to hike budget of water resources department
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nagpur: The state’s budget for the water resources department (WRD) that has been in the midst of controversies since nearly a decade is not likely to go up in the coming budget too.

At the most it may be increased by Rs1000 odd crore as against the average allocation of Rs8500 crore over the last 10 years, said sources accompanying deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar . The deputy chief minister had come down to Nagpur for a district annual budget planning meet.

This is because a number of projects do not have the capacity to absorb the funds, said a source. Poor allocation to WRD has been blamed as one of the major reasons for the slow development of irrigation projects. A number of irrigation projects are under the ACB scanner. The agency had given Pawar a clean chit.

The official admitted that low allocations may lead to a vicious circle of delay followed by revision of estimates.

Though Pawar, while addressing newspersons earlier, said that the government will ensure that the funds are hiked for the sector.

Major allocation for farm loan waiver

A major allocation for the state budget will be towards the Mahatma Jyotiba Phule farm loan waiver scheme , said Pawar. The scheme at present covers farmers having loans up to Rs2 lakh.

The deputy chief minister said a committee is examining the possibility of extending the waiver scheme to farmers having loans above Rs2 lakh too. The issue of granting incentives to farmers who have made prompt repayments is also being examined by the committee, he said.

The panel will be submitting its report before the state cabinet which will take a decision on the matter, said Pawar.

He said the waiver amount will be directly credited into the farmers’ loan account and the district collectors have been involved in the implementation process.

Pawar said a meeting with Madhya Pradesh’s chief minister Kamal Nath for discussing the plan to build a tunnel to bring Pench river’s water from the state to Nagpur will be held in Mumbai soon. The tunnel is expected to do away with the likely water shortage the city may face, he said.

Title: Trichy: One more held for sharing child porn on Facebook
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: A 31-year-old man was arrested for sharing child porn pictures on Facebook near Somarasampettai in Trichy on Sunday. It was the second arrest made after a man was arrested on the same charges in Trichy city last month.

All-women police station (AWPS), Jeeyapuram, arrested Saravanan, 31, of Vasan Valley near Somarasampettai under Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act and Information Technology (IT) Act on charges of sharing child porn pictures on social media and transmitting sexually explicit acts.

It was a secret operation carried out by Trichy rural police following an input from National Centre for Missing and Exploited Children (NCMEC) about Saravanan who has been spreading child pornographic contents on Facebook through his account.

Police have been collecting information about him for the past few days before arresting him. Police registered a case against Saravanan that he shared the content on March 10, 2019. Police sources said that he had been sharing the content for the past one year. He is unmarried.

A senior police officer in the district said that police is monitoring the Facebook contacts of Saravanan. “Since it is a multi-district and multi-state operation, the respective police force will be collecting his contact details, as many of his contacts are from other areas. Police arrested him in Trichy since his name was cropped up in the list,” said an officer on Wednesday.

On December 10, 2019, AWPS, Cantonment in Trichy city, arrested Christopher Alphonse, 42, of Kajapettai near Palakkarai in the city for creating Facebook accounts and sharing child porn contents to his contacts. His two accounts were blocked by Facebook, but he created a new account and continued the offence.

Title: IT can’t fine legal heir for ‘concealing income’ of deceased
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

MUMBAI: Nothing is certain, but death and taxes, this is an often-used quote. However, after death, the legal heir continues to be responsible for the tax dues of the deceased. Fortunately, the Mumbai bench of Income-tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT), after taking cognisance of the facts of the case, quashed penalty proceedings for concealment of income in the hands of the legal heir.

The late Ramila Mehta did not file her income-tax (I-T) return for the financial year 2012-13 as she had expired in May of this particular year. Her tax case was opened owing to this non-filing and the I-T officer issued a notice.

On receipt of this notice, the legal heir—her nephew—duly filed the I-T return, disclosing interest from fixed deposits of Rs 16.85 lakh.

During the course of assessment of this I-T return, the tax officer imposed a penalty of Rs 3.14 lakh for concealment of income. This penalty was upheld by the appellate commissioner, resulting in the legal heir filing an appeal with the ITAT.

The legal heir submitted that he had migrated to the US, owing to which he had been unable to attend to filing of the I-T return. He also submitted that post receipt of the notice, the I-T return of the deceased taxpayer was duly filed, and the income disclosed had been accepted by the I-T officer. Thus, no penalty under section 271(1) ( c) could be imposed for concealment of income.

The ITAT also observed that the deceased taxpayer was a senior citizen, who had during her lifetime regularly filed her tax returns and disclosed interest income from fixed deposits held by her.

Based on the facts of the case and also judicial precedents set by various high courts, the ITAT held that no penalty for concealment of income could be imposed on the legal heir.

Title: Traffic comes to a halt for an hour
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Jaipur: It was harrowing time for commuters for an hour at Tonk Road and M I Road due to Rahul Gandhi’s rally on Tuesday.

Most of the vehicles were diverted to different routes and Tonk Road and MI Road witnessed jam at around 3.30 pm for about an hour though it was cleared later on. Traffic was moving too slow that time and people were seen cribbing about the crowd of vehicles on the street.

Rush of vehicles could be seen at the Gopalpura Bypass Road at 4 pm when people were going back attending the rally. Buses were parked at a ground on Vidhan Sabha road from where people travelled to the venue.

DCP Traffic Rahul Prakash denied any traffic jam in the city and said that the traffic was smooth all over the city. “There was diversion to different places so the traffic weight will naturally increase but there was no such complaint about the heavy traffic jam,” said Rahul. None of the buses were allowed to enter from the normal routes of Narayan Singh Circle to go to Sindhi Camp. They were diverted from Ajmer Road to B2 Bypass to Sindhi Camp. The low floor buses from Narayan Singh Circle were diverted from different routes.

Due to the diversion of traffic, many schools in the city declared holiday on Tuesday. Subodh Public School, SMS School and Maharani Gayatri Devi Schools were amongst many. Subodh Public School authorities said that there school is located on the VIP Marg which made it necessary for them to declare holiday as there was excessive traffic during the time of any political event.

Title: NMC’s bio-CNG, compost, MRF projects get Rs48 crore
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nagpur: The central and state governments have released funds of Rs48.10 crore for the Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) three projects — bio-CNG, compost and material recovery facility (MRF) — proposed for garbage treatment and reuse. Funds have been approved under the Swachh Bharat Mission.

The state urban development department on Tuesday issued a notification about releasing the funds. “Nagpur’s Solid Waste Management Plan was approved under the Swachh Bharat Mission. The Centre had released funds of Rs28.86 crore as its share to the state. The state’s share is Rs19.24 crore. Thus, a total amount of Rs48.10 crore has been released,” the notification stated.

The NMC had sought Rs267 crore under the Swachh Bharat Mission in 2016-17. The government had approved Rs96.22 crore of which Rs70 crore for waste-to-energy project and remaining funds of Rs26.22 crore for procurement of road sweeping machine and other machineries for improving garbage collection and transportation.

The government had released Rs48.11 crore two years ago.

The NMC had planned to drop waste-to-energy project due to failure of private operators to execute the project. The civic body has proposed to treat and reuse entire garbage by developing bio-CNG, compost and MRF centre at Bhandewadi dumping yard. Accordingly, the NMC requested the government to approve these three projects and also increase financial grant from Rs96.22 crore to Rs155 crore.

The state’s high-powered committee had approved the NMC’s proposal in September 2018. Now, the grant of Rs48.10 crore has been released.

A few days ago, the NMC’s general body approved development of three new projects. Now, the NMC can begin tendering process and execute the projects. The NMC’s plan is to dispose of total garbage generated from the city in a scientific manner.

Title: Chennai: 121 more CCTV cameras to survey stretch from Porur to Kathipara
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Commissioner of police A K Viswanathan inaugurates CCTV cameras at Nandambakkam on Tuesday

CHENNAI: The stretch from Porur to Kathipara along Mount-Poonamallee High Road, home to educational institutions, hospitals and IT parks, is among the stretches with high vehicle density. Realising that this stretch is prone to traffic violations and vulnerable to incidents of crime, police on Tuesday installed 121 CCTV cameras and 8 Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) cameras on the route.

The cameras, installed every 50m on junctions such as Kathipara flyover, Butt Road, Nandambakkam, Ramapuram, Mugalivakkam and Porur, have been installed at a cost of Rs 30lakh. A team of police personnel surveyed the areas and installed the ANPR cameras at places where motorists tend to cross at high speeds at odd hours. The Ramapuram traffic signal on Mount-Poonamalle High Road is officially the most congested junction in Chennai with, on average, more than 1.75 lakh vehicles crossing it every day. The stretch below the Porur flyover, with 1.27 lakh vehicles crossing every day, is a close second.

The stretch between Porur and Kathipara so far had less than 100 cameras, making it difficult for police to identify and nab those violating traffic rules, including jumping signal, violating stop line rules, riding triples and driving over the speed limit. Now, ANPR cameras can trace owner details of vehicles that violate rules by reading number plates and help issue e-challans for fines. These cameras will help build a database of vehicles plying on the road and book violators without police personnel out on the road. They will also help trace stolen vehicles. Photos of vehicles flouting the rules will be attached to the e-challans. The cameras will be linked to the transport department database as well to enable automatic serving of e-challans.

Inaugurating the facility at Nandambakkam, police commissioner A K Vishwanathan said CCTV cameras should be now considered a first eye while solving crime cases. Installation of camera had brought in a feeling of safety among commuters, particularly women.

Title: Kattakada murder: Probe ordered into alleged foul play
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: While all the accused involved in the murder of Sangeeth Balan (37) of Ambalathinkala have been caught, an enquiry will be held on the alleged delay from the part of the local police to reach the crime scene.

Following the allegations, the superintendent of police (rural district) B Ashok ordered the Nedumangad deputy superintendent of police Stuart Keeler to look into the matter.

The SP said that since there was no formal complaint in this regard, no official enquiry has been ordered. The Nedumangad police sub-division authorities would look into the matter, he said.

The SP took this step after special branch officials reported that the residents of Kattakkode, where the murder took place, highlighted the delay from the part of the officials at the local police station to reach the spot that gave ample time for the accused to flee from the scene.

On Tuesday, DSP Stuart Keeler spoke to the officials of Kattakkada police station and apprised their version of the events to the Rural SP.

Meanwhile, the eighth person involved in the alleged crime was arrested by Kattakkada police on Tuesday. The accused, identified as Baiju (36) of Kattakode near Kattakada was part of the gang which confronted Sangeeth in front of his residential plot, which eventually resulted in his murder on Friday night. Baiju was produced before the court and subsequently remanded in judicial custody. Vijin who operated the JCB which landed the death blow to Sangeeth was arrested on Saturday. Linu (30), who operated the tipper, and vehicle owners Stanlin John alias Saju (48) and Uthaman alias Manikandan (34) were arrested on Monday.

According to Kattakkada station house officer inspector Bijukumar D, Baiju was nabbed by the police from near his residence as he came back home from his hiding spot to visit an advocate on Tuesday. “Baiju arrived at the plot as a co-driver of a tipper truck and was at the spot when the murder took place. It is also learnt that it was Baiju who moved Sangeeth’s car that was parked ahead of the gate as a blockade,” the inspector said. Bijukumar also said that a request for custody of the accused will be made for further interrogation of the gang. At present, police have arrested all the men who were in the list of identified accused.

KPCC working president and MP Kodikunnil Suresh said that the state home affairs department has failed to ensure safety of its citizens. “The murder of Sangeeth, who was killed by the land mafia with an earth mover, shows how the state has fallen to the grasp of land mafias under the Pinarayi Vijayan government. Never before has Kerala witnessed such a disruption in the law and order situation. Not even a single day passes without reports of murders, robberies and violent atrocities by goons. The state government’s way of protecting accused involved in political murders are further empowering land mafias to carry out further atrocities without fear. The government should ensure that the family of Sangeeth receives financial aid,” he said.

Title: Kochi corporation is incapable: Kerala government tells high court
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kerala high court

KOCHI: Kochi corporation doesn’t have the funds or the manpower to implement widening of Thammanam-Pulleppady Road into a four-lane road, state government has informed the Kerala high court. The court has now asked the government to inform further plans.

The submission by the government was in response to a contempt of court petition (COC No. 2050/2019) filed by doctor Priyarenjini S of Kadavanthra through lawyer K P Pradeep. In June last year, the high court had ordered for completing the road widening within a year.

In December last year, the court had directed Ernakulam district collector to file an affidavit on how the land-acquisition compensation is proposed to be paid and why stamp duty remission sought by the corporation regarding requisition of land was not granted by the government. The court had also asked details on developments made on land surrendered freely.

When the contempt case came up for hearing, government’s counsel submitted that since the corporation does not have the funds or manpower to complete the project as directed by the court, it has been directed to pass a resolution to hand over the road to PWD unconditionally.

In the meantime, PWD will undertake a detailed study and prepare a detailed project report (DPR), with the fund for the study to be provided by Kerala Road Fund Board. The extent of land to be acquired, along with the approximate cost of acquisition, is to be submitted by the district collector to PWD authorities. Action is being taken now to submit these details to the PWD authorities, the government counsel submitted while seeking further time to file the affidavit.

After considering the government counsel’s submission, justice Shaji P Chaly granted three weeks to file the affidavit. The affidavit should include details of action to be taken by the PWD, the district administration, as well as the government in order to complete the construction of the four-lane road within one year as ordered by the court earlier, the judge directed.

While ordering for widening of the road within one year in June last year, the high court had criticized the government for PWD’s stance that it will not take up the work.

Title: Shaheen Bagh Protest News: Man with gun threatens Shaheen Bagh protesters , overpowered
Content:
He was detained by police later in the evening

NEW DELHI: A man with a gun was overpowered by protesters at Shaheen Bagh for allegedly threatening them with dire consequences if they didn’t vacate a portion of the road for traffic movement. A video of the man, Mohammad Luqman Chaudhary , scuffling with the protesters, with the gun sticking out of his waist, went viral on social media.Following the incident, rumours about outsiders entering the protest site with weapons started floating, which led to panic among the protesters. Tweets about outsiders threatening the protesters were also shared by people.The video of the incident was tweeted from the “Shaheen Bagh Official” Twitter handle showing Chaudhary carrying a pistol being caught by some women. The tweet also claimed that the man threatened the protesters saying “laashein girengi”.The protesters claimed that Chaudhary and another person allegedly entered the protest site by climbing over the barricade minutes after local MLA Amanatullah Khan held a meeting with the organisers asking them to open a section of the road for traffic.“He started shouting that traitors should start vacating the road. When confronted, he tried to push a protester. He then flashed the weapon stuck in his trousers,” said Gul Bano, a protester.The video showed Chaudhary in a scuffle with the protesters during which one of them pulled out the pistol from his waist and held it up for the others to see. While being dragged out, he managed to shake off the protesters and flee.Chaudhary claimed to be an aide of the area AAP councillor, Abdul Wajid Khan. However, Khan refuted his claims saying that Luqman owns a shop in the area and is not affiliated with the party. “He has got nothing to do with me or the party. He went to the protest site on his own and created the ruckus,” he added.Police sources said that Chaudhary was detained on Tuesday evening. He claimed that he had a licence for the pistol, which is being verified with the department concerned. He is a realty agent and a resident of Abul Fazal Enclave.“We have not received a complaint from the organisers of the protest. We will take action if the weapon is found to be illegal,” said DCP (Southeast) Chinmoy Biswal.Late at night, former Okhla MLA Asif Muhammad Khan lodged a complaint with police against Chaudhary.In Video: Watch: Man carries a gun to Shaheen Bagh protest area

Title: Madras School of Economics may establish policy institute for public finance
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

CHENNAI: Madras School of Economics is ready to set up a public finance policy institute to give suggestions to the Tamil Nadu government on tax revenue. MSE chairman C Rangarajan and director K R Shanmugam called on chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Monday and sought the state government’s financial support to start the institute.

The MSE team drew the attention of the chief minister about similar institutes have been set up in Kerala, Karnataka and other states. While Tamil Nadu alone did not have one, a proposal from MSE is long pending.

“In Kerala, there is Gulati Institute of Finance and Taxation which is a public finance policy institute and it is functioning under the Kerala govenrment. Similarly in Karnataka, there is a Fiscal Policy Institute in Bengaluru. We are ready to set up a similar institute in Chennai with the state government support,” Shanmugam told TOI.

The MSE needs at least Rs 2.5 crore each year for five years to set up the institute. “We suggested to the government on the need to have a public finance institute in Chennai about two years ago. The proposal has been pending with the govenrment,” said Shanmugam.

While the MSE team approached chief secretary K Shanmugam a few days to discuss about this, he asked us to meet the chief minister. “We got the appointment on Monday and our chairman presented the details to the chief minister. We have been told to wait as the government will discuss and get back,” said Shanmugam.

Earlier, MSE had set up the National Institute of Public Finance and Policy in New Delhi, under the aegies of its founder Raja Chelliah. “The NIPFP was set up with the proposal to suggest to governments about tax policies. At present the NIPFP is with the Centre and states have their own institutions to suggest to their governments,” said Shanmugam.

Shanmugam has presented several papers to the state govenrment in the past to help the government on bringing down the fiscal deficit.

Title: Greens meet Aaditya Thackeray, seek change in Navi Mumbai's golf course plan
Content:
A bird’s eye view of the area off Palm Beach Road at Seawoods in Navi Mumbai where the golf course project is ... Read More

NAVI MUMBAI: Two weeks after 724 trees were hacked on the site of the proposed golf course integrated project at Navi Mumbai’s Seawoods, environmentalists have now found a ray of hope for a change in the controversial project, thanks to a meeting with environment minister Aaditya Thackeray .Thackeray had held a meeting with top officials of Cidco, the nodal agency for Navi Mumbai, the Urban Development Department (UDD) and the environmentalists on Monday to discuss and deliberate on the golf course project which is currently in litigation between green activists and state agencies (see graphics).Environmentalists, who attended the meeting at Mantrayala, claimed Thackeray has suggested that a bird sanctuary or a mangrove park be made at the site to conserve the wetlands . Cidco has reportedly asked for a week’s time to come up with a revised plan for the golf course plan.Activist Sunil Agarwal, who was a part of this meeting along with his wife Shruti Agarwal, told TOI: “Cidco MD Lokesh Chandra and UDD principal secretary Nitin Kareer were also present at the meeting. After hearing our stand that the surrounding wetlands and mangroves must be saved at the 35.55-hectare integrated golf course project, Thackeray suggested to officials that a bird sanctuary or a mangrove park can be built here. Chandra said they will need a week to come up with a revised plan for the golf course project.”TOI tried to contact the Cidco MD and also the Cidco PRO through phone calls, text messages and emails to know their official stand on the likely changes in the golf course plan. However, there was no reply from Cidco till the time of going to press. Text messages and phone calls to Thackeray too did not elicit any response.The Agarwals, along with another local group Navi Mumbai Environment Preservation Society, have been legally fighting against state agencies for the green cause. City based activists have also questioned the need to have a second golf course in the city, when golf course is already operational at Kharghar.Agarwal said: “We will await the revised plan by Cidco. We will also urge the state government to take back the pending litigation case because the environment minister has stated that he wants to save the mangroves and wetlands here.’’However, environmentalist D Stalin of Vanashakti NGO, said: “I have serious doubts whether Cidco will really change the golf course project in order to save the green wetlands. They may slightly reduce the number of building towers planned here, but the golf course project may not be fully scrapped. But, I am also waiting like others, hoping for the best green scenario.”

Title: Hyderabad: Sales executive, vegetable vendor killed in road mishaps
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Sai Deepika Reddy

HYDERABAD: A 24-year-old sales executive of a private firm and a 37-year-old vegetable vendor were killed in two different accidents in the city on Tuesday.

Sai Deepika Reddy was on her way to office in Jubilee Hills on her scooter when she came under the wheels of a TSRTC city bus near Andhra Bank in Yousufguda.

“While trying to overtake the bus from left side, Deepika lost balance and fell on the road. The rear tyre of the bus ran over her. She died on the spot,” SR Nagar police station SI Ch Naresh said. Deepika wore a helmet but it came off when she fell down, he said.

Deepika, who was residing in Sanathnagar, was working as sales executive in Aparna Enterprises Ltd, Jubilee Hills. The mishap occurred at 8.45 am.

In another accident at Hayathnagar, the vegetable vendor, D Surender Yadav, died on the spot after a truck hit the motorbike he was riding.

His relative K Laxmi Narsamma, who was pillion riding, suffered injuries.

The mishap occurred at 7.30 am when they were heading to LB Nagar from Hayathnagar.

“Surender was taking a U-turn when the truck knocked him down. The truck driver abandoned the vehicle and fled from the scene,” Hayathnagar police said.

Title: DMK protests new amendment to explore hydrocarbon
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Trichy: DMK organized a demonstration in five delta districts demanding to revoke the amendment allowing oil companies to carry out hydrocarbon exploration without applying for an environmental impact assessment and holding public consultation.

As the union government's decision has come as a shocker to the farmers of delta districts, DMK president MK Stalin announced a demonstration in delta districts. Thiruvaiyaru MLA Durai Chandrasekaran led the protest held in front of the head post office in Thanjavur.

MP SS Palanimanickam, Mayiladuthurai MP S Ramalingam and party district functionaries, farmers and cadre from various political parties took part in Thanjavur, Nagapattinam, Tiruvarur, Pudukkottai and Cuddalor district.

“Farmers are refusing to give away their lands. Even the TN Pollution Control Board (TNPCB) has declined permissions. At this, the union government’s new amendment is against the interests of the farming community,” the leaders said.

In Tiruvarur MLA and district secretary of the party, Poondi Kalaivanan headed the demonstration held near the collector’s office. Hundreds of farmers, party cadres participated and raised slogans against the union government’s new amendment.

Party town secretary A Panner headed the protest held at Avurithidal in Nagapattinam district. Demonstration held at Thilakar Thidal in Pudukottai headed by the party’s South district secretary and MLA S Regupathy, North district secretary (in-charge) KK Chellapandian. MLAs Periyannan Arasu, Meyyanathan and party functionaries along with cadre were present.

In the melee, S Regupathy MLA suddenly fainted on a vehicle where the leaders were standing. Swiftly he was sent back to his home. This incident created panic among the cadres. Meanwhile, women from Thirumanur in Ariyalur district aired their opposition against hydrocarbon projects and the new amendment nullifying public consultations before executing exploration activities, by drawing rangoli in front of their houses.

Title: Ex-deputy registrar among 4 booked
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nagpur: Kalmeshwar police on Friday registered an offence against four persons, including the then deputy registrar in 2005, for their role in duping Arunkumar Tandeyya on the pretext of selling him a plot.

Police said Tandeyya was fraudulently sold a plot by Sunil Naredi despite it being in the name of another person. Nilesh Bagde had prepared a fake power of attorney to sell the plot which belonged to someone else. Ramrao Gondane, knowing the deal was fraud, had consented to become a witness in the fraud deal.

Police have also booked the deputy registrar as he connived with the other accused to ensure that the plot was registered through fraudulent means.

Title: WhatsApp no. of She Teams
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Secunderabad: A WhatsApp number (+91-9441669988) for contacting She Teams for ‘non-emergency' purposes was launched during a She Team awareness program conducted at Gandhi Medical College, Secunderabad on Tuesday.

The number will be handled by the Women Safety Wing. TNN

Title: Boy murders 30-year-old for stealing his mobile phone
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: A 30-year-old pickpocket, who was found dead in a public toilet in the late hours on Monday, was allegedly murdered by a minor boy after the former stole the latter’s mobile phone. Police have arrested the 16-year-old boy. The deceased has been identified as I Mohammed Ishak from Chinnaamy Nagar in Thennur. Preliminary inquiry revealed Ishak was involved in some pickpocket cases.

Ishak’s mother Shakila Banu in her complaint, told the police that she and her son went to Singarathoppu at around 8.30pm on Monday. Ishak had told her that he stole the mobile phone from the boy and that he was threatening him with dire consequences for stealing.

Few minutes later, his son went to the public toilet where the boy was there. They reportedly picked up a quarrel. The boy then stabbed Ishak with a knife and escaped. Acting on information about a body lying inside a corporation toilet at Jalal Kuthiri street, the Fort police rushed to spot. Police found stab injuries on the neck and chest. Police sent the body to the Mahatma Gandhi memorial government hospital (MGMGH) for postmortem.

Title: Kerala: Rs 5.5 crore allotted for bridge works
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

ATTINGAL: Kerala infrastructure investment fund board (KIIFB) has allocated Rs 5.5 crore as a first instalment towards land acquisition for the construction of a bridge across the Vakkom-Kayikkara section of TS Canal .

The proposal to have a bridge, that may boost tourism potential by linking historically important destinations such as Anchuthengu, Vakkom and Kayikkara , was a long-pending demand of the residents.

The project was proposed in July 2019 and received KIIFB approval this month. The bridge will be constructed at an estimated cost of Rs 28 crore.

According to Attingal MLA B Satyan, the bridge will solve the traffic woes of the residents of Vakkom and Kayikkara. The bridge, which connects Vakkom grama panchayat, Anchuthengu and Vettoor grama panchayat will reduce the travel time of the commuters heading towards Thiruvananthapuram direction from Anchuthengu and Vakkom.

“The bridge was conceptualized nearly ten years ago but the scheme met with various hurdles. At present, the residents of Vakkom and Kayikkara are dependent on boat service to reach other places. With the commissioning of the Vakkom Bridge, a commuter can save 3km of travel. The proposed bridge is 232.2 metres long and 11 metres wide. A footpath with 1.5 metre width will also be constructed,” said the MLA, adding that around 202 cents should be acquired for the construction of approach roads at Vakkom and Kayikkara.

“As a first installment, KIIFB had allotted Rs 5.5 crore for land acquisition works. From Vakkom village and Kayikkara Village around 92 cents and 110 cents will be acquired respectively. Compensation equalling market rate will be given to the landowners,” said the MLA, adding that the upcoming bridge will help boost the tourism industry as it will provide connectivity to historically significant spots such as Vakkom Abdul Khader Memorial in Vakkom, birth place of legendary poet Kumaranasan, Anchuthengu Fort and other places.

Title: VHSE-NSS cyclothon to promote Vimukthi drive
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

KOCHI: The Vimukthi cell of Ernakulam excise division joins hands with National Service Scheme units of vocational higher secondary schools (NSS-VHSS) in the district to expand its anti-narcotic campaign. As a beginning, a teenagers’ cyclothon named ‘Sheriyoram’ will be held at various parts of the district on Friday. Around 1,500 student volunteers of NSS units in 26 vocational higher secondary schools in Ernakulam will take part in 26 cyclothons.

Deputy excise commissioner (Ernakulam) A S Ranjith will carry out the district level inauguration by flagging off the cyclothon to be held by the students of GVHSS, North Edappally. All other 25 cyclothons will be held in association with the respective excise circle and range offices under Ernakulam division. At least 50 students from each VHSS will take part in the cyclothon, which will be followed by street plays, flash mobs and skits spreading the objectives of the campaign.

“The influence of narcotics among the youths, especially those aged between 15 and 23, is on the rise in Ernakulam and there is a need to expand the awareness campaign against it. The best way to spread the caution is through involving students in the campaign. Cyclothon highlights the importance of physical fitness in fighting drug abuse. Excise officers and counsellors will conduct interactions with students to help them understand the danger of drug abuse,” said Ranjith.

NSS will continue its association with Vimukthi in the next academic year,” said NSS-VHSE Ernakulam district coordinator Vipul Murali.

Title: Gandhi show humorous, dramatic: BJP
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Jaipur: State BJP president Satish Poonia has termed Rahul Gandhi’s rally as humorous and dramatic.

“Elections are happening in Delhi and rally in Jaipur. People of the state have been amazed to see the sheer display of Gandhi’s political acumen,” said Poonia, who spoke to media after the rally was over in Jaipur.

“Jaipur’s Albert Hall is known for Kavi Sammalen, Mahamurk Sammalen, here Rahul Gandhi has best entertained the crowd,” said Poonia. Accusing the Congress of misusing the state machinery, Poonia said that traders’ association have been complaining that they are getting threatening calls from the police asking them to send their salesman in the rally.

“Even we have received videos from the students complaining they were sent forcibly by the institutes to attend the rally. They were told that if they don’t attend the rally, they will lose marks in practical exams,” said Poonia.

Taking a dig at the music band performance at the rally, Poonia said that in the rally people were enjoying filmi music and they enjoyed it lot. BJP dissected the entire speech of the BJP and countered him on his every statement. Gandhi told that India has become a rape capital while PM Narendra Modi is silent on the rising crime graph. Poonia responded that Congress ruled Rajasthan is on the fore of crime ridden state in the country.

Title: Hunt on for domestic help who robbed family in city
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Jaipur: City police have sent out teams to various locations to trace the couple, who worked as domestic help and robbed the household, where they were employed, of Rs 50 lakh worth of valuables. The incident is of Vaishali Nagar police station area and the complaint was filed after the owners found valuables missing and domestic help nowhere to be found.

On January 25, when the owners returned home they found the locks of the safe broken and valuables missing following which they registered a case at Vaishali Nagar police station. The accused Omprakash and Deepa along with two other accomplices were seen on CCTV cameras taking the stolen things from outside the house.

Anil Kumar Jaimani, SHO, Vaishali Nagar police station said, “The family had gone out for a wedding function and when they returned around three hours later, they discovered the theft . After the complaint was registered, we found the CCTV footage which clearly showed the accused taking the things out of the house.”tnn

Title: Trichy MP to meet CM to discuss pending projects
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Trichy: Congress leader and Trichy MP, S Thirunavukkarasar has said that he will meet chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami to discuss and fulfil the long-pending projects in the district.

Speaking to reporters after participating in the first District Development Coordination and Monitoring Committee (DISHA) meeting held here on Tuesday, Thirunavukkarasar said that several issues are to be resolved concerning various projects which are dragging on for a long time.

“To complete the railway flyover, 60 cents of land is required, which the state government has. So, I have decided to meet the chief minister to clear all the obstacles to complete the pending projects including the railway flyover, integrated bus terminus and Thuvakudi-Palpannai service road in Trichy,” he said.

He stressed on the importance of reviving the forgotten demand which was proposed by then chief minister M G Ramachandran.

“Since it was the first meeting, we did not discuss in-depth the status of the ongoing projects. Each member spoke about their demands. So, from the next meeting, we will review the ongoing developmental works which are going on across the district,” he said.

Though MLAs from the district were supposed to participate in the meeting, no one was present. He expressed hope that MLAs participate from the next meeting onwards to discuss the development of the entire district.

DISHA will be conducted once every three months to fulfil the objective of ensuring better coordination among all elected representatives of Parliament, state legislatures, civic bodies and officials from various government departments. TNN

Title: Trichy girl becomes country’s best NCC cadet
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Flight cadet R Reshma from 3 TN Air Squadron NCC trichy receiving the baton for all India best cadet from PM N... Read More

TRICHY: A city college girl received the all-India best cadet award from Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the annual Prime Minister’s NCC rally - 2020 held in New Delhi on Tuesday.

Flight cadet R Reshma, from 3 TN Air Squadron NCC – Trichy, a B Sc Chemistry student of Bishop Heber College (BHC), Trichy represented Tamil Nadu directorate in the Republic Day camp this year.

She won the medal after defeating NCC cadets from Punjab and Gujarat who came second and third respectively. Reshma made it to the national level event after winning directorate gold medal in the inter-group camp (IGC) - state level event.

Following this, she was selected for the national-level RDC event representing Tamil Nadu directorate.

Best cadet is given for the all-round performance of NCC cadets, which include written test, group discussion, extempore, interview, rifle firing, drill, and cultural events. Speaking to TOI, Reshma said receiving the baton from the Prime Minister was the most satisfying moment after more than a year-long preparation.

She didn’t show much interest in NCC at the beginning. But successive camps honed her skills and took her to the highest level. A very silent and shy girl from her school days, Reshma says that NCC has moulded her, while giving wings to her aspirations.

Aspiring to become an Indian Air Force pilot, Reshma suggests students to take up NCC in their college no matter what career they choose in future. NCC will shape them to confidently approach towards their respective goals, she said.

The 3 TN Air Squadron NCC – Trichy has got into celebration mode after a cadet from the unit has achieved accolade in the national-level. Commanding officer Wing Commander C Gunasekaran said that Reshma is a multifaceted, multi-talented girl and what makes her unique is her humility.

In last two years, cadets of 3TN Air Squadron from institutions across eight central districts have earned 22 commendations. This is the highest by any unit in the whole country. This speaks volumes about the hard work put in by cadets and staff, he said.

NCC is giving plethora of opportunities for school and colleges students to display their talents in state, national and international levels, he added.

Title: Over 7,000 patients availed Kanivu service in Thiruvananthapuram
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kanivu 108 ambulance. (Image tweetd by @CMOKerala)

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The capital recorded the highest number of patients availing state government’s trauma-care ambulance facility ‘ Kanivu 108’, four months after the project was launched. As many as 7,096 patients made use of the ambulance service in the district between September 2019 and January 2020.

A total of 27,097 patients availed the facility in four months across the state of which 3,969 cases were accidents. December marked the most number of cases; 8,152. In December, 1,156 victims of accidents and 108 pregnant women sought the service. Eight safe child births were also witnessed in the ambulances in four months.

The project is being monitored by district-level committees headed by the district collector. In case of emergencies, calls can be made to the toll-free number ‘108’. Hyderabad-based company ‘GVKEMRI’ has set up a 24-hour control room in Technopark which receives trauma calls. The message is passed on to nearest ambulance after collecting name and address of the patient. Details regarding the emergency and name of the patient will be sent to the mobile of the ambulance crew. Each ambulance will be tracked at the control room.

Title: Christy Friedgram moves Madras HC for deal with I-T department
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Madras high court

CHENNAI: Even as an anti-corruption forum has demanded a CBI probe into the alleged Rs 1,500-crore scam in public distribution system ( PDS ) involving Christy Friedgram , the company has moved the Madras high court offering to cut a deal with the income tax department to prevent further prosecution and attachments in connection with the case.

The issue pertains to raids conducted by income tax department on July 5, 2018 in various premises of the company. At the end of the searches on July 9, the department alleged that it had unearthed undisclosed income to the tune of Rs 1,350.29 crore by the firm.

Christy group of companies has Tamil Nadu government’s contract to supply eggs, daal and edible oil to the mid-day meal scheme of the state.

Six months after the raids, Christy and its founder TS Kumaraswamy moved the high court to declare the search as illegal, arbitrary and unconstitutional and to prohibit the department from using, divulging or relying upon the material, books of account, documents, electronic records, affidavits and statements seized through the ‘illegal raids’.

On Tuesday, when the seven pleas by Christy came up for hearing before a special bench of Justices V Parthiban and Anita Sumanth, counsel for the firm A L Somayaji moved a fresh application suggesting a deal with the department.

“Due to seizures and freezing of bank accounts the company is unable to operate its business effectively. Payments to suppliers have been withheld, salaries to over 200 employees were delayed, and several other financial distresses have been caused to over 3,000 employees of the petitioner and its suppliers having a direct impact on the mid-day meal scheme of the state government,” Somayaji said. “Therefore, we are volunteering to withdraw all the seven petitions challenging the raids and further proceedings besides depositing Rs 50 crore with the department (Rs 15 crore already seized during raids and Rs 35 crore from Rs 213 crore already deposited with the court as per its order) on two conditions,” the senior counsel said.

“The department must permit us to withdraw the remaining Rs 178 crore deposited with the court and desist from any further attachment of the properties/accounts of the company including initiation of fresh prosecution,” Somayaji added.

Objecting to the conditions to desist from further attachment and initiation of fresh prosecution, the department’s standing counsel AP Srinivas submitted that the estimated tax evasion by the company is about Rs 2,056 crore, adding he need time to get instructions from the department.

Recording the submission, the bench posted the pleas to February 4 for I-T department to submit its response.

Title: Cops bust gang of drug dealers, three arrested
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Jaisalmer: District special team of Jaisalmer acting against drug dealers in places under Mohangarh and Nachna police station areas busted a gang and recovered a consignment of 12,000 drug tablets and arrested three people. In last one week, this is the second action in the canal area against the drug dealers.

SP Kiran Kung said that they had information for a long time about a gang selling drugs in the canal areas with poor people spending their hard earned money on these intoxicants and getting addicted. Taking serious note of this, a special team led by Kanta Singh Dhillon took action and arrested three.

Kung said the team in Nachna area’s 192RD SBS caught Ashok Kumar (40), resident of Kalyanon ka Bas in Jhunjhunu district and seized 740 intoxicant tablets. Similarly, Trilokaram (35) at 2PTM Chowarha under Mohangarh police station was running Kumhawat Medical Store from where they recovered 2,550 tablets. Cops recovered 8,000 tablets from Shrawan Kumar, a resident of Jodhpur, currently residing at 2PTM Sultana and runs a Balaji Medical Store at Sutharwala. A case has been lodged against the three under NDPS Act.

Title: SDPI objects to implicating it in murder of BJP man
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Trichy: The murder of a 38-year-old dalit BJP functionary in the city by a history sheeter on Monday triggered fresh animosity between leaders of Hindu and Muslim outfits, with the Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) saying its name is being “dragged into the issue unnecessarily”.

F Vijaya Raghu, mandal secretary of the BJP in Palakkarai, was hacked to death by a gang led by M Babu alias Mittai Babu, 25, a habitual offender, allegedly due to personal enmity. SDPI leaders said the BJP was wilfully targeting the SDPI to gain political mileage over the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA).

“The accused was identified and the motive ascertained as personal. Raghu’s daughter had said in an interview to a television channel that minutes before he was murdered, he had cautioned her that Mittai Babu had been roaming in the area,” SDPI Trichy district president R Hassan told TOI on Tuesday.

Mittai Babu was identified as the prime accused. Police also suspect the role of two others. Sources said Babu had been stalking the minor daughter of Raghu, for which he was reprimanded by Raghu. Babu already has a couple of cases of attempt to murder Vijaya Raghu pending against him in the Gandhi market police station in 2019. Yet, the Gandhi market police registered an FIR on Monday based on a complaint from his brother F Senthilkumar, 38, that Babu killed his elder brother at the behest of the SDPI for being pro-CAA during the protests in the Gandhi market in December 2019. Former Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan, who visited Trichy on Monday also took the same stand.

“It was an attempt by the BJP to gain political mileage by tarnishing the image of the SDPI, which has been staging protests against the CAA across the country. The Federation of Islamic Organisations has made it clear to the commissioner of police, Trichy, denying its role,” said Hassan.

Though police registered a case based on the complaint linking the CAA issues to the murder, police commissioner V Varadharaju said a thorough investigation will bring out the real motive. “The case was filed based on the reason cited in the complaint. We are closely monitoring the investigation, which will reveal everything,” he said.

Title: Coronavirus in Delhi: Three still quarantined, doctors wait for test results
Content:
Photo used for representational purpose

NEW DELHI: Of the three persons quarantined at RML Hospital following the outbreak of coronavirus in China’s Wuhan , one is a 48-year-old businessman who returned from Beijing on January 17. He has fever, body ache and difficulty in swallowing. The others are a 34-year-old businessman and a 24-year-old student suffering from milder symptoms similar to common flu.The doctors say isolation will be maintained till the test results are out as they have a history of travel to China. While two of them are residents of Delhi, the third person comes from Noida, said Dr Meenkashi Bhardwaj, medical superintendent of the hospital.“We are completely ready. The isolation ward has eight beds, which can be increased if required. We are following all infection-control practices and using protective equipment while dealing with the suspected cases,” she added.Till Monday, 33,552 passengers arriving to India from China in 155 flights have been screened for a possible exposure to the respiratory virus. Till January 14, 17 samples have been received by the ICMR-NIV lab, out of which 14 have been found negative.Many people have been kept under observation in several states. The Centre has stepped up vigil in areas bordering Nepal as well.A 24x7 call centre (+91-11-23978046) of National Centre for Disease Control has been monitoring the list of contacts furnished by the external affairs ministry, providing details of district and state surveillance officers, and directing a caller, if needed, to the relevant Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme officer.The Prime Minister’s Office on Saturday reviewed the preparedness to deal with any situation amid mounting global concerns over rising instances in China, where over 100 people have died.

Title: Cancer treatment gets affordable in government hospitals
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: A specialised cancer treatment that can cost up to Rs 6.5 lakh in private hospitals will be available free for the poor or those covered under the state health insurance scheme. For people opting for paid wards in government hospitals the treatment will cost not more than Rs 2lakh.

On Tuesday, chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami inaugurated two linear accelerator machines in Omandur Government General Hospital and Government Royapettah Hospital . The state has invested nearly Rs 20 lakh for each of these machines. Linear accelerator or Linac machines use X-rays (photons) to treat cancerous tumours. Last year, the first Linac machine was inaugurated in Madurai. These machines can perform stereotactic radiosurgery in a single session or over three to five sessions for larger tumours, oncologists said. Precisely focused radiation beams will treat tumours in brain, neck, lungs, liver, spine and other parts of the body, without harming normal cells.

“We have the latest technology generation machine. Similar machines will be installed in at least eight other government hospitals,” said health minister C Vijaya Baskar. While installations of seven such machines have been completed, the state is awaiting mandatory approval from AERB, he said. The eighth centre is in Salem.

In February, a third such machine for Chennai will be opened to public at the Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital, along with PET CT scan and a new tower block. “The premier hospital will have all five facilities under one roof. The CT/MRI machines in the hospital will be used for diagnosis, PET CT for finding different stages of cancer, CT simulators for planning and Linac for treatment,” said Tamil Nadu Medical Service Corporation managing director Dr P Umanath.

The corporation will operate all Linac machines just like how it runs MRI/CT machines. “Our aim is to make optimal utilisation and not limit the machines to duty timings of radiologists and oncologists,” he said. The machines will be periodically serviced and maintained by the corporation.

Cases of common cancer diagnosed at state-run NCD clinics increased by nearly 324% between 2017 and 2018, according to National Health Profile, 2019 data.

Title: Concrete poles on footpath leave no space for citizens to walk
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

There is no space to walk on a stretch of the footpath between Rethibowli and Nanal Nagar, because concrete poles have blocked the space meant for walking. This causes a lot of inconvenience for pedestrians, especially senior citizens. I request the authorities to look into the issue and take action

—Mohammed Hajimiah

Streetlights at the Kachiguda junction

can be seen lit even during the day. No corrective action has been taken yet. I request the concerned authorities to take prompt action to prevent wastage of electricity

—Ankit Mathur

Sewage water has been flowing on to the street at Kattedan industrial area in Sai Baba Nagar. Apart from the stench, the place is swarming with mosquitoes, which can be dangerous in times of dengue. I request GHMC to act as soon as possible to resolve the issue —Lokesh Begwanil

The road near Snehapuri colony in Nagole has become a spot for garbage dumping. The continuous dumping of garbage poses health hazards to residents. I have already registered a complaint on the Swachhata app but have received no response. I request the concerned authorities to look into the matter

—Shravani Ananthula

Title: Cops solve dacoity case within 12 hours
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nagpur: Kotwali and Jaripatka police, under the supervision of zonal DCP Neelotpal, have cracked a case of armed dacoity within 12 hours. The cased was taken up following a complaint lodged by Arun Mahakalkar, a farmer, who was robbed by the gang in the early hours of Monday.

A minor was detained while two others were arrested after their involvement in the dacoity come to fore during interrogation. Abhijeet Nitnaware, having 17 offences of robberies and thefts in the past, was arrested along with his close aide Ashish Singh. Police are still trying to nab two other members of the gang.

Mahakalkar was intercepted by the gang of five, who had come on a bike and scooter. Armed with knife, the gang snatched some cash and his mobile phone at Bhilgaon between Automative Chowk and Chikhli Chowk. Mahakalkar was heading towards Kalamna market to sell vegetables when he was robbed.

After lodging a complaint later in the evening, the Yashodhara Nagar police immediately broadcast the message to rest of the city police. Kotwali police nab one of the five accused whose interrogation led to the arrest of another two by Jaripatka’s detection squad.

Title: Agra Municipal Corporation officials meet traders, fail to find solution
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

AMC officials talking to the traders on Tuesday

AGRA: After the 15th day of the indefinite strike, Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) officials came forward to meet the Sanjay Place traders to find a solution to the issue of parking fee. However, the meeting which took place at the Dharna point in parking space failed to find a solution.

On Tuesday afternoon, assistant municipal commissioner Anupam Shukla and civic body’s parking fee in-charge RK Singh came to meet the traders on orders of municipal commissioner Arun Prakash . The traders demanded officials to cancel the parking contracts until the court delivers its final orders in the matter.

Shukla assured the traders that their demand would be communicated to the municipal commissioner. He also requested the traders to end their protest but leaders of the market association refused to end the protest till their demand is fulfilled.

In the afternoon, a delegation of senior Congress leaders came to extend their support to the traders.

Secretary of Sanjay Place Market Association Hiren Agarwal said, “AMC has flouted norms as traders of the market have already paid a fee for parking space at the time of purchasing property. In this regard, we have sought details under the RTI Act. It will reveal all the malpractices done by the AMC administration to exploit the traders and common people.”

Association’s treasurer Vinay Mittal, said, “The AMC administration is trying to exploit traders by illegally charging the parking fee. We have already paid for the parking space. To muzzle the voice of traders, a fake FIR has been registered. We will continue our fight against the parking mafia backed by mayor Naveen Jain.”

Title: NIT-Trichy wins national swimming title
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

TRICHY: National Institute of Technology ( NIT ) Trichy has won the overall championship in swimming in the all-India inter-NIT sports meet, with women becoming overall champions and men overall runner’s up.

The sports meet was held at NIT Surathkal from 17-19 January. C H Esha from NIT Trichy won the individual championship for the best female swimmer in the tournament. Participants from 24 NITs including Nagpur, Surathkal, Calicut, Mizoram, Jalandhar, Sikkim and Srinagar participated in the tournament out of the 31 NITs in the country.

The three-day tournament witnessed the participation of around 1,000 players in match league and knockout tournaments in basketball, kabaddi and swimming.

Title: Rapid response team set up to deal with coronavirus in Agra
Content:
Image used for representational purpose only

AGRA: Sounding an alert, the health department in Agra district has constituted a rapid response team to deal with possible cases of the novel coronavirus infection. Besides, the department has sought details from the Airport Authority of India about the people who have recently returned from a trip to China. Hotel owners have been sounded to inform about tourists coming from the neighbouring country.After getting the lists, the health department is going to conduct checkup of all the people who have come from China in last one month. The virus has claimed 106 lives in China. The health department has also asked private laboratories to send details of the “suspected” cases.Chief medical officer Mukesh Kumar Vats said, “Required arrangements have been made to deal with any case of coronavirus infection. We are on the alert as Agra is a major tourist destination and Chinese people visit the city in large numbers. Besides, a rapid response team, insolation wards have been formed at the SN Medical College and district hospital to put tab on any possibility of spread of the disease in Agra.”

Title: Official’s absence for measurement of land sparks row
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020
