VADODARA: Foreign affairs minister Dr S Jaishankar on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for the Rs 15 crore Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Centre for Empowerment and Livelihoods in Narmada district .

The residential centre to be made jointly by Sardar Sarovar Nigam Ltd (SSNL) and GMR Varalakshmi Foundation will have infrastructure including accommodation for 100 youths. It will provide skilled staff for the Statue of Unity (SoU) that has now become a popular tourist site.

SSNNL MD Rajiv Gupta said, “The centre aims to train nearly 600 youth, farmers, SHGs etc. every year through its various capacity building programmes. This centre will prove to be a boon for empowering the local youth and women by their skill development and provide them with employment opportunities.”

SSNL officials said that the centre will cause integrated development of Kevadia besides augmenting socio-economic uplift of this predominant tribal region. “It will run several free skill courses aligned to the National Skills Qualification Framework focusing mainly on demand of tourism and hospitality requirements in Kevadia,” the officials said.

Separate entrepreneurship modules and career counselling as well as coaching for job aspirants will be also be done at the centre. “More than 3,000 local people are getting direct benefit of employment as tourist guides, sales counter help, office assistants, security guards, drivers, animal keepers, etc,” SSNL said.

Dr Rajiv Kumar Gupta, additional chief secretary, forest and environment department, state government and managing director, SSNL and G M Rao, group chairman, GMR Group were also present during the ceremony.

Title: Five killed, 10 injured as car collides head-on with van
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Virudhunagar: Five people were killed when the car in which they were travelling, collided with a van in the early hours of Tuesday. Ten others were injured. The incident took place at the Idumankulam bridge on the Rajapalayam-Tenkasi highway in Virudhunagar district.

The victims, identified as Anthony Raj, B Ayyappan, M Muthukumar, S Sudalaimani and G Prabhu, were occupants of the car and were returning from Courtallam. While four of them died on the spot, one more succumbed at the Government Rajaji Hospital in Madurai.

According to police sources, the victims, aged between 25 and 35 years, hailed from Sivakasi and nearby villages were employees of a printing press. They had visited Courtallam on Monday.

Sudalaimani was driving the ill-fated car. On being alerted, a police team from Rajapalayam South station rushed to the spot and rescued the injured from the van.

A police officer said the 10 injured travelling in the van were on their way back home after attending a marriage function in Melur in Madurai. Rajapalayam deputy superintendent of police M Nagasankar also visited the spot to conduct a separate inquiry. Based on a complaint, a case was registered against the van driver and an inquiry was conducted by the local police.

Title: In Rajasthan rally, Rahul Gandhi slams PM on jobs, but skirts CAA
Content:
Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at 'Yuva Akrosh Rally' in Jaipur

JAIPUR: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday accused PM Modi of destroying India’s image and scaring away investors, and urged the youth to not let their voice be suppressed.Addressing the ‘Yuva Aakrosh’ rally in Jaipur, Rahul, however, refrained from speaking directly against CAA , but lashed out at the Modi government for failing to generate jobs for the youth. Coming down heavily on the Modi government’s promise of creating 2 crore jobs every year, he claimed that 1-crore people had lost their jobs the past year alone. “Where are the 12 crore jobs of six years,” he asked.“Modi gives long speeches on CAA, NRC and NPR but prefers to remain silent on unemployment,” he said. “The growth rate during UPA’s tenure stood at 9%, which has now fallen to below 5%, according to the new parameters for calculating GDP (gross domestic product). If we calculate it as per the earlier parameters, it will be around 2.5%,” he added.Urging the youth not to let their voices be suppressed, the former Congress chief encouraged them to ask questions on employment and the country’s future. Rahul said India was known as a country of peace and harmony, often cited as a contrast to Pakistan . But the image is now tarnished and businessmen are wary of investing, he claimed.“PM Modi has destroyed India’s reputation in the world. Today, India is known as the rape capital, but Modi does not talk about this,” he said.. When the youth raise questions over unemployment and ask Modi why he “destroyed” India’s image, they “are answered with bullets and are suppressed”, Rahul remarked.The growth rate during UPA’s tenure stood at 9%, which has now fallen to below 5%, according to the new parameters for calculating GDP.

Title: Seven electric locomotives make Southern Railway richer by Rs 42L
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Madurai: The Salem railway division of the Southern Railway (SR) has rolled out seven electric locomotives with colourful exterior advertisements. The first locomotive was flagged off by SR general manager John Thomas at Dindigul Junction on Tuesday. These locomotives have been introduced as part of the railways’ effort to increase non-fare revenue.

Railway officials said the first two locomotives that have now rolled out have been taken by SKM Feeds. The remaining five have been taken up by other corporates and can soon be seen on the tracks.

Officials said that prior to Salem division, Nagpur railway division in Maharashtra had introduced this form of non-fare revenue general generation. In SR, the first batch of seven locomotives were allotted by floating tenders for a three-year period. It is expected to fetch revenue of Rs 42 lakh – at Rs 2 lakh per annum per locomotive. It has been launched in WAP-4, WAP-7 and WAG-7 locomotives running from Erode and will be attached to mail and express trains running through Salem division.

The area allotted per locomotive is 533sqft and it can be changed once in three months when they are brought to the yard in Erode for routine maintenance work. During the routine check, the locomotives will be under maintenance for a period of seven to eight days, when maintenance as well as painting (if needed) will be carried out simultaneously.

Though there are no specific routes for these locomotives as they will allotted to trains based on requirement and availability, they will be pulling various trains across Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Karnataka and Telangana and will travel as far as Nagpur.

The new initiative was flagged off in the presence of SR principal chief commercial manager Priamvada Viswanathan, Salem divisional railway manager, U Subba Rao and senior divisional commercial manager of Salem division, E Harikrishnan.

Title: AMU braces for total shutdown as 10,000 students of various faculties boycott exams
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Aligarh Muslim University

AGRA: Demanding resignation of vice-chancellor Tariq Mansoor and registrar Abdul Hamid , over 1o,000 students of Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) have decided to boycott examination from Wednesday, putting the varsity administration in a tight spot.

3,095 students of AMU’s Women's College are also part of the protesting students, who have announced a “lockdown” from Wednesday.

Students of almost all the streams, including commerce, management, science, art, social science, life science and law are part of the protest, confirmed AMU administration.

Talking to TOI, one of the women students, Sadaf Shakeel, who is leading the protest at Women’s College, said, “Students feel insecure on the campus after the recent incidents, which took place on December 15 and January 26.”

The students were allegedly beaten up on December 15 by security forces, which entered the campus after getting access nod from the registrar and the VC. Four students were also detained on January 26 after the proctor’s team handed over them to policemen for shouting slogans against the VC.

“We stand with our brothers, who were beaten by the security forces. We are students and we have the right to raise our voices. But, the administration is trying to suppress our voice by creating fear of the police,” said another protesting student, Farah Rufi.

The protesting students also alleged that the administration was trying their best to suppress the “peaceful mode of protest by blackmailing them regarding their attendance and evaluation of exam papers”.

Senior secondary school girls of AMU also joined them. One of the protesting girl students of Class XII said that though the lockdown will impact academic activities, the administration has left them with no choice.

When contacted, spokesperson of the university, Shafey Kidwai, said that the administration is trying to convince the agitating students by engaging some senior members of the faculty and students. “There is no change in the examination dates and we will try that students appear for Wednesday’s exams,” he said.

Title: Sanskrit drama competition begins in Nashik
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

NASHIK: The cultural directorate of the state government has organised 59th edition of Maharashtra state Sanskrit drama competition .

Besides Nashik , participants from Beed and Dhule will also perform their plays in the last round of the competition.

Rajesh Jadhav, co-ordinator of the event, on behalf of the state government, said, “In Maharashtra, Sanskrit is an optional subject in schools. Being a scoring subject, many students opt for it. There are many people in Nashik who study Vedas and are acquainted with the language. I am sure Sanskrit lovers will enjoy the plays.”

A total of four plays spanning 1.5 hours each will be performed in a day.

Renuka Yeolekar, the director of the first play Lokabhiramah Shriramah, said, “All actors have been practising for the competition since August. Everyone has to recite the whole script and master the pronunciation with exact halant and visarg as that would be a criterion for judgement.”

Lokabhiramah Shriramah is a musical drama that portrays the story of Ramayana from Sita’s marriage till the day when her husband sends her to the forest when she is pregnant, Renuka told TOI.

Aniket Inamdar, an undergraduate student who is playing the lead role of Ram in the play, said, “It is fun and easy to perform a Sanskrit drama as the words are different from the day-to-day language. We have to focus more on the action so that those who do not understand Sanskrit can also understand the play.”

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Private airline stops three Gujaratis at Chinese airport
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Monarch Savaliya (second right) returned from China on Monday

PALANPUR/VADODARA/RAJKOT: Three youngsters from Gujarat studying at Nanchang in east China’s Jiangxi province are stranded there as they were allegedly not allowed to board a flight by a private airline suspecting that they could be infected with coronavirus.

The youngsters, one of them who is from Palanpur, made a video seeking support of Indian government and the ministry of external affairs.

The youngsters have claimed that they were not allowed to board a flight from Nanchang’s airport by manager of Spring Airlines on the ground that their body temperature was high.

“We were scheduled to board a flight to Bangkok from where we had a connecting flight to New Delhi and later to Ahmedabad,” said Amit Moradia. They claimed they were made to undergo thorough check-up at the airport as they had to pass through an infrared machine that detects body temperature.

“Our body temperature was slightly higher than 37 degrees, approximately 37.3 degrees. We were stopped at the airport and had to undergo check-up for which we had given them written permission,” he said, adding even the tests confirmed that they were not infected due to the virus.

“Body temperature of all Indians is considered normal at 37.5 degrees. Our body temperature was well within the range and even the tests had proved that,” he said, adding that the problem started when they went to collect their boarding passes.

Navneet Barot, whose father is a police constable in Palanpur, said, “The airline manager did not allow us to board the flight even as our test were negative.” The trio had to cancel their tickets of their connecting flight to Delhi and Ahmedabad.

“We are in touch with the Indian embassy but the situation at Nanchang worsening. On Monday, there were 7-8 coronavirus positive which have increased to 18 within 24 hours. At the same time, while our families in India are worried, we don’t have enough food and water stock,” he said.

Meanwhile, around 23 students including four from Junagadh and 11 from Rajkot are expected to return home soon while some have returned safely.

Monarch Savaliya of Junagadh who returned on Monday, said, "The situation in China is grim. We were ordered to return to India, but there was no way we could arrange our flight so fast. Junagadh's BJP leader Kirit Patel helped facilitate our return within just three hours after speaking with chief minister Vijay Rupani."

Four more students from Junagadh - Deep Vaishnani, Brijesh Davra, Ruchi Viroja and Shivam Maradiya, who are studying in Shanghai and Wuhan, are expected to return on Wednesday, official sources said.

Meanwhile, parents of a student from Botad, Samir, who studies in a university in Wuhan, are spending anxious moments as he is still stranded there. His mother is a teacher in Tatam village.

Title: UP’s Deoband also erupts in protest, braving rain hundreds of women launch ‘indefinite protest’
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Muzaffarnagar: Seat of world-renowned Islamic seminary, Saharanpur’s Deoband town remained strangely serene all these days while other neighbouring districts and towns of western UP witnessed sit-ins and protests against CAA and the national register of citizens (NRC). Darul Uloom had advised its students in December last year to stay away from protests which it said may “tarnish the image of the seminary.”

But, on Monday evening, hundreds of local women holding tricolors and placards marched to city’s Eidgah ground and sat on an “indefinite” protest. They stayed there the entire night, and their ranks swelled by Tuesday evening.

One of them, Amna Roshi, a young woman, said, “We have come on the streets against this law. We all are on our own; no one is behind us… no political party, no politician. And we will not go back to our homes till the government fulfills out demand.”

Another woman protester, Fozia Usmani, said, “We are aware about our rights that the Constitution has given to us. We will fight in a democratic way against this black law.”

The local administration was caught off the guard and heavy police force was deployed in the area.

Superintendent of police (rural) Vidya Sagar Mishra said, “We are trying to pacify them. Senior superintendent of police of Saharanpur also met them, but they are not ready to give up.”

Title: IIM-K beats slowdown blues with 100% placements
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kozhikode: Indian Institute of Management, Kozhikode, (IIM-K) has witnessed 100% placement for its largest-ever batch of 413 students within five days, amid concerns of slowdown in the economy.

The final placements also saw a 12% increase in the mean and 12.4% increase in the median salary from last year. The mean salary increased from Rs 20.6 lakh per annum (LPA) to Rs 23.08 LPA while the median increased from Rs 18.5 LPA to Rs 20.8 LPA as compared to last year, IIM-K authorities said on Tuesday.

The top 50% of the students bagged an average CTC of Rs 26.69 LPA, a 12.5% increase from the last year. Five students of the batch of 418 students chose to opt out of the process.

The placement offers were rolled out by 131 recruiters, a 22.4% increase when compared to last year.

A total of 29% of the offers were rolled out by the consulting sector while 21% of the offers came from financial industry and 18% offers from the sales and marketing sector.

IIM-K director prof Debashis Chatterjee said the alacrity of placements is reflective of the consolidation that quality B-schools like IIM-K have achieved over the years.

“Technology is re-shaping education and I foresee the edu-tech sector becoming the prime recruiter and a formidable force in attracting talent. The talent that an institute like IIM-K offers is more enduring than job profiles. Our students are recognized by our recruiters for their distinctive traits like talent profile, multi-cultural literacy, entrepreneurial mindset and richer diversity quotient,” he added.

Prof Shovan Chowdhury, chairperson, placements at IIM-K, said the institute has seen a 200% surge in offers from startups along with more than 150% increase in the roles from e-commerce firms securing 12.5% of the total offers from these sectors. “IIM-K has witnessed another successful completion of final placements for its largest batch despite the negative sentiment of the job market. Contrary to the industry sentiments, 14% of the offers have come from the banking sector. Overall, we have seen a 22.4% increase in the participation of the companies this year,” he added.

Title: Bodies of two men who drowned near Kalhatti Falls retrieved
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

UDHAGAMANDALAM: Two days after two men drowned in a waterbody near Kalhatti Falls in the Nilgiris, the National Disaster and Relief Force and a team of fire and rescue services personnel fished out their bodies on Tuesday.

The district administration roped in NDRF after fire and rescue services personnel could not retrieve the bodies as they were stuck among rocks and the waterbody was deep.

On Sunday, Ganesh, 25, and Samuel, 23, residents of Elk Hill area in Ooty, along with five other friends, went to Kalhatti Falls, which is 10km away from Ooty. “They were standing near the foot of the fall and taking pictures and videos. Suddenly, Ganesh and Samuel slipped and fell into the waterbody. As their friends didn’t know swimming, they didn’t attempt to save Ganesh and Samuel,” a revenue official said.

Fire service personnel and locals tried to recover the bodies for the past two days, but in vain.

Subsequently, the district administration sought the help of National Disaster and Relief Force. Besides, a team of fire and rescue services personnel from Kanyakumari district was also roped in.

The team of 21 NDRF personnel and 12 rescue services personnel recovered the bodies on Tuesday. The bodies were later sent to the Ooty government headquarters hospital for postmortem.

Police registered a case and further investigation is on.

Title: For safety of villagers, forest dept forms leopard taskforce
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Bijnor: To ensure safety of villagers in the backdrop of leopard attacks which claimed six lives in Bijnor district, the forest department has formed a leopard taskforce.

Giving details, divisional forest officer M Semmaran said, “We have formed leopard taskforce in the district. The taskforce is equipped with a four-wheeler, special cage, drone, nets and tranquilizer gun. Team will reach any spot after getting a tip-off about leopard sightings.”

From February to May, leopardess are known to give birth to cubs and turn aggressive to protect their litter. “Breeding season is set to start from February and will continue till May-end. The last time, we had rescued around a dozen cubs after harvesting sugarcane crop. All cubs were sent to the zoo. This time, a number of cubs will rise. We are preparing for the breeding season.” Semmaran said.

In this backdrop, a leopard taskforce will remain on its toes for the safety of villagers. According to officials, Bijnor district is known as the sugar bowl of UP. Big cats have made the cane fields home and are thriving. It is estimated that more than 100 leopards live amid the cane fields. Now, they have spread in lowland areas. Over the past few months since sugarcane harvesting begun, leopard sightings have increased manifold.

Since November, around 200 sightings have been reported to the forest department. Six people have been killed and numerous people have been injured.

The presence of leopards in the fields has resulted in man-animal confrontation. A big cat was killed by villagers at Bhogpur village on January 6 soon after it mauled a student to death.

Since then, villagers have turned aggressive and their tendency to cordon off big cats in fields is common. Recently, villagers had surrounded a cane field here at Fatehpur Sabhachand village, cornering a leopard there. Forest and police acted swiftly and controlled the situation. To deal with such types of incidents, forest department has formed leopard task force.

Title: Bus fares go up by 30%, thanks to toll collection
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Hubballi: The bus fare hike has been one of the long-pending demands of the loss-making NWKRTC. Though the authorities had several times placed a proposal to increase the fare following fuel price hike, the government had not approved the same fearing backlash from the public.

However, the toll collection between Hubballi and Kundgol or Laxmeshwar has prompted the authorities to increase the fare by over 30%.

North West Karnataka Transport Corporation (NWKRTC) has “quietly” hiked the fare of express and ordinary services after toll collection was started at Sherewad on State Highway-73.

Shivanand Gurusiddappa Ullegaddi, a farmer in Sherewad, alleged that the state government has started collecting toll at 19 booths, including the one at his village, from January 21. “But nowhere has the bus fare increased, except for buses plying between Hubballi and Kundagol. Though the toll for buses is Rs 95 for one way and Rs 140 two way, NWKRTC is collecting Rs 4-5 extra from each passenger,” he alleged.

Harish Koneri, a BJP worker in Kundgol, said NWKRTC is collecting Rs 5 from Kundgol-bound passengers who travel 21km, and Rs 4 for Laxmeshwar-bound passengers who travel 45km. “So the hike is unscientific. Kundgol people travel to Hubballi for their daily needs. Many farmers and labourers travel to Hubballi to work at factories, shops, construction sites. The hike is a burden on us,” he explained.

A conductor on board the Hubballi-Kundagol bus said that it’s become difficult for the crew to convince passengers over the hike. “Many travellers quarrel with us. But none of them approaches our higher-up. At the other end, our officials have not publicised about the fare hike in media or on noticeboards in bus stands,” he rued.

Mallappa Hullatti, a farmer from Noolvi, said NWKRTC had hiked the fare by Re 1 citing the toll plaza at Gabbur Cross 2-3 years ago. “Though buses are not going through the toll plaza and entering the Hubballi at Gabbur Cross, collection is still on,” he alleged.

Ashok Patil, divisional traffic officer, NWKRTC (Hubballi division), said the fare was hiked as per the government circular. “We have a government instruction to hike the price by Rs 4-5 for each toll plaza. Normally, contractors don’t collect the toll from ordinary buses. The toll contractor is not collecting toll from ordinary buses on Dharwad-Alnavar route. Such concession is not available at Sherewad toll gate. If that happens, we will stick to the earlir fare.”

WHAT YOU PAY

After toll collection started on January 21, the fare between Hubballi-Kundgol has been hiked from Rs 15 to 20 for shuttle buses, and from Rs 25 to 30 for express buses. For Hubballi-Laxmeshwar express buses, the fare has been hiked from Rs 51 to Rs 55. For other moffsil buses bound to Budenkatti and other places, the fare has gone up from Rs 22 to 27.

Title: Speed-demon loses control of car, kills four
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Mangled remains of the car

RAJKOT: Four youths including a teenager were killed and two minor girls injured when the car in which they were travelling cartwheeled 3-4 times after colliding with a motorcycle near Shapar village in Lalpur taluka of Jamnagar on Tuesday.

The incident happened when Kuldeep Sonrat (21), who was driving at very high speed on a narrow road lost control of the vehicle after hitting a motorcycle coming from the opposite side.

The survivors — Snehaba Zala (15) and her cousin Artiba Jethwa (15) — who were in the back seat of the car, confirmed that Sonrat was driving at very high-speed. They further told the police that after hitting the bike, the car rolled over 3-4 times and hit a concrete boundary wall of a factory.

According to police, besides Sonrat, Vishwarajsinh Zala (14) and Sukhdevsinh Jadeja (22), who were inside the car, also died on the spot. Mohan Joshi, who was riding the motorcycle, was rushed to a private hospital where he succumbed to his injuries. Joshi is resident of Kanasikri village in Lalpur.

Police said that Sonrat had come to Jamnagar for a function in his friends car and was returning to his village Navagam of Lalpur. On his way back, he gave lift to Vishwarajsinh, his sister Snehaba; Sukhdevsinh and his cousin Artiba; who are also residents of Navagam and had come to Jamnagar city for shopping.

Joshi’s brother Nanji Joshi has become complainant in the case registered at Meghpar Padana police station. Police sub-inspector D S Wadher is investigating the case.

Title: Cop deployed in UP cabinet minister Suresh Rana’s security found shot dead
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Ashish Kumar, 28, a Uttar Pradesh police constable of 2011 batch posted with police lines in Shamli district, ... Read More

MEERUT: Ashish Kumar, 28, a Uttar Pradesh police constable of 2011 batch posted with police lines in Shamli district, was found dead on the outskirts of his native village in Meerut ’s Mawana area on Tuesday morning. He had suffered bullet injury in the head.

While senior police officers are considering it to be a case of suicide, they have not yet ruled out foul play as the pistol used in incident was not recovered from the spot. “There is no struggle marks on the body and no circumstantial evidence suggest any commotion due to resistance. Also, the wound on the right temple suggests that the victim was shot from point blank range,” Avinash Pandey, superintendent of police (rural area) said.

According to Shamli police, Kumar was on sanctioned leave for three days from January 26 and is currently deployed in the security of state cabinet minister Suresh Rana . The local Meerut police which is investigating the case has claimed that the deceased was going through a marital dispute and was party to divorce case for which he had to attend a hearing on Tuesday.

Kumar got married to a girl in Daurala area in Meerut. The marriage soon ran into trouble following which the girl had registered a case of domestic violence against her husband and in-laws.

Sources said that both sides had agreed to settle the case for Rs 22 lakh and some part of it was already paid to the girl’s side. “There was a hearing in the domestic violence case and a final settlement was supposed to take place,” Pandey said.

Title: As illegal arms units sprout across district, Meerut turns into the new Munger
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

The raid carried out by a Delhi Police special cell team on the illegal weapons manufacturing unit at a locati... Read More

MEERUT: The raid carried out by a Delhi Police special cell team on the illegal weapons manufacturing unit at a location under Lisari Gate police station in Meerut’s Humayun Nagar on January 20, has put the spotlight on the city as the new hub of illicit firearms trade in the north, replacing Munger in Bihar. In that raid, which was carried out by keeping Meerut police in the dark, 50 pistols were seized and a local, Noor Hasaan, arrested.

It was not the first time Delhi Police had busted an illegal arms manufacturing unit in the heart of Meerut. In a similar crackdown in October 2018, Delhi Police’s special cell had arrested five men for allegedly running an illegal arms factory, again in Lisari Gate, and seized 84 pistols.

Again in November 2019, Delhi Police busted another illegal unit in Meerut, based in a residential house, recovering two unfinished country-made pistols and 50 barrels meant to be used to manufacture pistols.

Law enforcement agencies believe this development is adversely affecting law and order in western UP and neighbouring states. According to senior police officials, this is due to availability of arms with “factory finished” quality in western UP, which earlier had to be procured from neighbouring Bihar and Madhya Pradesh via conduits.

“We have been consistently working on gangs from the region sourcing firearms from Munger in Bihar, Khargone and Khandwa in Madhya Pradesh and West Bengal and Jharkhand . But this trend is now changing. Earlier, carriers, mostly from UP, used to go these places, procure weapons and supply them across north India. But now, they collect equipment and parts in UP, and get the firearms manufactured by craftsmen from other regions, which are then supplied to neighbouring states,” said Sanjeev Yadav, DCP (special cell, Delhi).

From clunky country-made pistols, criminals of western UP have recently upgraded to sophisticated factory-made weapons that compete with their counterparts in Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, etc. “Police in Bihar and Madhya Pradesh have tightened the noose on manufacturing of illicit firearms, forcing the artisans to relocate especially to western UP, where the demand is high,” said a STF sleuth in UP.

A country-made pistol, which costs Rs 1,000-1,500 to manufacture, is sold at Rs 3,000-5,000, while locally-sourced ones with “factory finish” cost between Rs 3,000-5,000 to manufacture, and is sold for Rs 15,000-20,000.

Though western UP is considered a hub of arms trade and manufacturing, law enforcement agencies become active only ahead of elections or critical law and order situations in the state. Reacting to the haul by Delhi Police in the past, SP (city) Akhilesh Narayan Singh said, “We busted several illegal arms rackets in the past, and continue to do so. We act based on our inputs, and so do our counterparts in Delhi.”

Title: Dy CM joins in releasing 301 turtles into Ganga
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Meerut/Hastinapur: A day after CM Yogi Adityanath flagged off Ganga Yatra in Bijnor, deputy CM Dinesh Sharma participated in a function to release 301 turtles at Makhdoompur ghat into the river at Hastinapur Wildlife Sanctuary. With this, the number of turtles released in Hastinapur Wildlife Sanctuary has crossed 3,000 ever since conservation began jointly by WWF India and UP Government in 2012.

“Turtles are an inseparable part of ‘Clean Ganga’ campaign and contribute a lot in keeping the sacred river clean,” said Sharma, who arrived on Tuesday morning at the ghat, offered prayers at the river bank and then released the turtles. He was flanked by UP cane minister Suresh Rana, Meerut MP Rajender Agarwal and others.

According to field project coordinator of WWF India Sanjeev Yadav, “ ‘The River for Life Programme’ of WWF was initially a five-year programme that began in 2012. Later, it was extended. We had educated the river bed farmers of Makhoompur area of Hastinapur about how important the endangered turtles are in preservation of river Ganga. We approached around 10 villages located on the river banks that encompass a stretch of 50 km. These villagers provided us with 53 nests which had a total of 578 eggs in 2014. This also gives them a sense of ownership. Over a period of time, this community-driven programme has resulted in the release of over 3,000 turtles. A majority of the turtles released belong to three species -- Three striped turtle Batagur Dhongoka, Brown Roofed Turtle ‘pangshura smithii’ and ‘pangshura tecta’ (Indian roofed turtle).”

Special fenced hatcheries are developed for rescued eggs and later, the hatchlings are transferred to a pond at Hastinapur Forest Training Centre, where they are protected and taken care of before their release into the Ganga four or five months after birth.

Divisional forest officer, Meerut, Aditi Sharma added, “It’s not just turtles but dolphins and gharials are also part of this programme. In fact in 2009, we (UP forest division) in association with WWF-India began innovative initiative of involving Ganga ‘mitras’ (village volunteers) in the conservation process. The community-based programme has resulted in the release of over a thousand gharials (finds mention in the IUCN Red List of Threatened species). Similarly, we have now three dozen dolphins up from 30 in 2015.”

Title: CAA: DMK plans signature campaign
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Chennai: DMK has set a target of getting not less than 1 crore signatures against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), National Population Register (NPR) and National Register for Citizens (NRC). In a letter to functionaries, DMK president M K Stalin said that while the target will be 1 crore signatures, party workers should not stop with it. DMK and its alliance parties had decided to get signatures against CAA, NPR and NRC between February 2 and 8. Stalin said once the parties get an appointment with the President, a team will present the signatures to him. “With regard to DMK cadres, whether is a public meeting or a rally or a meeting to get funds for the party, it will definitely be more than the target. Similarly, for getting the signatures, let the target be more than several crores as the CAA would divide the country in the name of religion,” said Stalin.

As per a DMK release, Stalin will begin the campaign in his constituency Kolathur, TNCC chief K S Alagiri will start it at Avadi, MDMK chief Vaiko at Madras Harbour, CPM state secretary K Balakrishnan in Villupuram, former CPI state secretary D Pandian at Royapuram and others in various places. TNN

Title: Congress wants Big Temple consecration ceremony in Tamil
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Tirupur: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee president K S Alagiri said his party wanted consecration ceremony at Brihadeeswarar temple in Thanjavur performed in Tamil.

Alagiri was in Kangeyam to participate in Tirupur north district Congress committee cadre camp on Tuesday.

“Sanskrit is an intellectual language, but Tamil is sweeter than the former. Congress is not against Sanskrit, but Tamil is a local language, and moreover Brihadeeswarar temple was built by a Tamil king. There were different opinions among the people in this context. But our party wanted consecration ceremony to be held in Tamil,” he said.

Meanwhile, the party passed various resolutions regarding Tirupur north district in the meeting presided by Tirupur north district Congress committee president P Gopi.

One of the resolutions said the state government should set up moringa leaf power factory at Vellakoil as moringa cultivation is prominent in this part of the state. The factory will improve the livelihood of farmers here, it said. Palladam-Karanampettai stretch in Coimbatore-Trichy highway should be converted as four-way. tnn

Title: Madurai: Man held for sexually assaulting three-year-old
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

Title: Civic body plans to buy 3 mechanised road sweepers
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nashik: Municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game has directed the solid waste department to buy three mechanised road sweepers and a provision of Rs 15 crore will be made for it in the budget for financial year 2020-21.

It would be for the first time that the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) would be undertaking mechanised sweeping of roads. These machines would enable the civic body to deal with lack of sanitation workers involved in sweeping the city roads manually.

The instruction from Game came during the meeting of head of department (HODs) held on Tuesday. The total length of the roads under the jurisdiction of the NMC is around 2,500-km. The city needs a total of 2,500 sanitation workers to maintain cleanliness and keep the roads clean. However, there are only 1,800 sanitation employees working with the municipal corporation.

As no recruitment has taken place in the past few years due to lack of permission by the state government on the ground of high administrative expenses of the NMC, the solid waste management department is facing scarcity of sanitation employees. There is still requirement of 700 sanitation employees for maintaining cleanliness in the city.

Earlier, the NMC had planned to outsource 700 sanitation employees through contractors and had also started tender process. But a section of corporators had alleged the NMC administration of financial irregularities in the tender process.

While the general body of the NMC had given approval to outsource 700 sanitation workers for a period of one year at a cost of Rs 20 crore, the standing committee of the NMC had given approval to give work order to the contractor for a period of three years at a total cost of Rs 77 crore.

This had sparked allegations of corruption by some corporators from Congress and Shiv Sena in NMC. The municipal commissioner had also directed the additional commissioner to verify the tender process.

As outsourcing of sanitation employees is getting delayed, the NMC has decided to opt for mechanical sweeping instead of outsourcing staff.

Title: Doorstep delivery of pension to begin soon
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Vijayawada: In a good new for beneficiaries of all government scheme, doorstep delivery of pensions is likely to begin soon. In a review meet on Spandana programme, held here on Tuesday with higher officials, chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy directed them to distribute new pension and rice cards between February 15 to 21 and begin the doorstep delivery of pensions.

As many as 54.64 lakh people are eligible for the doorstep delivery of pension facility, as per latest data. Six months prior to the elections, the number of pensioners was 39 lakh.

The chief minister observed that about 60% of the applications received through Spandana were related to rice cards, pensions and houses. He directed the collectors that the applications for audit of pensions and white cards should be completed and issued by February 2.

Meanwhile, eligible people who have been left out will be issued cards through the village secretariats. These cards are offered as part of 541 services and they would be given to eligible people within a scheduled time. Those who apply for the rice cards would get the card in five days from the village secretariats.

Reviewing the housing scheme, Jaganmohan Reddy said all the house site pattas should be issued by the time he visits the villages. He underlined that the plots of land and area chosen should be congenial for living and beneficiaries should be allowed only after the construction of the houses. He directed the officials to develope the plot by March 10 and complete the selection of beneficiaries through lottery by March 15. He added that data pertaining to beneficiaries of the housing scheme from 2006 is available with the government and they should be given priority in the first phase of construction of houses that will commence next year.

Title: YSRC and TDP gear up for Amaravati battle in Parliament
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Vijayawada: The capital decentralisation imbroglio has now shifted to the national capital. While the state government has sent the legislative council abolition resolution for Parliament’s nod, opposition TDP too is gearing up to take the fight against the trifurcation of the capital to the Parliament .

The ruling YSRC has termed the resolution to dissolve council as a “historic decision”. The party’s official spokesperson, Sattenapalle MLA Ambati Rambabu, said on Tuesday that many states in the country do not have councils. “The state government would not have taken such a decision had Naidu not influenced the council by sitting in the gallery. If anyone is to be blamed for this, it is Naidu,” he said.

Meanwhile, Naidu held a meeting with his party MPs to finalise the strategy to be followed to take up the capital issue at the national level. TDP MPs in both the Houses of the Parliament have been told to raise the capital trifurcation issue and scrapping of legislative council during the upcoming budget session.

Guntur MP Galla Jayadev said they will raise the issues in the Parliament. “We will also raise the issue of police oppression on peaceful protesters. We are going to lodge complaints with the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC), National Commission for Women and other appropriate forums,” he said.

Rajya Sabha member Kanakamedala Revindra said the resolution passed by the assembly to scrap the legislative council will not stand judicial scrutiny and they will take it at appropriate legal forums.

Title: Cop, 28, deployed in UP cabinet minister Suresh Rana’s security found shot dead
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Meerut: Ashish Kumar, 28, a Uttar Pradesh police constable of 2011 batch posted with police lines in Shamli district, was found dead on the outskirts of his native village in Meerut’s Mawana area on Tuesday morning. He had suffered bullet injury in the head.

While senior police officers are considering it to be a case of suicide, they have not yet ruled out foul play as the pistol used in incident was not recovered from the spot. “There is no struggle marks on the body and no circumstantial evidence suggest any commotion due to resistance. Also, the wound on the right temple suggests that the victim was shot from point blank range,” Avinash Pandey, superintendent of police (rural area) said.

According to Shamli police, Kumar was on sanctioned leave for three days from January 26 and is currently deployed in the security of state cabinet minister Suresh Rana. The local Meerut police which is investigating the case has claimed that the deceased was going through a marital dispute and was party to divorce case for which he had to attend a hearing on Tuesday.

Kumar got married to a girl in Daurala area in Meerut. The marriage soon ran into trouble following which the girl had registered a case of domestic violence against her husband and in-laws.

Sources said that both sides had agreed to settle the case for Rs 22 lakh and some part of it was already paid to the girl’s side. “There was a hearing in the domestic violence case and a final settlement was supposed to take place,” Pandey said.

Title: Man dies of burn injuries at workplace in Padra
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Vadodara: An employee of a company manufacturing lighting and electrical consumer durables died of severe burns in accidental fire at the firm’s Padra unit.

Surendra Parmar (47) was lighting an incense stick at the LED streetlight plant on Monday late evening when the matchstick touched his clothes.

“The deceased rushed out of the plant while his body was on fire. The security guards and other employees doused the fire and took him to a private hospital in Dabhasa,” said police.

Parmar died during treatment on Tuesday morning. He had suffered severe burn injuries on his face, arms and legs, police said.

“It has come to our notice that the company will be paying compensation to his family members and has also promised apprenticeship to his son,” the cop added. An accidental death case was registered at Vadu police station.

Parmar was working at the unit since 1994.

Title: Govt plans project to develop rural women entrepreneurs
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Coimbatore: To develop and promote women entrepreneurs in rural parts, the state government plans to implement the Tamil Nadu Rural Transformation Project (TNRTP), a World Bank-funded project to build sustainability and prosperity among rural communities through enterprise promotion.

The project will be carried out in two phases. “In total, the project will be implemented in 3,994 village panchayats from 120 blocks across the state over a period of six years. In the first phase, 1,393 village panchayats from 38 blocks across the state are selected,” said A Philips Ilayaraja, district executive officer of the project.

“In Coimbatore district, the project will be implemented in 54 village panchayats from four blocks – Karamadai, Annur, Sarkar Samankulam and Periyanaickenpalayam. Of them, 17 village panchayats in Karamadai block will come under the first phase,” he said, adding that the preliminary work to implement the project in Karamadai block has begun.

Apart from building rural enterprises, the project will create employment opportunities and assist in financial matters. “Our first preference is for women entrepreneurs, who should be part of a self-help group (SHG),” he said.

“Through the project, close to 30% of the fund to run an enterprise will be given by the state government. For remaining fund, we would help them get bank loans,” he added.

The project officials have submitted a report to the state government after assessing the available resources and identifying scopes for starting business in the district. “The next step is to identify business scopes in block and village level with the help of participatory groups. Subsequently, investment plans for village, block and district levels would be drawn and beneficiaries would be identified,” he said.

The officials are also conducting orientation programmes about the project in villages.

Title: MKU syndicate to discuss graft charges against CoE today
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Madurai: After the controller of examination (CoE) at Madurai Kamaraj University (MKU), O Ravi, was allegedly accused of corruption, the university syndicate members are set to discuss the matter in the meeting to be held on Wednesday and take necessary action.

A statement issued by I Ismail, general secretary of MKU Principals’ Association, has requested suspension of the CoE and an enquiry by directorate of vigilance and anti-corruption (DVAC) enquiry for allegedly collecting a bribe of Rs 3 crore from various distance education centre coordinators of Tamil Nadu and other states by distributing consolidated mark statements without collecting fees dues for the university. “It is a multi-crore scam resulting in losses for the university. This cannot happen without the vice-chancellor’s knowledge. Nexus between him and CoE must also be probed,” said Ismail.

Meanwhile, sources from the university also confirmed an incident last week wherein an unauthorised person accessed the consolidated mark sheets of various centres in the office of the CoE. MKU VC M Krishnan is also said to have acted on a tip-off catching the person in the act and confronting Ravi. However, no action has so far been taken after the incident.

Speaking to TOI, the VC said that the matter and allegations against the CoE will be taken up during the meeting of the university’s syndicate members to be held on Wednesday and promised that prompt action will be taken against him, if found guilty.

Title: NMSCDCL to carry out bore-well trails to revive the ancient kunds
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nashik: The Nashik Municipal Smart City Development Corporation (NMSCDCL) has decided to undertake borewell trials at 17 ancient kund sites in an effort to revive them.

In each of the kunds, the authorities will first sink a borewell to ascertain the water depth. If the water is not available in the kund it won’t be revived.

Moreover, the smart city company has decided to de-concretise the riverbed stretch between Dutondya Maruti and the Gadge Maharaj bridge.

The decision on the same was taken during a board meeting of the smart city on Monday. “We have decided not to de-concretise Ram Kund and Gandhi Talav in the river Godavari, but the stretch between Dutondya Maruti and Gadge Maharaj bridge would be de-concretised,” said the chairman of NMSCDCL Sitaram Kunte.

There were also proposals to revive 17 ancient kunds with natural springs in the Godavari. “Initially, we decided to study the project. Moreover, we will undertake borewell trials to ascertain that there are still natural springs at the sites of ancient 17 kunds,” said Kunte.

The survey for mapping of the kunds with natural springs have already been completed by the smart city officials.

In December last year, the smart city officials had decided to start the reviving work of the kunds from Gandhi talav, but they had to stop it following opposition by a section of corproators.

In 2015, an environmentalist Devang Jani had filed a PIL in the Bombay High Court seeking removal of concrete in the Godavari. He has been pursuing with the NMC for removal the concrete development.

The High Court in its judgment had said that it is the right to devotees to get pure water and it is the responsibility of NMC to make it available. In reply, the court had asked the petitioner to give a presentation before the municipal commissioner, who will take a decision on the same.

Thereafter, the then municipal commissioner Abhishek Krishna had deployed security guards to protect the river from pollution and had also set up a Godavari conservation cell. But, no decision was taken on removal of concrete.

Now, the municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game has taken initiative in this connection.

Title: SSI murder: documents seized from houses of accused
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Kanyakumari district police, probing the murder of SSI Y Wilson, have seized some documents allegedly related to the murder from the houses of the two accused in searches conducted on Tuesday.

A team led by DSP (crime branch) K P Ganesan, who is the investigation officer, searched the house of Thoufeek at Elankadai near Kottar in Kanyakumari district, while another team led by inspector Thangaraj searched the house of Sameem at Thiruvithancode. DSP Ganesan told reporters that they have some documents regarding the murder and that they will have to examine it. The officer refused to disclose further details on the documents. NIA personnel were not part of the searches. SSI Wilson was killed at the Kaliyakkavilai Market Road check post in Kanyakumari district on January 8.

Title: 2 injured in Kuppam bull-racing event
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Tirupati: Two persons sustained injuries during the traditional bull-run event — a milder version of Jallikattu — at Lakshmipuram village in Kuppam mandal of Chittoor district on Tuesday.

Despite strict warning from the police, the bull-taming event was held at Lakshmipuram village, in which around 750 bulls took part.

The organisers allegedly collected Rs 2,000 per bull and distributed huge prize money to the winners.

Scores of youngsters from various parts of the district and neighbouring states of Tamil Nadu and Karnataka thronged the village to witness the event in which the bulls were made to run amok through the narrow passage in the village. Meanwhile, two persons including a woman were injured during the event. While locals said the duo sustained grievous injuries, Palamaner DSP S Arifulla maintained that a youngster who tried to run behind the bulls sustained minor injuries while the woman, who was standing near the narrow passage where the bulls were made to run, sustained abrasions only.

Title: Mutilated ‘torso’ only found floating in Sayla
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Rajkot: A badly mutilated and decapitated torso was found floating in the Thoriyali dam reservoir in Sayla taluka of Surendranagar on Tuesday.

Sarpanch of Juna Jasapar village, Jesabhai Algotar, informed the police on Monday evening about the discovery of the headless, limbless body found floating in the reservoir.

Police said that that body part had started decomposing. “We have registered a case of murder and are trying to ascertain the identity of the deceased,” said sub-inspector R J Gohil of Sayla police station, who is probing the case.

Title: Petition against school teacher for ill-treating cancer-ridden student
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Madurai: The mother of a cancer-ridden son has petitioned the Kanyakumari district collector Prashant M Wadnere on Tuesday seeking action against a government school teacher who allegedly ill-treated her son.

According to the petition by S Syethu Marjuna, her son, A Muhammed Abid, is studying Class XI at the Thuckalay government higher secondary school. “My son, who is undergoing chemotherapy for cancer was treated in an inhumane manner by his teacher. He was scolded for not keeping his hair neat and was also forced to sit on the floor for three hours to write a revision test,” Marjuna said.

Further, despite Abid’s repeated pleas to sit more comfortably on the bench and explanation about his health condition, the teacher, identified as Fredrick Manohar, only verbally abused him more, the petition said.

She also noted that her son also started suffering from neck pain since the incident and is being given treatment for seizures.

The boy was diagnosed with cancer when he was in Class IX. He has been undergoing continuous periodical medical treatment at the Thiruvananthapuram RCC Hospital.

Title: Plea to scrap Class V, VIII board exams
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Madurai: Even as State school education minister KA Sengottaiyan insisted that board exams for students of Class V and VIII will definitely be held this year, many teachers in the city from both government and private schools are still against the exams being conducted.

The Private Schools Correspondents Confederation (PSCC), an association of private schools affiliated to the state board has written to the secretary, Ministry of School Education, requesting to scrap the exams.

“Considering that the children come from different learning spectrums, we adapt our delivery and assessment as best suited to them. So, it is essential that primary schooling from grades I to VIII have the utmost flexibility and autonomy,” the association said in a statement. It further added that after the announcement of board exams, many parents had approached member schools asking for rigorous academic schedules and pulled out children from all their extra-curricular activities.

“Already, the introduction of board examination for Class XI has created undue pressure on children. Many of them have dropped of class XI and this year, in turn, has seen an increase in enrolment in polytechnic colleges. Having two more board exams will be rather disastrous,” said the PSCC statement.

Several government school teachers also echoed similar concerns and said that the only reason to not oppose the exams was fear of losing their jobs. “I understand that it is a quality test. But, this will only put unnecessary pressure on students and teachers because results are ultimate. Desperation for good result will not help improve the quality of education and only increase dropouts. Students will be denied a basic right,” said a headmaster of a government school.

Senthilnathan M, president, PSCC, said that the association is reaching out to try and create a collective of teachers and parents to appeal to the government to scrap the exams. “The only thing is that everyone has to come together for this. If required, we are planning to take it to court as well,” he added.

Title: City MP urges CM to push projects stuck in Nashik
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

(done)

Nashik: City MP Hemant Godse has urged chief minister Uddhav Thackeray to request the Centre to speed up projects like Nashik Metro, Nashik-Pune railway track and strengthening of air connectivity under regional connectivity scheme (RCS).

According to a statement issued by Godse, he took up the issue of pending projects in Nashik during a meeting of all MPs from the state convened by the CM in Mumbai on Monday.

Godse said that he informed Thackeray about the pending projects that have halted development in the district, which need to be pushed by the Union government. “The CM assured me that he would look into the issues.”

“The Nashik metro project has been approved by the state government and has been sent to the Centre for approval, but it is still pending and the state government needs to pursue it. The project is important to strengthen the public transport in the city,” said Godse.

The MP said that he also brought to the notice of the CM the DPR of Nashik-Pune railway line project that is lying with the state government for approval.

The ministry of civil aviation has already awarded different routes to various private airlines under RCS, but these airlines are yet to start operations from some airports in Maharashhtra, including Nashik.

Godse said that he urged the CM to pursue the issue with the central government and urge it to ensure commencement of all flights under RCS from Nashik and other airports in the state.

The MP said that Nashik and Nagpur have been selected by the Centre for the Ramayan Circuit project, which is yet to take off. There is a need to pursue the issue with the Centre to get the proposal approved.

“The Union ministry of agriculture has in principle given its approval for agricultural terminal projects for Nagpur, Nashik and Thane. The project, which is in the interest of farmers, is yet to kick-start in Nashik,” he said.

Title: Police arrest burglar, seize 2 gold chains
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Coimbatore: The Sulur police arrested a burglar on Tuesday and seized six sovereigns of gold ornaments from him. The burglar spilled the beans about burglaries when he was arrested in another case.

Police said K Anandakumar, 30, of Vettaikaranpudur near Pollachi, stole an omni van on January 21. Based on a complaint from owner A Palanisamy, 60, of Pallapalayam, the police registered a case and formed a special team.

On Tuesday, the team arrested Anandakumar and seized the van. While questioning, police said Anandakumar admitted to burgling two houses. “Between January 7 night and January 8 morning, Anandakumar broke open into a house at Peedampalli and made away with three sovereigns of gold chain when inmates W Chandra, a tailor, and his family members were not there. Again on January 9, he looted another three sovereigns of gold chain and Rs 7,000 from a house at Sulur,” a police officer said. Police later retrieved the ornaments from him.

The accused was remanded in judicial custody after he was produced before the judicial magistrate court, Sulur, on Tuesday evening. tnn

Title: Gujarat: Four cops suspended for facilitating loot accused in custody
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: Four cops including a sub-inspector and three constables were suspended on Tuesday for negligence and providing an accused in their custody facilities that they are not entitled for.

Sub Inspector B B Rana and constables Upendrasinh Vaghela, Mayursinh Parmar and Yashpalsinh Zala; were suspended following a probe by ACP Pramod Behora who found them guilty of facilitating a loot accused while he was being brought to the court for a hearing on Monday.

The probe into the conduct of the cops was ordered after they entered into an altercation with a group of lawyers at the Rajkot sessions court compound over parking on Monday afternoon.

The vehicle in which the cops had brought the loot accused was a private car belonging to one of the policemen. Further it also had no registration number.

While parking near the court premises, the cops’ car rammed into a parked car of a lawyer. Soon the cops and a group of lawyers entered into a heated altercation. Though no police complaint was filed by either of the parties, lawyer Tushar Gokani whose vehicle suffered a scratch by the cop’s car, registered his grievance with the city police commissioner.

Following this CP Manoj Agarwal ordered a probe into the incident and asked Behora to file a report on Tuesday. Behora found that the cops had used a private car instead of a government vehicle to transport the loot accused from the central jail to the court and back. This transportation is prvate vehicle goes against the rules. The cops were found guilty of negligence and facilitating an accused in custody.

Title: Anti-CAA clashes: UP court grants bail to 48 booked by cops for attempt to murder
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Bijnor: A local court on Tuesday granted bail to 48 people, who were booked under several stringent sections of IPC including that of 307 (attempt to murder) after the December 20 anti-CAA clashes in Bijnor’s Nagina area. Additional district and sessions judge gave the bail to the 48 accused after hearing both the sides.

During the course of the hearing, lawyer of the accused, Mohammad Arif Khan, claimed that all the cases registered against the accused will not stand judicial scrutiny as police slapped section 307 of Indian Penal Code (IPC) without even recovering any arm from them.

“After the protests, 79 people were arrested and sent to jail in Nagina area alone. Additional district and sessions judge Sanjeev Pandey gave bail to 48 of them on Tuesday. No fire arm was recovered, but police had slapped IPC’s section 307 on them,” Khan said.

Meanwhile, the Allahabad high court has granted anticipatory bail to former chairman of Bijnor municipality Javed Aftab, who is also one of the accused in the anti-CAA clashes. Police had announced a reward of Rs 25,000 on him.

The anti-CAA clashes took place in Bijnor city and its several areas including Nagina, Nahtaur, Najibabad, Jalalabad, Chandpur, and Sherkot. Police had registered 34 cases against 3,900 protestors in the district. Of them, 149 protesters were arrested and sent to jail. Maximum 79 were from Nagina. Seven persons were released on bail earlier.

The protesters were booked under various sections of IPC, including sections 147 (punishment for rioting), 148 (rioting, armed with deadly weapon), 149 (every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 353 (assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty), 336 (act endangering life or personal safety of others), 427 (mischief causing damage), 436 (mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy house, etc), 307 (attempt to murder), 188 (disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant), and 120-B (criminal conspiracy). Two persons were also killed in firing in Nahtaur.

Title: Former BJP MLA takes on Congress legislator
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Hubballi: Former MLA Veerabhadrappa Halaharavi has charged Congress MLA Prasad Abbayya with misleading Dalits about CAA in the city for political gains.

Taking on Abbayya at a press meet here on Monday, Halaharavi said despite the fact that there will be no harm to people of any religion because of CAA, he said the former is unnecessarily dragging Dalits into the matter and staging protest to condemn CAA, which is condemnable. “There is nothing wrong in CAA. Just for political gains, protests by Dalits were organised. Innocent Dalits have been misled,” he alleged.

He also appealed to minorities, mainly Muslims , and others not to believe the allegations made by the opposition parties against CAA. “Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union home minister Amit Shah and others have made it clear that no Indian, irrespective of their caste and religions, will get affected from the act,” he said, adding: “The MLA has a lot of work to do — there are several works, pending since decades, hanging fire. Let the MLA to concentrate on development works, instead of playing politics on caste and religion for votes,” the former MLA said.

He also made it clear that BJP’s Dalit Morcha will not try to stop the protests, but it will conduct a door-to-door campaign at Dalit colonies to create awareness about CAA in the coming days.

Laxman Bilagi of state BJP Dalit Morcha said Muslims are gradually showing less interest towards such protests, “as they realized the truth about CAA”. “Just to play politics, Congress and other party leaders are dragging Dalits into protests,” he alleged.

Chandrasekhar Gokak, defeated MLA candidate from Hubballi (east) constituency, appealed to people not to trust and not to join anti-CAA protests. “Many opposition leaders are playing politics without knowing about the acts,” he alleged.

Mahendra Koutal, Hanumantappa Doddamani, Basavaraj Amminbhavi, and others were present at the press conference.

Dharna enters eighth day

The sit-in dhana, being staged by Anjuman-e-Islam at Mini Vidhan Soudha here, entered eighth day on Monday. Residents of Altaf Nagar, NA Nagar, Ishwar Nagar, Jannath Nagar, and members of Badi Masjid and Hyderia Shopping Complex Pendare Sunni Jamat Hubli took part in the dharna.

Former corporator Altaf Kittur said these acts, being anti-minorities and anti-Dalits, divide people on caste and religion. “India has been a country known for communal harmony. So the central government should withdraw these acts to retain secularism in the country,” he said.

The protesters warned of intensifying the dharna if the government neglects their protests.

Title: School’s walls defaced with slogans against Modi, Shah
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

The walls were spray painted in the wee hours on Tuesday

Vadodara: A month after walls of Police Bhavan, MS University’s (MSU) union pavilion and other places in the city were vandalized with slogans against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), some miscreants defaced walls of a school in Gadapura with slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union home minister Amit Shah and BJP.

According to police, some persons wrote slogans using spray paint in the wee hours of Tuesday. In the previous incidents too, spray paint was used to write slogans against CAA, National Register of Citizens (NRC) and BJP. On learning about the incident, some BJP supporters who claimed to be members of Amit Shah Fan Club repainted the wall and informed Gotri police.

“The incident could have taken place between 1am and 5am and two to three persons are suspected to have been involved. The footages of CCTV camera, however, have not revealed much as the area was dark,” said inspector A B Gohil of Gotri police station. He added that a non-cognizable offence has been registered against unidentified persons and investigation is underway to find the miscreants. The school’s management has also shared its own CCTV cameras’ footages with the cops.

Title: Cops to hold gram sabhas on Pocso Act
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Tirupati: In view of the rising atrocities against children, the Tirupati police department has decided to spread awareness about Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act in rural areas by conducting gram sabhas.

The decision was taken at a review meet on Mahila Mitra in the Tirupati Urban police district on Tuesday. Speaking at the meet, additional AP (admin) Anil Babu hailed the Disha Act as path-breaking and maintained that such cases should be dealt with on a priority basis.

On the change in perspective required in the department while dealing with such sensitive cases, Women’s Initiatives (WINS) secretary R Meera appealed to the cops to break the stereotype and initiate action against the culprit, instead of trivialising criminal action and victimising the victim.

In many cases, the victim’s attire and social behaviour are scrutinised, instead of questioning the offender. “Uncontrollable anger or sexuality is attributed to men and police tend to think that women enjoy being subjugated. This is where we need a course correction”, she pointed out.

Taking note, Babu instructed the Mahila Mitras to reach out to survivors to settle the issue rather than dragging it on. Apart from assuring tighter vigilance on women-related issues, he directed the officials concerned to fast-track such cases to bring the culprits to book within 21 days.

Title: Surat cop booked for domestic violence
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Vadodara: A head constable posted at Sachin police station in Surat city has been booked at Mahila police station here for domestic violence, assault, criminal intimidation and breach of trust.

Rajesh alias Tukaram Thakur’s wife Priti had registered a complaint on Monday after learning about her husband’s alleged extra-marital affair with a colleague and a son born out of the illicit relationship.

Priti, who has been living with her mother at Gotri since October last year, told police that she left her husband when he threatened to kill her. Priti had confronted Thakur about the son born out of his relationship with his colleague Sarvada Chaudhary, after she found a birth certificate from the house. The birth certificate had Thakur’s name as father and Chaudhary’s name as mother.

Priti’s complaint stated that in 2010 she had learnt about Thakur and Chaudhary’s extra marital affair. She had submitted a complaint to then Surat city police commissioner following which Thakur and Chaudhary were posted in different police stations.

Later the elders of the couple’s family met and a settlement was reached wherein Thakur promised that he will improve his behaviour and not indulge in extra-marital affair.

The complaint also stated that a few months after reaching a settlement, Priti began living with Thakur, But was subjected to domestic violence.

Title: Puducherry legislative assembly to convene on February 12
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

CM V Narayanasami

PUDUCHERRY: The legislative assembly of Puducherry will re-assemble at 9.30am on February 12, said secretary A Vincent Rayar . The House convenes in the backdrop of several issues faced by the government including ongoing stand-off between council of ministers headed by chief minister V Narayanasamy and lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi, suspension of MLA N Danavelu from the Congress after he accused the CM and his son and health minister Malladi Krishna Rao of corruption and a controversial proposal to establish casinos and breweries to generate revenue among others.

Opposition parties have demanded the ruling Congress party to prove its majority in House after Danavelu raised a banner of revolt against the government.

In the 30-member assembly, Congress has 14 seats after the suspension of Danavelu from the party. Congress' ally DMK has three seats. An independent candidate extended support to Congress. On the opposition side, All India NR Congress has seven seats and AIADMK four. Three men from BJP were nominated as the members of the legislative assembly.

Title: Nashik to be included in the second phase of DMIC
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nashik: Nashik city will be included in the second phase of the Delhi Mumbai Industrial Corridor (DMIC), P Anbagalan, CEO of Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation (MIDC), said.

The agency has already identified lands in Sinnar and Ghoti areas of the district for the same. Moreover, MIDC has also proposed developing of electric and engineering zones in the district under DMIC.

An information to this effect was issued by MIDC CEO P Anbagalan during a meeting with industries held in the city recently.

“Earlier, Nashik was not included in the first phase of the DMIC project because of the water reservation issue. But, the district is to be included in the second phase of the project that is expected to begin shortly,” P Anbagalan said.

“Some parts of districts such as Ghoti and Sinnar are to be included in the second phase of DMIC. The electric and engineering industries require very less quantum of water. Considering the water issue, we are planning to develop electric and engineering zone under the DMIC project,” said Anbagalan.

Nashik was not included in the first phase of the DMIC due to false reports by the water resources department of the state government about non-availability of water even though Nashik had large number of dams. Aurangabad, which gets water from Nashik, was included in the first phase of DMIC. Therefore, the industry bodies now want Nashik to be included at least in the second phase of DMIC.

MIDC has already selected over 2,000 hectares in Sinnar near Nashik for industries and it is in the process of land acquisition for the same. It is also looking for more land in Sinnar for the DMIC project.

“Industrial areas that would get developed under DMIC project will require adequate water. We will require at least 24 million litres daily (MLD) water for industries under the DMIC project. Hence, we need to do planning for availability of water. We are already in talks with the water resources department for availability of water for DMIC project,” sources from MIDC said.

The DMIC project seeks to create a strong economic base with a globally competitive environment and state-of-the-art infrastructure to activate local commerce, enhance investments and attain sustainable development.

The project aspires to double employment potential, triple industrial output and quadruple exports from the region in the next couple of years.

Title: ‘CAA, Article 370 internal matters of India’
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Coimbatore: Consul general of Israel to South India Dana Kursh said every nation should support the sovereignty of other nations when it comes to defending its citizens.

Kursh was in the city to participate as a chief guest at an Indo-Israel joint conference on ‘Sustainable Cities’ at Kumaraguru College of Technology (KCT) on Tuesday. The conference was jointly organized by KCT and PSG college of Technology. Fifteen professors from the Israeli Agriculture Research Organization and Tel Avivi University participated in the conference.

Speaking at the conference, Kursh said, “India has been supporting Israel in different situations that are crucial to the security of the country. Recently, the Israeli prime minister thanked his Indian counterpart for standing with us and the partnership is going to be same during the present situation.”

When asked about Israel’s stand on Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and revocation of Article 370, Kursh said, “Every nation should support the sovereignty of other nations especially when it comes to defending its citizens. These are internal matters of India, which come within the sovereignty of the nation.”

She said, “India has its own national interest and there are things that India would not support us. But we know where we can unite, and we understand when we have different agendas and interests. We do return the respect.”

Commenting about the European Union (EU) parliament’s decision to pass a resolution against India, she said that EU had passed several resolutions against Israel as well. Both Israel and India are facing similar issues, she added.

Title: One dead, 9 injured in a pile up on Delhi-Pauri highway in Muzaffarnagar
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Muzaffarnagar: A pile-up of four vehicles on Delhi-Pauri state highway (119) near Muzaafarnagar district on Tuesday morning claimed a life and left nine others severely injured.

According to police, the pile-up happened Ramraj area after a truck rammed into a car due to heavy fog.

The area police and emergency services rushed to the spot and sent all the injured to a nearby hospital.

Police said the accident was so severe that a crane was called in to separate the mangled vehicles and gas cutter was used to rescue the injured.

The deceased has been identified as 25-year-old Raja, a resident of village Ramraj in Muzaffarnagar. The doctors said the Raja died minutes after reaching the hospital. Meanwhile, All the injured are being treated in separate hospitals in the district.

Station house officer of Ramraj police station, Rajendra Giri said, “ A truck rammed into a car which caused the pile-up of the vehicles. An investigation is on and a case against the truck driver has also been registered. Appropriate action will be taken .”

It should be noted that in December 2019, a similar accident took place in Muzaffarnagar-Haridwar section of NH-58 near Mansoorpur area in which one person died and several others sustained injuries. The police said the accident took place due to dense fog.

Title: Kidnapped girl child rescued, 1 detained
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Tirupur: A 19-year-old woman was detained on Tuesday for kidnapping a three-year-old girl from Palladam taluk last Friday (January 24).

While police have rescued the girl, it is not known whether she was handed over to her father or grandfather, with whom she was staying.

According to a police officer attached to Palladam police station, the woman, identified as Anitha, of Omalur in Salem district, was caught in Erode. “After kidnapping the child, she went to Velankanni shrine in Nagapattinam district. On Tuesday, she came to Erode bus terminus with the child. Police there subsequently took her into custody and alerted us.”

Preliminary inquiry revealed that the woman was deserted by her husband. “She used to roam around many places. The girl’s grandfather found her in Palani on last Thursday when he went to the Dhandayuthapani Swamy temple and took her home for availing sexual services,” the officer said.

According to her, the officer said, the girl’s grandfather told her that he and his son were struggling to raise the girl child since her mother left her. “So, she decided to raise the child and took her away when he fell asleep on January 25,” the officer said.

The Palladam police had earlier registered a kidnapping case against the woman and formed three special teams to nab her based on a complaint lodged by the girl’s father and grandfather.

“We had distributed notices with the details of missing child to police stations across the state. Erode police spotted the accused with the child and caught them. They were then handed over to us. The woman is likely to be arrested on Wednesday,” the officer said.

Title: Energy startup gets funding
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Coimbatore: Native Angel Network, an investor in native startups, has invested in a Bengaluru-based renewable energy startup, Carbon Masters.

Native Angel Network, an arm of Madurai-based Nativelead Foundation, had last year invested Rs 65lakh in a city-based startup, ‘VilFresh’, which supplies packaged fresh milk within three hours of procurement.

Carbon Masters, which has managed to get funding of Rs 1.67crore, also received investments from Indian Angel Network and VC Sangam Ventures. The company has developed a bottled bio CNG (compressed natural gas) brand ‘Carbonlites’. “It is made by converting food and agri wastes into clean renewable energy that can displace LPG for commercial cooking in restaurants and hotels,” said a release.

The company currently has a presence in Karnataka and Madhya Pradesh, the release said. “The next phase will see Carbon Masters take its energy and organic manure solutions to Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu.” tnn

Title: Temple cleaned ahead of Radhasapthami fest
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Tirupati: The Koil Alwar Thirumanjanam, temple cleansing ritual, was held ahead of the annual Radhasapthami festival at Sri Padmavathi Ammavari temple at Tiruchanoor on Tuesday.
