The Koil Alwar Thirumanjanam is held four times a year — the preceding Tuesday ahead of Ugadi, Vaikunta Ekadasi, annual Brahmotsavams and Ani Vara Asthanam — at the Tiruchanoor temple.

In connection with the cleansing ritual, the main idol of the presiding deity, other processional deities and sub-deities were provided with a water-proof cover. Later a herbal paste comprising sandalwood powder, refined camphor, turmeric, flowers and other herbal ingredients were applied to all the walls and pillars inside the sanctum as wells as the sub-shrines inside the main temple complex. Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams officials and priests took part in the temple cleansing ritual.

Title: Man rapes minor niece for three years in Kutch, held
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

Title: After flu outbreak, culling of birds start in OUAT farm
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The state government on Tuesday ordered culling of birds in the poultry farm of the Odisha University of Agriculture and Technology (OUAT) in Siripur and within one km radius of the infected area.

The moves comes a day after Bhopal-based National Institute of High Security Animal Diseases (NIHSAD) confirmed the H5N1 — the avian influenza virus — in the samples of dead birds from the poultry farm at College of Veterinary Science and Animal Husbandry under the OUAT on Monday.

Ratnakar Rout, director of the animal husbandry department, said altogether 922 birds, 4,631 eggs, 2,357 kg of poultry feed and other materials were disposed of by deep burial method. “We culled 922 birds inside the OUAT poultry farm using deep burial method. We had engaged seven rapid response teams (RRT),” he added.

The teams used lime and bleaching powder to disinfect and check further contamination, Rout said, adding that culling would continue on Wednesday.

The area within one-km radius of the OUAT poultry farm has been declared as the infected zone and area between one to 10 km zone declared as surveillance zone.

This apart, the RRT inspected private poultry within 1 km of the farm and culled 11 broiler chicks, 45 layer chicks, 859 layer adults and seven ducks. “Each owner has been given a compensation of Rs 20 per broiler chick, Rs 70 per broiler adult, Rs 20 per layer chicks and Rs 35 per duck,” Rout added.

The state has not provided any compensation for the birds at the OUAT farm because it is a government set-up.

Officials said the RRTs would inspect up to 10 km radius of the OUAT farm for possible H5N1 cases in birds from Wednesday

Prior to sending the samples, 1,500 birds died of the infection. “We have asked the OUAT to seal the poultry farm for now. We have appealed to the people not to panic,” a government official said.

Meanwhile, Nandankanan Zoo has temporarily closed the bird aviary of the zoo to prevent visitors from getting exposed to birds. “This is just a precautionary measure,” a zoo official said.

Title: After suspension blow, capital dream ray of hope for boat tourism sector
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Visakhapatnam: If Visakhapatnam were to indeed become the executive capital , it will come as a boon for the boat tourism industry, say sources linked to the sector .

Currently, the city has only three boats and two scooter boats. Those in the business hope for the number to go up, to around 10, if the city is officially declared the executive capital of Andhra Pradesh.

Discussing the significance of the sector, TG Prasada Reddy, the Visakhapatnam divisional manager of Andhra Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation (ATDC) said that boat tourism is one of the major revenue generators for the corporation.

Boating operations were suspended across the state since September 15, 2019, when a tourist boat— Royal Vasistha capsized in River Godavari. The operations resumed recently after new safety rules were introduced.

Prasad Reddy informed TOI that APTDCL incurred a loss of Rs 70 lakh in the five months in which boating operations remained suspended.

Under the new rules, every boat has to undergo a fitness test as well as a swamp test. Additionally, the new rules also call for training of all crew members and especially drivers at the National Institute of Water Sports (NIWS).

“Drivers of APTDC boats have received training at NIWS. The government has resumed boating operations of only those boats operated by the tourism corporation. It is yet to give permissions to private boat operators,” Prasad Reddy added.

Tourists too were reportedly miffed at the boating operations as boating at sea is one of the significant aspects of tourism itinerary.

“We earn an average of Rs 40,000 per day in the off season and Rs 1 lakh in the peak season. The next peak season begins in April,” the divisional manager informed.

Title: Duo dupes woman with partial paralysis
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Vadodara: The Raopura police have booked two persons including a doctor for duping a woman who is suffering from partial paralysis. Prashant Tailor, a resident of Kothi Crossroads, told the police that the accused duo took Rs 2 lakh from him for treating his sister Meeta.

According to the police, one of the accused identified as Raju had approached Meeta in October last year. Raju told her that he knows a doctor who can cure her of her paralysis. He claimed that he had paralysis and Dr Rehman Malik, who stays in Thane in Maharashtra, had cured him.

Meeta returned home and told Prashant about it. Prashant then called Raju who made the same claims to him before giving him mobile number of Malik. Prashant called up Malik who said that he will pay visit to his home to see Meeta. On October 28, 2019, Malik visited Meeta at her home and took out some blood drops. The accused then claimed that he can cure her. Malik demanded Rs 2.37 lakh for the treatment but later settled for Rs 2 lakh. Prashant gave him Rs 37,000 in cash and a cheque of Rs 1.15 lakh. Malik told him that he will send receipt and his visiting card later. But Malik never turned up for treatment and didn’t even call back. Prashant told the police that he kept calling Malik but the latter did not answer his calls and later blocked him.

Title: GUDA’s amit further hiked
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kakinada: Four urban local bodies and 236 villages in 24 mandals of East Godavari district in set to be merged in Godavari Urban Development Authority ( GUDA ), as per a government order issued on Tuesday.

Earlier in 2017, the government had constituted GUDA with headquarters in Kakinada that included 280 villages in 26 mandals of East Godavari district, spread in an extent of 2,183.02 sqkms.

Later, another GO was issued on December 12, 2018, according to which two urban local bodies — Tuni and Ramachandrapuram municipalities — and 75 villages were merged in Guda.

As per GO issued on January 28, four urban local bodies — Amalapuram, Mandapeta, Mummidivaram and Yeleswaram municipalities/nagarpanchayats and 236 villages were further brought under Guda. tnn

Title: STF seizes brown sugar worth Rs 30L, nabs 2
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Bhubaneswar: Continuing its crackdown on drug traffickers, the special task force (STF) of state crime branch on Tuesday arrested two persons and seized brown sugar worth nearly Rs 30 lakh.

The accused were identified as Sheikh Haider, 21, and Tanmay Bhuyan, 20, both residents of Balasore district. A sub-inspector (SI) was injured after he was allegedly assaulted by the accused during the arrest.

Crime branch’s additional director general Soumendra Priyadarshi termed the drug haul significant and said the STF had received specific inputs about the narcotics trade and raided a place near NH-16 in Balasore.

“Our personnel arrested the two persons, seized nearly 301 grams of brown sugar, Rs 2.22 lakh, three mobile phones, bank debit cards and other incriminating articles. Efforts are on to bust their illicit business network,” Priyadarshi said.

STF’s deputy inspector general Jay Narayan Pankaj said 19 drug peddlers had been arrested from different parts of the state in the past 20 days.

“Our force has been turning the heat on narcotics traders. Brown sugar weighing nearly 818 grams with market value of Rs 81 lakh was seized in different raids in the past 20 days. Nineteen people have been arrested so far from different places like Puri, Bhubaneswar, Balasore, Khurda, Angul, Pipili, Dhenkanal and Bhadrak,” Pankaj said.

An STF source said Balasore had earned the notoriety of being the safe haven of drug peddlers as most arrests were made in the district. An official said smugglers from neighbouring West Bengal normally supplied brown sugar to their associates in Balasore.

“We are in touch with West Bengal Police to trace the origins of the narcotics,” another STF officer said.

Taking its cue from STF, commissionerate police also recently launched a crackdown on drug traders. It arrested 105 drug peddlers between September 2019 and January 2020 (so far) and seized 1,302 grams of brown sugar worth nearly Rs 1.5 crore, said a police officer.

Title: Five-day yoga by Baba Ramdev in Hubballi
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Yoga guru Baba Ramdev

HUBBALLI: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev will conduct a five-day yoga camp from January 30. The camp, to be organised by Patanjali Yogpeeth (Haridwar), will be held Railway Sports Grounds from 5am to 7.30pm. Anyone aged 8 and above can attend the camp.

Sharing details on the preparation for the camp, Karnataka Patanjali Yoga Samiti state in-charge Bhavarlal Arya said this is the second edition of Ramdev’s yoga camp in the city. The first one was held in 2007, and at the same venue.

Over 500 volunteers have been trained in yoga to conduct the camp smoothly. Over 15,000 of yoga enthusiasts are expected to take part in it. The aim of the camp is to take yoga to every household and ensure a healthy lifestyle among people. Patanjali Yoga Samiti has conducted 160 yoga training camps in the twin cities in the last two months.

Arya said that preparations are going on a war footing for the camp, and arrangements for vehicle parking will be made.

A special camp will be organised at 4pm on February 3, the last day of the camp, for schoolchildren and women. Ramdev will interact with them on the occasion, he added.

Title: Sunitha moves HC against SIT probe into Viveka murder
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Vivekananda

Vijayawada: In a fresh twist in the mysterious murder of ex-MP YS Vivekananda Reddy, his daughter Dr Sunitha Narreddy on Tuesday petitioned the AP high court questioning the SIT probe as well as raising doubts on the conduct of several persons, including her cousin and CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy. While she pressed for a CBI probe as sought by Jagan himself earlier, the AP government said that it was not required now as the SIT probe was at an advanced stage.

“The present CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy, who is none other than my cousin, had sought investigation by an independent agency like the CBI through his writ petition as well as through public demands and a representation to the governor... clearly expressing his lack of confidence in the state police. It has been eight months since he became CM but he has not made any request for a CBI probe. Moreover, there is absolutely no valid reason or justification for constitution/reconstitution of the second SIT,” she said.

Sunitha also raised doubts over the dilution of the SIT, which was originally headed by an additional director-general (ADG) of police but is now supervised by the district superintendent of police. She sought to know the reasons for changing the members of SIT and Abhishek Mohanty, who headed the SIT, going on long leave.

Finding fault with the SIT for not including all the persons registered for erasing evidence from the crime scene, Sunitha said YS Avinash Reddy, MP, YS Prakash Reddy, YS Manohar Reddy, YS Pratap Reddy, Dr YS Abhishek Reddy, D Shivashankar Reddy, Uday Kumar Reddy, Dr Nayak, Prakash Reddy, Dr Madhusudhan Reddy, Narreddy Jagadeeswar Reddy, Yerra Gangi Reddy, YS Joseph Reddy, Ramakrishna Reddy, YS Madhusudhan Reddy, Shankaraiah, Ramakrishna Reddy and Srinivas Reddy were all present at the time of cleaning the bloodstains and wrapping the wounds with bandages. She also named Inayatullah, Ranganna, Lakshmamma, EC Surendra Reddy, Prakash and MV Krishna Reddy.

Sunitha also alleged that the suicide of K Srinivas Reddy, brother-in-law of Parameswar Reddy, on September 2, 2019, was in fact a murder as the post-mortem report stated that blood was found in hepatorenal pouch. Sunitha, who is a doctor, said that the blood in the pouch could be of some internal or external injury. This gave enough room to suspect that he was murdered by forcibly administering poison and the murder was staged as suicide, she claimed.

Referring to Rangaiah, the watchman present on the fateful night, she expressed doubts as to how he did not hear any noise as evidently her father had tried hard to resist the killers.

She said that Uday Kumar Reddy and Madhusudhan Reddy were first taken into custody on the instructions of then SIT chief Abhishek Mohanty but were were let off after several calls were made before they reached Kadapa. After that incident, Mohanty went on long leave and his exit from the investigation speaks volumes, she said.

Pressing her case for a CBI inquiry, she told the high court that the SIT was nowhere close to cracking the case despite 10 months and sequence of events suggested that leaders from both ruling and opposition parties were not willing to reveal the names of real culprits.

When the HC questioned the government pleader why the case can’t be handed over to CBI as both sides were asking for the same, he said that SIT investigation was at an advanced stage and hence a CBI inquiry was not necessary. The HC posted the matter to February 6 after government’s counsel sought additional time as the advocate general was not available and two more counters were yet to be filed in the case.

Title: NMC firm on city bus service launch
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

CLEARED SKHER

Nashik: The Nashik Municipal Corporation ( NMC ) is set to roll out the city bus service despite reservations regarding the financial burden it might put on the civic body.

The city mayor had meeting with the group leaders of all parties in NMC to discuss the issue and inform them about the present status of the city bus service project. The mayor clearly told them that despite the reservations, the NMC is going ahead with the project.

“We have decided to go ahead with our plan to roll out the city bus service project by April end this year. District guardian minister Chhagan Bhujbal has also told us that he is not against the bus service project,” said mayor Satish Kulkarni.

Kulkarni added that the project was at an advanced stage and it would not be possible to roll it back now. “The agreements have been signed with contractors and NMC will have to compensate 80% of the total project cost if we cancel the project,” he said.

The opposition parties — Shiv Sena, NCP and Congress — have demanded a white paper on the city bus service project. The leader of the opposition in NMC, Ajay Boraste of Shiv Sena, opposed the city bus service project.

“Not a single public transport project in the world is in profit. The city bus service project will incur heavy losses. We want the civic body to release white paper on the revenue NMC will earn and losses it will incur, if at all, through this project,” Boraste said.

NCP group leader Gajanan Shelar alleged that the group leaders were not informed about the agenda of the meeting on Tuesday. The mayor also did not take any suggestions from the group leaders and was adamant on rolling out the city bus service, he said. Congress group leader Shahu Khaire also reiterated the same.

“We were informed that NMC will incur Rs 54 crore loss per annum due to city bus service project. In fact, NMC may incur losses over Rs 120 crore per annum due to the project. The mayor and the BJP will be responsible for the losses,” said Shelar.

NMC plans to operate 150 electric, 200 CNG and 50 diesel buses for city transport. The contractors will purchase, operate and maintain the buses for a period of 10 years and the NMC will pay them on kilometre basis.

During a meeting at Mumbai, Bhujbal had cautioned that the project could put huge financial burden on NMC. He had also told the mayor to conduct a meeting with all the party group leaders to discuss the future of the bus service project.

Title: Disturbed Areas Act: Gujarat high court notice over deal cancellation
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court on Tuesday issued notice to the state government over a petition complaining that the state authorities cancelled the registration of a property under the Disturbed Areas Act, though the property does not fall in the area notified under the law.

The Gujarat Prohibition of Transfer of Immovable Property and Provision of Tenants from Evication from Premises in Disturbed Areas Act (The Disturbed Areas Act) prohibits the sale and purchase of any property falling in an area notified under this law, without permission from the district collectorate.

The case in question pertains to the Danilimda area of Ahmedabad, and the petitioner is Nazir Ahmed Diwan, a tailor, living in Vatva. He had bought a 12-square-metre shop in Danilimda in January 2011 from two brothers, Badruddin Munshi and Rashiduddin Munshi. He got the sale deed registered on March 28, 2011.

Later, a resident of Shah-e-Alam, Mohammed Siddik Shaikh complained before the deputy collector (East) that the registration of the property bought by Diwan was illegal because he had not obtained the mandatory permission from the authority under Section 5(1) of the Disturbed Areas Act before the purchase. The deputy collector straightaway cancelled the registration and held the transfer of property null and void. Diwan has been using the shop since 2011.

On cancellation of the registration of property in his name, Diwan filed an appeal before the secretary against the deputy collector’s decision. He claimed that the property does not fall under the area notified under the Disturbed Areas Act. The secretary rejected his appeal on December 6, 2017.

Diwan moved the HC last month and argued that the notification issued earmarking the disturbed area was not properly appreciated by the authorities. He asserted that the property does not fall in the area. Diwan also told the HC that he had later filed a criminal case against the officials, who registered the transfer of the property after telling him that the property does not fall in a disturbed area. He urged the HC to quash the secretary’s order and regularize the registration of the sale deed.

The high court will hear this case further on February 18.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Edappadi K Palaniswami slaps two defamation complaints on MK Stalin
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami

CHENNAI: Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami has slapped two criminal defamation complaints on opposition leader and DMK president M K Stalin for his alleged defamatory statements against him.

Moving the complaints on behalf of the CM before the principal sessions court here, city public prosecutor (CPP) Gowri Ashokan wanted the judge to initiate proceedings for criminal defamation against Stalin.

According to the complaints, Stalin had questioned the decision of the Union government in declaring Tamil Nadu the leading state in the good governance index. Stalin said the fact that the BJP government at the Centre wants to prop up the AIADMK government with such ranking shows their close relations and raises suspicion that their relationship is beyond just being alliance partners, the CPP said. The opposition leader questioned the rationale of the decision when there were issues like the Pollachi rape cases, killing of protesters during the Sterlite protests and the state ranking second in the rape of minors. The statement was published in DMK’s ‘Murasoli’ on January 28, she added. In the second complaint, the CPP alleged that in another statement Stalin condemned the government for arresting six people who indulged in Kolam protest against Citizenship Amendment Act in Chennai. The alleged defamatory statement was published in ‘Murasoli’ on December 30.

Since the statements were highly defamatory and not made in good faith, the same constitutes criminal defamation under Sections 499 and 500 of IPC, the prosecutor said.

Title: Rescue my friends, appeals VV Nagar girl
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Vadodara/ Anand: A girl from Vallabh Vidyanagar town of Anand district who has safely returned back to her home from China’s Wuhan city has appealed government to ensure safe return of all the Indian students who are stuck in China.

Wuhan city has got quarantined with all routes in and out of the city closed down or highly regulated due to the outbreak of the coronavirus.

“I had returned to India on January 13 before the outbreak of coronavirus became international news and drew global attention. But my friends along with other students from India are still stuck there,” said Zeel Patel, a first year student of MBBS at University of Chinese Medicine at Wuhan.

Zeel said that before the outbreak of the deadly virus caught global attention, the Chinese government had taken enough precautions as everybody was asked to wear masks. “But unlike me, my friends who have not been able to return to their homes are facing lot of problems,” she said.

“Some of my friends are not getting enough drinking water and others are facing problems of food stock. Our government should ensure that they return to India as early as possible,” said Zeel, who had to undergo medical check-up both at New Delhi and Anand before she met her family members in Anand.

Title: RI, VAO issued show cause notice
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Tirupur: Days after an audio clip of a revenue inspector threatening a village administrative officer to release the trucks laden with gravel that the latter impounded went viral on social media, the district administration on Tuesday issued show cause notices to both the officials seeking explanation for their actions within 15 days.

On Monday, sub collector S Kavitha held inquiry with Kattur village administrative officer Karthikeyan and Pongalur revenue inspector Eswari in this regard.

According to an official source, Karthikeyan had on last Friday (January 24) caught three trucks laden with gravel. “Eswari called him up the same day. Pointing out that the vehicles were being operated as its owner was seeing (bribing) officials from the rank of tahsildar to collector, she told him that it was better to release them immediately.”

Karthikeyan recorded the conversation and circulated it on social media. He was issued the notice, seeking explanation for circulating the audio clip on social media instead of complaining against the revenue inspector. tnn

Title: Vivekananda Reddy murder: Daughter questions SIT probe, spells trouble for Jagan
Content:
Vivekananda

Srinivas Reddy’s suicide was murder: Viveka’s daughter

VIJAYAWADA: In a fresh twist in the mysterious murder of ex-MP YS Vivekananda Reddy , his daughter Dr Sunitha Narreddy on Tuesday petitioned the AP high court questioning the SIT probe as well as raising doubts on the conduct of several persons, including her cousin and CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy. While she pressed for a CBI probe as sought by Jagan himself earlier, the AP government said that it was not required now as the SIT probe was at an advanced stage.“The present CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy, who is none other than my cousin, had sought investigation by an independent agency like the CBI through his writ petition as well as through public demands and a representation to the governor... clearly expressing his lack of confidence in the state police. It has been eight months since he became CM but he has not made any request for a CBI probe. Moreover, there is absolutely no valid reason or justification for constitution/reconstitution of the second SIT,” she said.Sunitha also raised doubts over the dilution of the SIT, which was originally headed by an additional director-general (ADG) of police but is now supervised by the district superintendent of police. She sought to know the reasons for changing the members of SIT and Abhishek Mohanty, who headed the SIT, going on long leave.Finding fault with the SIT for not including all the persons registered for erasing evidence from the crime scene, Sunitha said YS Avinash Reddy, MP, YS Prakash Reddy, YS Manohar Reddy, YS Pratap Reddy, Dr YS Abhishek Reddy, D Shivashankar Reddy, Uday Kumar Reddy, Dr Nayak, Prakash Reddy, Dr Madhusudhan Reddy, Narreddy Jagadeeswar Reddy, Yerra Gangi Reddy, YS Joseph Reddy, Ramakrishna Reddy, YS Madhusudhan Reddy, Shankaraiah, Ramakrishna Reddy and Srinivas Reddy were all present at the time of cleaning the bloodstains and wrapping the wounds with bandages. She also named Inayatullah, Ranganna, Lakshmamma, EC Surendra Reddy, Prakash and MV Krishna Reddy.Sunitha also alleged that the suicide of K Srinivas Reddy, brother-in-law of Parameswar Reddy, on September 2, 2019, was in fact a murder as the post-mortem report stated that blood was found in hepatorenal pouch. Sunitha, who is a doctor, said that the blood in the pouch could be of some internal or external injury. This gave enough room to suspect that he was murdered by forcibly administering poison and the murder was staged as suicide, she claimed.Referring to Rangaiah, the watchman present on the fateful night, she expressed doubts as to how he did not hear any noise as evidently her father had tried hard to resist the killers.She said that Uday Kumar Reddy and Madhusudhan Reddy were first taken into custody on the instructions of then SIT chief Abhishek Mohanty but were were let off after several calls were made before they reached Kadapa. After that incident, Mohanty went on long leave and his exit from the investigation speaks volumes, she said.Pressing her case for a CBI inquiry, she told the high court that the SIT was nowhere close to cracking the case despite 10 months and sequence of events suggested that leaders from both ruling and opposition parties were not willing to reveal the names of real culprits.When the HC questioned the government pleader why the case can’t be handed over to CBI as both sides were asking for the same, he said that SIT investigation was at an advanced stage and hence a CBI inquiry was not necessary. The HC posted the matter to February 6 after government’s counsel sought additional time as the advocate general was not available and two more counters were yet to be filed in the case.

Title: AMC slaps Rs 2 lakh fine on AES for mosquito breeding sites
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

An AMC team raided the area on Tuesday and found mosquito breeding in the block which houses students of LM Ph... Read More

AHMEDABAD: The AMC has slapped a fine of Rs 2 lakh on the Ahmedabad Education Society (AES) which manages the J Block on the Gujarat University (GU) campus. The fine was issued for mosquito breeding in the area.

An AMC team raided the area on Tuesday and found mosquito breeding in the block which houses students of LM Pharmacy. Some of the students had approached the GU authorities in this connection but the problem persisted.

Kamlesh Patel, a member of the AMC team, said that the solid waste department and the malaria department had issued separate notices to the AES and asked them to resolve the issue and clean the campus within seven days. “We will again inspect the block on Thursday after which the final call will be taken,” he said.

Officials said that the authorities have been warned that if the problem continued, they will seal the hostel block. Students refusing to be quoted said that drainage water has been overflowing, and they had made several requests. “When we failed to get any response from the authorities, the issue was raised before the media,” said a student.

AES authorities, when contacted, said this is a small incident.

Title: Man arrested for morphing former lover’s photographs
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The city police have arrested a 29-year-old man for morphing a 23-year-old woman’s photographs.

The arrested person was identified as R Ruban of Vivekanandar Street at Kothari Layout in Singanallur. “A graduate, he was working as a building contractor. He had befriended the woman seven years ago and took selfies and videos together. He promised to marry her and pestered her for physical intimacy. When the woman refused, he threatened to upload her photographs on social media. He morphed her photographs and sent them to her sister,” a police officer said.

The woman lodged a complaint with the Singanallur police, which registered a case against Ruban under sections 67 A of the Information Technology Act, 2000 and Section 4 of the Tamil Nadu Prohibition of Harassment of Women Act, 1998 on Monday and arrested him.

He was remanded in judicial custody and lodged in the Coimbatore Central Prison .

Title: MPs with poor Parliament performance asked to pull up socks
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Bhubaneswar: Days ahead of the Budget session of Parliament, an assessment carried out by the BJD shows that the performance of its women MPs have not been satisfactory when it comes to proceedings in Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. Some of the BJD MPs have barely participated in proceedings like question hour and important debates or moved private member’s bill, found the party’s performance tracking system for the last Budget session (June-August, 2019).

On Tuesday BJD president and chief minister Naveen Patnaik asked the MPs to improve their performance in the forthcoming Budget session of Parliament. Sources said as many as six Lok Sabha MPs and one Rajya Sabha MP has been asked to improve their performance.

Naveen, who had earlier asked MPs to submit performance report every two months, separately met those whose performance was not up to the mark. “The MPs have also been instructed to work in close coordination with the chief minister’s office,” a party insider said.

Aska MP Pramila Bisoyi, who started her political journey from a very humble background, has 100 per cent attendance in the House. But none of her questions were listed as starred question. The performance tracker said she had spoken only twice during the Budget session while 10 of her questions were listed unstarred.

Similarly, not a single question of Jagatsinghpur MP Rajashree Mallick, a doctor-turned-politician, was listed as starred or unstarred categories while Mallik has participated in only four debates. Mallick has 63 per cent attendance.

Starred questions are the ones for which an oral answer is expected. Unstarred questions are the ones where the reply is in written form.

Despite 75.5 per cent attendance, Keonjhar’s Chandrani Murmu, one of the youngest MPs in the country, did not participate in the question hour of the Budget session. She took part in only five debates. Jajpur MP Sarmistha Sethi and Bhadrak MP Manjulata Mandal were also asked to improve their performance in Parliament.

When contacted, Sethi said there was a general instruction from the chief minister to all the new MPs to improve their performance by actively participating in proceedings. Besides the women leaders, the name of former Union minister and Berhampur MP Chandrasekhar Sahu has been identified for poor attendance.

“As far as my attendance is concerned, I had gone to the US after taking permission from the party president as my daughter was unwell. The chief minister has asked the MPs to actively participate in debates and to raise questions regarding the state’s interest,” Sahu said. Among the Rajya Sabha members, Narendra Swain’s performance has been found unsatisfactory.

Among the MPs with better performance are BJD leader in Lok Sabha Pinaki Mishra, Bhartruhari Mahtab, Achyuta Samanta and Rajya Sabha members Sasmit Patra and Amar Patnaik.

Mishra said the performance of MPs is being directly monitored by the chief minister. “All the members have been given a performance chart. Specific instruction has been given by the chief minister that the MPs and MLAs of the party should work in close coordination for better delivery of services to the people,” Mishra said.

EoM

Title: Police in Moradabad book seven women for staging protest against CAA & NRC
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Bareilly: Moradabad police have filed an FIR against seven women who were staging protests against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) near Moradabad-Aligarh highway here. The women were sitting on protest holding placards and demanding government to take back its decision of implementing CAA.

Police said that they reached the spot on Monday evening and managed to disperse the crowd that had gathered there. They termed the act illegal and filed an FIR under section 143 (whoever is a member of an unlawful assembly) and 188 (Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant).

Speaking to TOI, superintendent of police (SP), Moradabad, Amit Anand said, “Around seven unidentified women had gathered in Rahmatnagar area near Karula culvert and staged a dharna against CAA/NRC. The women agitators were raising slogans against government, demanding rollback of CAA, NRC. A police team reached the spot to talk to the women agitators, but most of them had left the area.”

SP city added, “Despite section 144 of Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) enforced, women had gathered and staged the ‘dharna’ without taking permission from the district administration which is violation of the law.”

Moradabad’s additional superintendent of police (ASP), Deepak Bhuker said, “As soon as a police team reached the spot, the protest was discontinued and women had left. The women who were participating in the agitation are probably the residents of Karula and adjacent areas. As of now, FIR has been lodged at Katghar police station against six to seven unidentified women. A further inquiry into the incident is underway.”

On Saturday, over 100 women had took to streets of Pakka Bag Kheda in Nakhasa area of UP’s Sambhal, and staged protests.

Title: Govt schoolteachers to be trained to use hi-tech classrooms better
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Coimbatore: Over the next two weeks , a total of 3 ,270 teachers who handle Class VI to Class XII at government schools in the district would be trained in information and communication technology (ICT) aspects such as creating videos and presentations using internet to enhance classroom teaching and using QR codes to access online content from Diksha portal.

Samagra Shiksha officials said while teachers were already using these facilities, the training session would encourage them to use it effectively and frequently in classes.

An official said the teachers would be trained in how to crate simple videos and presentations using pictures. “They can make videos based on lessons and screen it to students. They would also be taught to use QR codes and access digital content from online portals such as Diksha.”

Pointing out that around 180 government schools in the district are equipped with hi-tech classrooms, the official said, “The training would enable teachers to use these facilities better. Presently, some teachers are using the hi-tech classrooms frequently. We want all the teachers to do the same efficiently.”

Teachers would also be trained in doing online administrative work such as updating their attendance and that of students, and other details on Education Management Information System, the official said.

The two-day training session would be held for both graduate and postgraduate teachers from all the 15 blocks in the district. The training would be held in a government higher secondary school in each block, the official said.

Title: Gujarat: ‘Government hospitals now compete with private ones on quality’
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: There is a wrong perception that medicines being provided free of cost to patients in government-run hospitals lack quality, said health commissioner Jai Prakash Shivahare. He was speaking at a regional seminar on “Availability, accessibility and affordability of medicines for all”, which was held in Ahmedabad on Tuesday.

Stating that government hospitals are now competing with private hospitals to provide quality healthcare, Shivahare said that Gujarat has the third largest number of drugs on the essential drug list (EDL). The government, through Gujarat Medical Services Corporation Ltd ( GMSCL ) procures medicines from pharmaceutical companies through a bidding process and provides these free of cost to patients of lower socio-economic sections under schemes of the central and state governments.

“Quality of drugs remains a challenge. I think it is more of a perception that drugs available through EDL list lack in quality. We want to change that perception. We are also very keen that all the good companies should also participate in the bidding process. We have some of the best pharmaceutical companies in Gujarat,” Shivahare said.

Stating that the government intended to provide a level playing field to new and established companies, Shivahare stated that there is a need to change the perception that quality drugs cannot be provided to the public health system. “We want to organize a meeting with various stake holders. Why some good companies are not participating in the bidding process that is being run by GMSCL. If they are having any difficulty, we would like to address those issues also. We want the best brands also to compete for supplying to the public health system,” he said.

Principal secretary, health, Jayanti Ravi sought inputs from pharma companies on the issue, saying that their feedback will help the government in making policy changes if required. “We wanted to interact with all of you and see how we can make our process of pricing, the process of bidding, all of this more transparent and allow for good quality. And at the same time, if the volume is huge, we can certainly have a very competitive price as well. We can definitely reconcile quantity and price as well without compromising on quality,” she said.

PMRU opened in Gujarat: The Gujarat unit of Price Monitoring and Resource Unit (PMRU) was inaugurated on Tuesday by National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority (NPPA) chairman Shubra Singh in Ahmedabad. Gujarat has become the tenth state in the country to set up a PMRU. The unit will track violations of prices of essential drugs and medical devices under the Drugs Price Control Order (DPCO).

Title: Mayawati jibe at BJP over Padma to Sami
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Lucknow: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati has now used the occasion of the government conferring the Padma Shri on singer Adnan Sami to question the rationale behind the new citizenship law.

Two days after the prestigious award for Sami was announced, Mayawati said on Tuesday: “When Bharatiya Janata Party can give citizenship and Padma Shri to Pakistani origin singer Adnan Sami, then why cannot it give shelter to Muslims who are being victimised in Pakistan, like it is doing with Hindus, Sikhs, Christians under the CAA. It would be better for the Centre to reconsider this law.”

The BSP chief, who has been a vocal opponent of the Citizenship Amendment Act and NRC, has further appealed to the UP government to take back cases filed against protesters during widespread agitations in the state last month. “The UP government should take back all the fake cases filed against protesters, especially women, who have stood against the CAA and NRC. The government should also provide suitable help to the families of those who died during the protests,” she said.

Title: Gujarat I-T department conducts search and survey on builders, furniture company
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

The I-T department carried out 22 searches and eight surveys at 30 premises belonging to the promoters of A Sh... Read More

AHMEDABAD: A major search and survey operation was carried out by the Gujarat Income Tax (I-T) department on Tuesday where the officials covered three firms associated with real estate development and branded furniture.

According to sources with the I-T department, 22 searches and eight surveys were carried out by the teams on 30 premises belonging to promoters of A Shridhar Group, Suryam Builders and HOF . Of them, 15 were residential and 15 were commercial, said sources. The officials worked till late evening for evidences.

“We cannot disclose the details of seizure of cash and valuables as of now but account details, financial transactions, digital storage devices and deal papers have been recovered from the premises under survey. We are yet to get details on bank lockers and other financial assets held by the firms,” said an official close to the development, adding that if needed the operation will continue on Wednesday.

Sources said that the officials found the tax paid by the firms lower than the expected returns and thus decided to launch probe. They added that the past couple of years’ average income and tax will be compared against the financial records recovered from the spot.

Title: Mobile med units at Pilibhit, Kheri checkposts on Nepal border to screen people for coronavirus
Content: Bareilly: The health department has set up mobile medical units at checkposts in Pilibhit and Lakhimpur Kheri districts to screen people entering India through the Indo-Nepal border for novel coronavirus, that has claimed 106 lives in China alone and is spreading to other nations. According to a Nepal-based daily, one confirmed case and two suspected cases have surfaced in Nepal.Health officials said people entering India are being checked for symptoms of pneumonia, seasonal influenza (flu), bronchitis, disorientation and dizziness. Two isolation wards have been set up at Bareilly district hospital here. Not much is known about the virus but experts say, the main symptoms are fever and in some cases, difficulty in breathing.Though an alert against coronavirus has been sounded across UP, but special attention is on the districts bordering Nepal to prevent coronavirus from spreading in India.Additional director (health), Bareilly division, Dr Rakesh Dubey told TOI, “A mobile medical unit each has been deployed at two checkpoints -- Dhanara Ghat and Naujalia Nakta -- in Pilibhit. Our health staff will check all persons who enter Pilibhit through Nepal. If any person shows suspected symptoms, his or her blood and throat swab samples will be taken.” The sample will be sent to the National Institute of Virology in Pune and further action will be taken on the basis of the report.Both Dhanara Ghat and Naujalia Nakta are situated on the opposite sides of river Sharda.Dubey added, “No case of coronavirus has been detected so far in the country. However, cases of influenza, which is a common viral infection, are being reported in the region.”Additional chief medical officer, Lakhimpur Kheri, Dr Ashwani Kumar said, “We have deployed a team of two members at each of the four checkpoints -- Gauriphanta, Tikuniya, Chandan Chowki and Khajuriya -- in Lakhimpur Kheri district. Each team comprises a medical officer and paramedical staff. Besides, 108 ambulance is stationed at four checkpoints. We are following the format given by supervisors for checking suspected cases. The screening of people crossing the border is done in association with Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB, immigration and Customs departments.”Meanwhile, officials have reserved two isolation wards at district hospital in Bareilly. Chief medical officer, Bareilly, Dr Vineet Shukla, said, “We conducted a meeting with staff at district hospitals, community health centres and primary health centres and informed them about coronavirus. We are on the alert and have proper logistics to deal with it.”According to health department officials, after cluster of pneumonia were reported from Wuhan city of Hubei province in China in December last year, Chinese authorities identified it to be caused by a new type of coronavirus (2019-nCoV). It has infected more than 2,700 people and caused 106 deaths in China.

Title: Common schedule: AMTS wants synergy with BRTS
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

AMTS buses were recently prohibited from using the BRTS corridor, leading to congestion in the mixed traffic l... Read More

AHMEDABAD: The Ahmedabad Municipal Transport Service (AMTS) chairman, Atul Bhavsar, has proposed a common schedule for the AMTS and the Bus Rapid Transit System (BRTS). The aim is to reduce congestion on roads and ensure that ensure that buses of both services are available to commuters at an optimal frequency.

AMTS buses were recently prohibited from using the BRTS corridor, leading to congestion in the mixed traffic lanes. Bhavsar, while presenting his budget for 2020-2021, suggested that a common schedule for both BRT and AMTS be drawn up.

Bhavsar said, “There should be two fares, one for AMTS which has non-air-conditioned buses and the other for the AC buses operated by the BRTS. The BRTS plans add a lot more buses to its fleet, and these will be forced to use the mixed traffic lane. These will eat into passenger traffic of both AMTS and BRTS. To ensure that passengers get proper service, the AMC, the parent organisation of both these services, has to integrate them and ensure that they have a common timetable instead of running parallel to each other.”

Bhavsar said this will ensure better and timely services. Those who want to use AC buses will use them, others will will use non-AC buses.

A senior AMC officer said this was the AMC’s original plan when BRTS was launched. “It was decided that the AMTS would be a feeder service to the BRTS and not run parallel to it. It was also planned to have common tickets for both. But this not implemented and even one decade later, the AMC has not been able to issue common tickets.”

The officer said that the 10 years later, the situation is that both services managed by the AMC are not only making operation losses, but are competing with each other.

Bhavsar said that AMTS is facing operating losses of Rs 99 crore in buses run by private contractors, besides the 130-odd buses AMTS operates itself.

Title: State govt transfers IAS officer, triggers speculation
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Chennai: The Tamil Nadu government on Monday transferred Information Technology secretary Santhosh Babu and posted him as chairman and managing director of Tamil Nadu Handicrafts Development Corporation, a post of which he was holding additional charge since September. Rural Development and Panchayat Raj secretary Hans Raj Varma will now hold additional charge of Information Technology.

Santhosh Babu’s transfer comes in the wake of reports that he had sought voluntary retirement last week and later withdrew it. The transfer assumes significance given the controversial high-cost tender floated by his department in December to provide broadband connectivity to all 12,524 villages. The state government secured the approval of the Centre for the estimated Rs 1,815.31 crore project. Amid reports of ‘pressure’ to favour some bidders, the officer sent a letter to chief secretary K Shanmugam via email last week seeking voluntary retirement and sent another mail two days later, seeking its withdrawal, said a senior official, on condition of anonymity. Santhosh Babu went on leave last week.

Close associates said the senior officer gave shape to Tamil Nadu FibreNet Corporation (Tanfinet), a special purpose vehicle, floated for implementing the Centre’s ambitious BharatNet project to link all 2.5 lakh village panchayats in the country with broadband connectivity. Tanfinet was picked as the agency that will implement the project covering all villages in Tamil Nadu. “He not only worked from the beginning to help implement the project in Tamil Nadu, he also visited New Delhi to attend meetings to get it going,” sources said. The state will soon launch TamilNet to connect all urban local bodies, but without Santhosh Babu to oversee the final roll out. “It is unfortunate that a go-getter like Santhosh was shifted out and additional charge given to rural development secretary, whose hands are already full,” said an official, not willing to be named.

The state government transferred Tanfinet MD M S Shanmugam and posted him as commissioner of museums. D Ravichandran, home, prohibition and excise department deputy secretary, is the new Tanfinet managing director. Hans Raj Varma holds additional charge of special programme implementation department that takes care of welfare schemes. He held additional charge of Sidco (Small Industries Development Corporation) and registration department in 2017 and 2019.

Title: Man booked for atrocity after wife hangs herself
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 41-year-old member of an OBC community, Vinodkumar Mandaliya, was booked by Meghaninagar police on Tuesday on charges of abetment of suicide and under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, after his wife, Priti Vaghela, who came from an SC community, hanged herself at their house in Meghaninagar on Sunday.

According to the complaint filed by the deceased’s brother, Dilip Vaghela, Mandaliya had been physically and verbally abusing Priti for the past two years, ever since their wedding. The accused had been using casteist slurs to abuse and torment Priti, which ultimately drove her to commit suicide.

After her first husband, Vijay Kumar, died due to illness, Priti lived with her brother, a sanitation worker, and other family members. She then fell in love with Mandaliya after they met at a sewing class near Bapunagar. Mandaliya’ daughter from his previous marriage also lived with the couple.

“Mandaliya’s daughter was going around with a boy and when Mandaliya came to know about this, he accused my sister of not properly caring for his daughter and began harassing and abusing her,” the complainant stated.

He said that in October 2019, his sister left Mandaliya and came to their house because Mandaliya was using casteist slurs against her and beat her up very often.

The family members, however, convinced Priti to return to her marital home, hoping that things would improve. On January 26, the complainant said that he was informed by Mandaliya that Priti had committing suicide by hanging herself at their house.

Meghaninagar police registered a complaint and began an investigation in the case.

Title: Pollachi rape: Copies of chargesheet issued to five
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

Title: Fire breaks out in dyeing mill at Pandesara
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: A fire broke out in Vasant Dyeing Mills located on Batliboy Road of Pandesara GIDC in the city on Tuesday morning. Fire and emergency services department of Surat Municipal Corporation rushed firefighters and tankers from five fire stations to the spot.

The fire, which started in a printing machine on ground floor, soon engulfed two floors. The fire was doused in 45 minutes but few machines were gutted in the fire. There were no casualties but the cause of the fire remains unknown.

Title: Forced to pay for waste disposal, apartment dwellers flay corpn
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Coimbatore: Housing units in Manchester Sitara that used to handover segregated waste to the city corporation are convincing residents to pay Rs 85 a month for service providers to do it.

The civic body is discriminating between individual houses and group houses, and is promoting new service providers, thereby burdening residents unnecessarily, members of the resident welfare association said.

Two months ago, the corporation had announced that it would not collect garbage even if segregated from apartments and gated communities that generate more than 100kg waste a day. It took the decision after the solid waste management rules of 2016 banned collecting garbage from bulk generators.

“The letters communicating the decision sent by the corporation had contact information of four service providers, who can collect segregated garbage,” said K Senthil Kumar, secretary of the federation of group housing. “Left with no option, we brought in a service provider, who charges Rs 85 per month. While the amount might seem small, it is a service that the corporation used to provide for free. What if the service providers increase the fee as we are totally dependent on them?”

The federation of group housing is now planning to take up the issue legally. “The service providers collect the garbage, but we don’t know if they are recycling it or just dumping it somewhere. We plan to complain to the ministers and move court if required,” said Kumar.

Consumer activists also blamed the corporation. “It is a civic body’s basic duty to collect and dispose garbage. Like drinking water, they are trying to privatise this also. Next, they will ask residents to manage streetlights, roads and drainage,” said C Jayaraman of Citizen’s Voice Club.

Agreed Singanallur-based Rathina Devi, secretary of an apartment’s welfare association. “Where do the older apartments have space for composting? We have no space for even a garden. If we compost near a park, the residents near the park will fight with us,” she told TOI.

K Kathirmathiyon of Coimbatore Consumer Cause said the corporation is discriminating between individual houses and apartments. “What is the difference? Just that individual houses are in a horizontal line on a street, but apartments are in a vertical line. If the corporation does not have the infrastructure to handle garbage from so many houses, why give permission to construct them,” he said. “Also, if the corporation is recommending service providers, it should also pay the service charge and not burden residents.”

The service providers recommended by the corporation are mainly logistics providers. “We collect segregated garbage from people, further segregate it and then transport it to recyclers and composters,” said Suresh Bandari of Unwaste.

A Sundaraj, founder of H Adhira Recycleaning, admitted that the firm only collects segregated waste, further segregate it into 22 categories and transport it to users. “We send food waste to pig farms, non-recyclable waste to a cement factory and sell recyclable waste like paper, rubber and coconut shells,” he said. Sundaraj charges apartments around Rs 3 to Rs 3.5 per kilogram.

Meanwhile, corporation authorities said they are just following the solid waste management rule. “According to the rule, bulk waste generators should be able to dispose their waste within their compound,” a senior official said. “Why should Vellalore residents bear the burden of living with the waste generated by lakhs of residents across the city? When we offered to set up micro composting centres in parks, residents in the surrounding areas complained and stopped the project,” he said. “Only if someone has to handle their own waste, will they reduce waste generation. That’s the idea behind the rule.”

Title: Telangana: 80-year-old killed, robbed of jewellery
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: An 80-year-old woman was killed, her body dragged for some distance and dumped near her daughter’s house by robbers in Rangareddy’s Kandukur mandal late on Monday night. Police said the unidentified assailants took away Rs 1.2 lakh worth jewellery.

On Tuesday morning, Kandukur police received a complaint from Sargari Venkat Reddy (65) that his mother Sargari Balamani was found murdered in their village Nedunur. Venkat told cops that his brother-in-law M Anji Reddy, who lives close to Balamani’s house, had informed him about his mother’s death. Nedunur is about 50 km from Hyderabad.

Cops said they were looking at CCTV footage in the area to identify the gang behind the crime.

“The assailants throttled Balamani and dropped her body near her daughter’s house. There were marks on the road indicating that the victim’s body was dragged forcefully from an open area. We suspect that Balamani might have stepped out to attend nature’s call when the assailants targeted her,” Kandukur inspector E Jangaiah said.

After killing her they took her bangles and earrings, leaving scratch marks on her hands and bleeding injury on her right ear. In all, six tola ornaments, including two gold chains and earrings, and 10 tola silver bangles were stolen. “The value of the ornaments is Rs 1.2 lakh,” the inspector said.

Balamani was last seen sitting near the house of G Mallamma close to Syndicate Bank in the village on Monday evening. A murder for gain case was registered. Balamani’s family owns seven acres in the village and her son Venkat resides in Raji Reddy Nagar Colony in Champapet, Hyderabad, cops said.

Title: Gujarat high court seeks reply from government, RBI over bank strikes
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court on Tuesday issued notice to the Centre, the Reserve Bank of India and the united forum of bank unions over a PIL filed by traders opposing the proposed strikes by public sector bank employees later this week.

According to petitioner’s advocate Rashmin Jani, the high court has sought reply from the authorities on Thursday and posted further hearing the same day.

Gujarat Traders Federation along with other traders’ federations approached the HC and filed a PIL a few days after employees of public sector banks announced a two-day strike for January 31 and February 1. The traders have claimed that such repetitive strike calls by bank employees and officers cause severe problems for trade and industry bodies in carrying out financial transactions.

The traders’ bodies highlighted that the bank employees have also given a call for a three-day strike in March, and have threatened indefinite strike from April 1 onwards, if their demands over wage-revision and recruitments are not accepted.

In their PIL the traders’ federation submitted, “Such illegal strikes would cause huge financial losses to the nation and strictest actions are proposed to be taken against the employees who support strikes.” It was also submitted that people would suffer due to these bank strikes as it is estimated that bank transactions amounting to Rs 21,000 crore would be stalled across the country and Rs 12,000 crore would not be taking place in Gujarat alone.

Title: Government hospital gets 50 new stretchers
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: MLA Amman K Arjunan on Tuesday handed over 50 new stretchers to the Coimbatore Medical College and Hospital (CMCH). Earlier, the Coimbatore South MLA had ordered 100 stretchers for the hospital at a cost of Rs 15 lakh, which was spend from his MLA fund.

“While 50 stretchers arrived today (Tuesday), the remaining 50 will arrive within the next one month,” said Dr B Ashokan, hospital dean.

Once the hospital receives the next batch of 50, it will have a total of 250 stretchers. The new stretchers come with better breaks and provisions to hold large oxygen cylinder, ensuring patients’ comfort while being shifted.

“The new ones to arrive will have large wheelbases to facilitate smooth movement on rough or hard surfaces,” the officer said.

With just 150 stretchers, the hospital, which has more than 1,000 inpatients at any point of time, used to struggle earlier to transfer patients from one building to another for scans, dialysis treatments, tests and surgeries, among others. “The new addition will make work smoother,” the hospital dean said.

Title: Supreme Court asks Gujarat government to frame policy for use of commercial parking space
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Supreme Court

SURAT: Many vehicle owners , grappling with parking issues , heaved a sigh of relief because Supreme Court on Tuesday directed the state government to frame a policy whereby parking in malls, hospitals and schools can be used in night by residents of concerned residential area on payment. Thus, if a private car owner, who lives near VR Mall on Surat-Dumas Road, wants to park his car in the mall during night time, he can do so now by paying some charges to the owners. Justice Deepak Gupta and Justice Aniruddha Bose on January 27 gave this order in a special leave petition filed by Rahul Raj Mall Co-operative Service Society (RRMCSS) of Surat. The matter will now come up on March 2, the bench said, adding that its interim order will continue.

The petitioner had challenged Gujarat high court order of July 2019 which had held that the present laws in Gujarat do not allow private malls, multiplexes and commercial complexes to levy parking charges. The high court’s division bench struck down a single judge’s order which had said that the malls and shopping centres should offer free parking to visitors for the first hour. The single judge had also asked malls and multiplexes to charge nominally from visitors for the day after the first hour of parking- Rs10 for two-wheelers and Rs30 for four-wheelers.

Kumar Trivedi, advocate for RRMCSS, said, “The issue of vehicle parking during night time is complex in major cities of the country. In some cities, including Surat, vehicles are parked on society roads obstructing the path of ambulances and fire vehicles. This is right step because it will keep vital roads open for movement of emergency vehicles.”

RRMCSS annually pays up Rs4.75 crore, a portion of pay and park charges to Surat Municipal Corporation . It had submitted that Rs30 for four-wheelers for night after a free hour and Rs10 for two-wheelers as charges be allowed. Trivedi said, “If the state government comes up with a parking policy together with charges, we will welcome it.”

Title: Lucknow: High court orders removal of dairies from municipal limits in one month
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: The high court has directed Lucknow municipal commissioner to ensure removal of dairies from municipal limits within a month.

A bench of Justice PK Jaiswal and Justice KS Pawar passed the order on the petition moved by local lawyer Rahul Srivastava.

In compliance of an earlier direction, municipal commissioner Indramani Tripathi appeared before the court and informed it that there were 1,038 dairies running in the city. Of them, 990 dairies had been ousted from the municipal limit and heavy fine had been realised from those running these illegally.

Many FIRs had also been lodged. However, 180 dairies had made their way back in the municipal limit.

With the court expressing concern on the remaining dairies in the city, Tripathi assured it they would be gone soon. However, he sought more time, owing to the Defence Expo, saying that police would be available only thereafter.

Granting time to the commissioner, the bench directed him to take necessary steps.

Title: ‘Sexually harassed’ by four neighbours, married woman found hanging
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: A 26-year-old married woman, who was allegedly sexually harassed by four neighbours a month ago, was found hanging from a tree in Faridpur area of Bareilly district .

The incident took place on Monday night. On December 24, the woman had lodged a complaint at Faridpur police station against the four accused, but the family claimed that the police didn’t take any action.

On Tuesday, the victim’s husband filed a complaint, but the police are yet to file an FIR in this matter.

The victim's husband sells snacks on a cart and the couple used to live in a rented house in Faridpur.

The four accused, who live in the same locality, often used to harass the woman and her husband, who was also thrashed by them in December.

“We were repeatedly harassed by the four people. Since we came from outside (Shahjahanpur), none of the locals came to support us. Even when the police came for questioning, the villagers favoured the accused, which gave them more liberty. The police didn't bother to file FIR even once,” the victim’s husband said.

“The accused again misbehaved with my wife while she was going to market to buy vegetables on Monday. They chased her, misbehaved with her in the market and also pulled her ‘dupatta’ and later they killed her at an abandoned place and hanged her body. My wife was murdered due to the negligence of the police,” the victim’s husband added.

SHO, Faridpur police station, Dhananjay Singh told TOI, “We are registering an FIR against the four people for murder. The autopsy report will confirm the reason behind the woman's death. A police team had dealt with the earlier complaints of the victim’s family and filed complaints based on their findings. We will ensure that all the accused are arrested soon.”

Title: Gujarat government ‘wears’ helmet in high court, takes it off in public
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Ahmedabad police did not get any instructions on implementing the helmet rule and punish the two-wheeler rider... Read More

By: Meghna Singh and Nandini Didwania

AHMEDABAD: The state government had on Monday stated on oath before the Gujarat high court that no relaxation has been given from wearing helmet, the ground reality is altogether different.

The city police did not get any instructions on implementing the helmet rule and punish the two-wheeler riders caught riding without the head gear.

The city traffic police personnel are still advising the people to wear helmet. On the other hand, some of the people are still not ready to accept the norm of wearing helmet giving various excuses.

“Though we are not imposing fines on people for not wearing helmets , they should wear it. It is our duty to make sure everyone on the road is safe,” said a traffic cop.

DCP, traffic (west), Ajit Rajian, said that he could not comment over the issue as the case is subjudice before the high court. “But we want people to wear the helmet because it is for their safety only,” stressed Rajian.

DCP, traffic (admin), Tejas Patel, too reiterated that the case was pending with the high court so he would not comment over the issue. On the government’s statement in the court, Patel said, “We would take instructions from the government on implementation of the helmet rule.”

The state government had on Monday stated in its affidavit in response to a public interest litigation (PIL) that it had not issued any notification relaxing the rule regarding safety headgear for two-wheeler riders.

The PIL contended that the government’s announcement to relax the helmet rule was a violation of Section 129 of the recently amended motor vehicle act.

Not only did the government assert that it had not relaxed the compulsory helmets rule, its advocate pointed out that in 2015, it amended the state rules and made helmets mandatory for pillion riders as well. The state government made this clarification after the much-touted announcement by the state cabinet on December 5, that the mandatory helmets rule was “temporarily” relaxed in municipal areas.

Title: Three years on, Lucknow Development Authority allottees still wait for dream home
Content:
Representative image

TimesView People invest their life’s savings to buy the dream home. Therefore, it’s grave injustice if they are made to wait for years to get the possession of the house. Civic bodies like Lucknow Development Authorities need to be more sensitive towards this issue and must ensure timely allotment of the houses constructed by them to the buyers. This would also help them win the faith of buyers for future projects as credibility holds the key.

LUCKNOW: Lucknow Development Authority has failed to provide housing units to 865 allottees at Chak Gajariya (CG) city even after three years of the promised date of allotment .Allottees claimed they made full payment for housing units but when they asked for allotment, LDA officials informed them that the registration process was still underway and they would get allotments soon.According to LDA records, registration of 865 lower income group (LIG) housing units was done in 2016.All these units ranged between Rs 13 lakh and Rs 22 lakh.When the matter remained pending for more than three years, some allottees met LDA vice-chairman SK Dwivedi.An allottee, who didn’t wish to be identified, said: “Whenever we contact LDA officials to know the status of our housing units, they tell us that registration process is on and we will get allotment soon. However, it has been three years and we are still waiting.”“LDA had promised us that we will get allotment by 2017 but nothing has happened yet. Complaints made with the grievance cell were not addressed too,” another allottee said.The LDA vice-chairman said, “I am looking into the matter. Directives have been issued to senior officials. All allottees will get their housing units by the end of February.”According to LDA officials, the matter got stuck between planning and finance departments which led to delay. The allotments would have been made earlier had any of the allottees approached UP Real Estate Regulatory Authority (UPRERA) which would have redressed their grievances on priority.

Title: Ahmedabad: Neighbour tries to rescue mentally ill woman, beaten
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A 62-year-old woman from Navrangpura on Tuesday filed a complaint with city police alleging that she and two family members were beaten by a neighbour when she tried to rescue the neighbour’s sister when she was being thrashed by the man late on Monday evening.

In her FIR with Navrangpura police, Jyoti Madhu, a resident of Jaldarshan Society near Vallabh Sadan, off Ashram Road, stated that she, her husband and their daughter had gone to Rajpath Club on SG Road on Monday evening.

“When we retuned at around 8.30pm on Monday, we a woman’s screams. When I went towards that source, I saw Karm Panchal, 25, who lives on the third floor of our building, beating his sister, who is mentally unwell,” Madhu stated in the FIR.

She further states that she was still only watching Panchal beating her sister, when he rushed towards her and began threatening her.“He told me there was no drama was going on I should go away. He then pushed me and slapped my daughter, Bindiya. He had also slapped my husband, Haresh Madhu,” Madhu stated in the FIR.

Madhu alleged that Panchal threatened to kill her. When Madhu told him that she would call police, Panchal fled. Inspector P B Desai of Navrangpura police said Panchal was charged with the IPC sections for causing injury, uttering abusive words and criminal intimidation and had not yet been arrested.

Title: Hyderabad electric-rickshaws to replace Chinese EVs in Nepal
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

HYDERABAD: Even as India grapples with the growing influence of China in the subcontinent, a Hyderabad-based start-up is helping replace ‘made in China’ electric-rickshaws ( e-ricks ) with its own sturdy ‘swadeshi’ brand. Gayam Motor Works is slowly making inroads into the Himalayan nation and replacing Chinese three-wheelers in Butwal, Bhairahawa, Biratnagar and Birgunj.

Not just Nepal, the start-up claims to be the first Indian EV player to drive into the UK. Gayam Motor Works CEO Raja Gayam told TOI that in last six months 20 EVs were exported to the UK where they are being used in and around Manchester.

The home-grown start-up has bagged an order to replace 700 Chinese e-ricks with its Urban ET-Passenger SmartAuto. Gayam had sent its e-ricks for trial run to Nepal around eight months ago, following which it bagged the order and has already exported 60 units. Two of its models are being used at the famed Pashupatinath Temple in Kathmandu to ferry pilgrims.

Patancheru plant to ramp up production

The main issue with Chinese e-ricks is that if roads are bad, they cannot travel at more than 25kmph. Their suspension is bad. But our vehicles can be driven at 50-55 kmph even on bad roads and are comfortable for use,” Raja said, adding their vehicles, once charged, can run for up to 110 km.

Currently, Gayam Motors has an overall order book of 5,000 units, of which 1,500 are from Nepal, Japan, Lebanon and the UK. It has also applied for certification in Europe that it expects to get in about a month, following which it will be shipping its vehicles for trial in Spain, Germany and France.

In order to meet the demand for EVs, the company is also set to ramp up the manufacturing capacity at its Patancheru plant from around 80 units per month to 250 over the next four months. In India, 700 of its e-vehicles are plying on the roads of Hyderabad and Bengaluru, where they are used mainly by e-commerce companies for lastmile deliveries. Some of e-commerce biggies using Gayam’s vehicles include BigBasket, Amazon, Gofers and Flipkart.

Title: Ahmedabad: Youth made 14-year-old boy give him oral sex
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

Title: Ahmedabad: Man stabs friend for dropping cake on his shirt
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A 33-year-old man was stabbed by his friend who was angry at him for dropping cake on his shirt. The incident took place at an AMC garden in Vastral late on Monday night, states the FIR filed with Ramol police.

According to the FIR filed by Jayshree Jhala, the wife of the victim, Rajkumar Jhala, her husband, an autoriW!ckshaw driver, had come home in Vastral late on Monday night. After a while, he left telling her that he would return shortly.

At around 12pm on Tuesday, Rajkumar called Jayshree and told her that his friend, Nikhil Lakum, who lives in the same neighbourhood, had stabbed him over a dispute. She rushed to Ganga Apartments where Rajkumar was sitting and bleeding heavily. The injury was so severe that his intestines had spilled out of his abdomen, the FIR states.

Rajkumar was taken to the Asarwa Civil Hospital where a medico-legal complaint was filed.

“Another friend of Rajkumar’s, Paresh Patel, told Jayshree that he along with Rajkumar and Lakum had gone to the AMC garden on Monday evening. Some boys were celebrating someone’s birthday there. The boys had offered cake to Rajkumar, Patel and Lakum,” states the FIR.

“At the time, Lakum refused to have cake but Rajkumar insisted that he eat it. Rajkumar then accidentally dropped some cake on Lakum’s shirt. This angered Lakum, who then hit Rajkumar, stabbed him with a knife and fled,” the FIR states.

Title: Forest dept steps up vigilance to protect tigers in Mhadei Wildlife Sanctuary
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Keri: Following the death of four tigers at the Mhadei Wildlife Sanctuary in Sattari, the state’s forest officials have heightened vigilance to protect the three other tigers that are known to be present in the sanctuary’s forests.

“Our staff, along with trekkers, are patrolling the area and monitoring the movements of tigers in the forests of the sanctuary daily,” deputy conservator of forests (wildlife division) Vikas Desai told TOI.

During combing operations, forests officials said they spotted one tiger. Deputy conservator of forests (North Goa territory division) Kuldeep Sharma visited Derode and collected evidence of tiger presence.

“There are three tigers roaming in the forests of the Mhadei region of Goa, Maharashtra and Karnataka. Last year, camera traps captured two tigers inside the private forests in Maharashtra bordering Goa and Karnataka. Recently, people have sighted these tigers late at night. The forest department has to plan a strategy to protect these three tigers,” wildlifer Vitthal Shelke, who frequently visits the Mhadei forests, said.

“Our officials are monitoring tiger movement in the Tillari valley. I visited Golauli in Sattari and we are eager to help the Goa forest department in the protection of the tigers,” deputy conservator of forests, Sawantwadi, Samadhan Chavan, told TOI. Recently, tigers killed a cow in Derode and a buffalo in Surla. The Mhadei Wildlife Sanctuary shares its borders with the Bhimgad Wildlife Sanctuary in Karnataka.

The National Wildlife Survey of 2015-16 had found seven tigers in the Bhimgad Sanctuary. As per pugmark evidence and photographs captured by sensor cameras, tiger numbers had gone up to 12 in 2017.

Recent evidence collected by forest officials of the Bhimgad sanctuary in December 2019 revealed the presence of 16 tigers. The Goa forest department has installed 40 camera traps to monitor tigers in the Mhadei forest region.

Title: PG in physiotherapy on cards at Goa Medical College
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: Taking into consideration the growing demand for physiotherapists, Goa Medical College (GMC) and hospital, Bambolim, plans to start a postgraduate (PG) course in physiotherapy. The course will be offered in association with the Pravara Institute of Medical Sciences , Ahmednagar, which is a deemed university. Classes for the programme will be held at the premises of the Asilo hospital in Mapusa, which has been renovated and repaired.

As part of allied health science courses, GMC currently offers 20 seats in its undergraduate degree course in physiotherapy (BPT). However, Goa does not have any institute that offers specialties in physiotherapy.

Dr Rahul Kunkulol, coordinator, directorate of research at the Pravara Institute, said the exact reference of work that needs to be taken up will be clear after a memorandum of understanding (MoU) is signed between Pravara and the Goa government.

“Physiotherapy is beneficial to those who have suffered a stroke, patients with spinal cord injuries and also in orthopaedic treatment. It aids in faster recovery. Even paraplegic people have reaped benefits of physiotherapy sessions,” Kunkulol said.

Title: Coronavirus may impact India’s polished diamond exports
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Surat: Spread of coronavirus in China are making Surat diamantaires worried. They aren’t as frightened for the infection itself than they are from the prospect of exports of polished diamond getting hit by the outbreak.

The anti-government protests in Hong Kong and the US-China trade war has already impacted the polished diamond exports from India to Hong Kong. With annual export of gems and jewellery pegged at over $12 billion, which includes over $10 billion worth of polished diamonds, Hong Kong is the world’s second largest export market for India after the US.

Majority of the exports of polished diamonds to China is done via Hong Kong and now coronavirus may dent consumer demand, said Gems and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC), resulting in the dip in exports.

Vice-chairman of GJEPC, Colin Shah told TOI, “China is the world’s second largest diamond jewellery market after US. The outbreak will impact consumer demand, resulting in decline in export of polished diamonds.”
