Vipin was the son of a retired Armyman Ram Ladete. His wife was not in the house at the time of the incident. Police are investigation the incident to ensure that there is no foul play.

According to police, Vipin had taken leave after the sudden demise of his father-in-law. After completing all the rituals, Vipin had returned home while his wife was still at her maternal house. On Tuesday morning, Vipin was cleaning his pistol while sitting on a charpoy. His mother was busy with household chores. She suddenly heard a bullet report and rushed towards the courtyard. She found Vipin withering in pain. He was immediately rushed to hospital but he died before getting any medical attention as the bullet had hit his head.

Aparna Gautam, SP (rural), told TOI, “An Armyman was killed by his own licenced pistol in Jalalabad. His family members claimed that a bullet was accidentally fired from the pistol while he was cleaning it. We have sent his body for an autopsy and are taking appropriate action as per law. We have not received any complaint from the family and we suspect that it may be a case of suicide.”

Title: Complaint against Church body over kids at CAA protest
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Panaji: An NGO’s child protection coordinator has written to the women and child police station in Panaji, asking that action be taken against a Church body—Council for Social Justice and Peace (CSJP) and another organisation— for including children in the anti-CAA meeting they organised in Margao last Friday.

Providing photographs as proof of participation of children at the gathering held at Lohia Maidan in Margao, Emidio Pinho of the NGO ‘Scan’ said that having impressionable children at such events places them in vulnerable situations.

The anti-CAA/NRC/NPR meeting was organised by CSJP and National confederation of Human Rights organisations.“Children are exposed to political ideology, aggressive and often derogatory language and this can leave a lasting memory. The impact can be detrimental to their sensitive minds. Also, at such meetings, the participants can become violent and innocent children become victims,” said Pinho in his letter to the police. “We also request you to analyse every speech, and if any derogatory words were used, then provisions of the Goa Children’s Act too need to be attracted,” Pinho said.

He said that recently the national commission for protection of child rights had written to director generals of police (DGP) across the country, requesting them to be vigilant to the misuse of children at such meetings.

Pinho has also sent his letter to the Goa DGP and the chief minister.

As per the Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection) Act, 2015, any adult or an adult group’s use of children for illegal activities shall be liable for rigourous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to pay a fine of Rs 5 lakh, Pinho states.

Title: Pakistan must take demonstrable steps against terror: Rajnath Singh
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Union minister for defence Rajnath Singh (File photo)

NEW DELHI: India is “fully capable of giving a firm response” to cross-border terrorism like it did through the surgical strikes in 2016 and the Balakot air strikes last year, said defence minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday, while slamming Pakistan for using “terror as a state policy” rather than peacefully settling disputes through dialogue.

“We have made it clear that talks and terror cannot go together and that Pakistan must take demonstrable steps against terror groups responsible for launching various attacks on India from its soil,” said Singh, addressing the 12th South Asia conference in New Delhi.

Pakistan’s use of terror as an instrument of its foreign and security policy has “promoted radicalism and terrorism in the region”, with Mumbai, Pathankot, Uri and Pulwama being “grim reminders of state-sponsored terrorism”, while all the other Saarc countries have adhered to the principles of non-interference in each other’s internal affairs and not supporting cross-border terrorism, the defence minister said.

Title: Ganga survey for biodiversity conservation
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Lucknow: National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) has taken up the task of conserving biodiversity of the Ganga and its tributaries.

In the first of its kind initiative, 10 rivers, covering more than 4,000 km in eight states of the Ganga basin, will be surveyed. These rivers include Ganga, Ramganga, Yamuna, Gomti, Ghaghra, Gandak, Kosi, Son, Chambal and Rupnarayan. The survey will be conducted by Wildlife Institute of India (WII) along the entire length of the rivers.A team from WII on Tuesday started the survey of Gomti from its origin at Madho Tanda in Pilibhit. The survey of 940km long river will continue till Kaithi in Varanasi. Conservation officer, WII, Rajeev Chauhan said the survey of Gomti would be completed in 20 days.

The survey will record aquatic life of the river which has turtles, crocodiles, water birds and aquatic plants.

Surveys of other rivers will also be carried out soon. Wildllife Institute of India will generate baseline data on river habitat conditions after which a roadmap will be prepared for aquatic biodiversity conservation in Ganga basin.

Title: Mild tremors felt in Navsari district
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Mild tremors were felt in the parts of Navsari district on Tuesday. The tremors were recorded for a few seconds with epicentre located at Chasa village in Chikhli taluka in the district.

Official sources said that the tremors were of 1.9 magnitude on the Ritcher scale. There were no reports of damage to the property or casualty in the region.

R J Patel, mamlatdar of disaster control department of Navsari district said, “We had immediately sent a team for the survey, but there was no loss of property or life.”

Patel said, “The villages in Vansda have been experiencing tremors from the last couple of months. Though the magnitude of the tremor is less than 4, but the people in these villages are worried. Earlier, few kutcha houses in Vansda villages had reported minor damages due to the tremors.”

Title: ‘Heinous crime’ charges dropped against 26 arrested anti-CAA protesters
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Rampur DM Aunjaneya Kumar Singh. (Image taken from his official Twitter account)

RAMPUR: Amar Singh, the police officer investigating the case against 34 people who were arrested on December 21, 2019, for protesting against the just ratified Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), on Tuesday produced two separate applications before two courts, in which he pleaded that no offence under charges of murder, attempt to murder and dacoity could be made out against 26 of the jailed protesters.

They had been arrested after violence broke out at Hatikhana square, in which one protester, Faiz Khan, was shot dead.

The charges of heinous crimes — murder, attempt to murder and dacoity — were dropped after the courts accepted the investigating officer’s applications. The investigation is still on, with police now trying to track the “real culprits”.

On that December afternoon, Kotwali police arrested 24 protesters and sent them to jail under IPC sections 147 (rioting), 148 (rioting, armed with deadly weapons), 149 (unlawful assembly), 307 (attempt to murder), 302 (murder), 333 (voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant), 353 ( assault or criminal force) and sections 3 and 4 of the Prevention of Damage to Public Property Act, 1984. Section 7 of the CLAA (Criminal Law Amendment Act) was also invoked against the protesters.

According to officials, 10 protesters were sent to jail by Ganj Kotwali police station, under charges of rioting, assault on public servants and attempt to murder.

Speaking to TOI, Rampur DM Aunjaneya Kumar Singh said, “No innocent shall be booked. The entire investigation is being done on the basis of evidence. We had ordered officials that if evidence of heinous offenses couldn’t be found against those arrested, charges should be dropped so that they can be released by courts,” adding, “Charges of murder, attempt to murder and dacoity have been dropped against 26 of the jailed protesters.”

Special prosecution officer Shiv Prakash Pandey said, “The courts of the chief judicial magistrate and additional chief judicial magistrate have allowed the applications filed by IO Amar Singh, in which he had mentioned 26 names and prayed before court to have the charges dropped. The IO informed the court that no clinching evidence could be found against them.”

He added, “The remaining sections of IPC, which include rioting, assault on public servant, damage to public property, etc, will remain in force against the offenders.”

The SPO also said charges of murder, dacoity and attempt to murder will remain in force against the eight remaining protesters, who are still in jail.

Police and administration became active after Muslim clerics gathered at Jama Masjid during Friday prayers and set January 29 as deadline for resolving the cases against those who have been “falsely accused”, stating that if their demands were not met by then, they would decide their next course of action on January 30.

Title: SWR asked to start Hubballi-Vijayapura Intercity Express
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Hubballi: Minister of state for railways Suresh Angadi has asked the South Western Railways (SWR) to start Hubballi-Vijayapura Intercity Express from February 15.

Speaking at the inauguration of the Road Over Bridge (ROB) at Desai Cross here on Tuesday, Angadi said that the proposed train will connect Hubballi and Vijayapura in less time compared to existing passenger trains.

Angadi said line doubling is the first priority of the Railways. “As part of this vision, line doubling between Bengaluru and Pune has been expedited and all work incuding electrification in Karnataka will be completed by 2022,” he said.

Comparing the growth of railway network in India with that of Korea, which also got independence in 1947, Angadi said that trains in Korea are running at a speed of 400 KMPH whereas in India we are still struggling to enhance the speed to 100 KMPH. “With line doubling, we aim to take passengers from Bengaluru to Hubballi only in four hours,” he added.

Ajay Kumar Singh, general manager, SWR, said that the ROB is reconstructed as part of the ongoing Hospet-Tinaighat railway doubling project. The new bridge, which is built at the cost of Rs 14.6 crore, accommodates double line as well as extension of Hubballi station yard.

Title: No clarity yet on transfer of Elgar case hearing to NIA court
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

There was no clarity about the timing of transferring Elgar Parishad case papers to the NIA court at the case ... Read More

PUNE: There was no clarity about the timing of transferring Elgar Parishad case papers to the NIA court at the case hearing on Monday, the first after the Centre ordered the transfer of its further probe to the National Investigation Agency last Friday.

Besides, clarity also eluded on the place of hearing, Pune or Mumbai, in the case.

Special UAPA judge SR Navander, hearing the case for now, told the representing lawyers that the court had received no official word yet about the transfer. Special public prosecutor Ujjwala Pawar told the court that the prosecution was seeking a copy of the order from the authorities concerned while the defence lawyers said they had no idea about the matter.

Lawyer Rohan Nahar, who is representing one of the arrested activists P Varavara Rao, told TOI, “As per our information, the charge of NIA court in Pune is with district and sessions judge AY Thatte. However, only those cases wherein the state government has initiated probe transfer to NIA are expected to come up for hearing before the NIA court here. In the instant case, the transfer of further investigation has been ordered by the Centre. As such, the case papers may go to NIA court in Mumbai. We have to wait and watch what happens ahead.”

Other defence lawyers said there was still some time before the case papers were actually moved to the appropriate NIA court for hearing. This is because the Maharashtra Vikas Aghadi government in the state has protested the Union home ministry’s move to transfer the case to the NIA without seeking its permission or even formally notifying it about the move. State home minister Anil Deshmukh has declared that the government was seeking legal opinion before taking a call on challenging the transfer move in the court of law.

“Legally speaking, there are sufficient grounds for the transfer move to be challenged before the higher courts. If such a challenge is made, it will take some more time before the NIA court starts hearing the case,” said a defence lawyer.

Till then, the special UAPA court in Pune will continue to hear the matter.

Title: Fomento gave truncated RFP docu, MMC tells court
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Margao: The Margao Municipal Council (MMC) at the hearing of the Sonsoddo case in the district and sessions court on Tuesday, said that Fomento Green submitted to it a “truncated” copy of its request for proposal (RFP) which, it claimed, was different from the original document.

The RFP was issued by MMC to Fomento in 2009 for setting up the garbage treatment plant, and it was required to be returned to the municipality after filling in the details.

Advancing his arguments in the case, MMC counsel Sandesh Padiyar poked holes in Fomento Green’s appeal to the court that MMC be stopped from bringing waste into the Sonsoddo plant as it was already choked with excluded waste.

Padiyar sought to suggest that if Fomento Green has already stopped operations at the plant, its prayer to restrict MMC from bringing waste to the plant was effectively infructuous.

Padiyar then referred to the RFP submitted by Fomento and pointed out that certain pages and paragraphs from the original document were missing. “It’s truncated,” he said while pointing out missing components, particularly from clauses pertaining to scope of work, relocation of the existing dump and construction of sanitary landfill.

The argument assumes significance as several changes that took place subsequent to the signing of the concession agreement in February 2011 led to a change in the scope of the work of the project, though no addendum to the concession agreement was carried out.

Terming the accusation as “serious”, justice B P Deshpande directed the MMC to place before the court the original RFP.

Countering Fomento’s contention that all changes in the scope of work were made upon the directions of the high-powered coordination committee on Sonsoddo chaired by the chief minister, Padiyar pointed out that the minutes of the HPCC meetings were not placed on record.

The court then directed that minutes of the HPCC meetings also be placed before it within the next three days. It expressed its displeasure over the failure of the Goa State Pollution Control Board to submit its report of the samples of waste collected by it to determine the nature of waste lying inside the plant at Sonsoddo.

The court said it would write to the board, asking to submit the report to it within a week.

The matter was adjourned to February 6 for further arguments.

Title: Bihar: Wanted in four states, JNU’s Sharjeel Imam caught in Jehanabad
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Sharjeel Imam

PATNA: Sharjeel Imam , the JNU student on the run since January 24 after FIRs were filed against him four states, was arrested by a joint team of Delhi and Bihar Police in Jehanabad around 3 pm on Tuesday. He was produced in a local court, which granted a transit remand of 36 hours to the Delhi Police to take him to the national capital.

The PhD scholar, who reportedly played a key role in the launch of the Shaheen Bagh protest against the CAA, faces charges ranging from sedition to promotion of religious enmity. He was reportedly caught at his ancestral village of Malik Tola in Kako.

“We arrested Sharjeel in the Kako police station area during a joint operation by police personnel from Bihar and Delhi. Earlier, the crime branch of Delhi Police had lodged an FIR against him,” Bihar ADG (headquarters) Jitendra Kumar said, adding, “Further details about him and the case can only be shared by Delhi Police.”

Another officer privy to the operation against the JNU scholar, added, “Prior to Sharjeel’s arrest, police carried out search operations at Sabjibagh, Alamganj and Phulwarisharif (all in Patna) and Jehanabad after a Delhi Police team arrived in the state on Saturday.”

Sources said as part of their search operation, Delhi Police had earlier questioned three member of Sharjeel’s family, including his brother Muzammil Imam.

Sharjeel went into hiding after UP Police slapped a sedition case on him following his inflammatory speech at Aligarh Muslim University where he allegedly said Muslims should cut off Assam from the rest of India. Later, three FIRs were lodged against him in Assam, Arunachal Pradesh and Manipur.

In a tweet purportedly posted more than an hour after his arrest, Sharjeel claimed that he had given himself up to police. He wrote, “I have surrendered to the Delhi Police on 28.1.2020 at 3 PM. I am ready and willing to operate (sic) with the investigation. I have full faith in due process of law. My safety and security are now in the hand of Delhi Police. Let peace prevail.”

His lawyers, too, released a statement claiming that he surrendered before the Delhi police team at Kako on Tuesday.

“We received Delhi Police summons under Section 160 CrPC on Monday after which we (a team of two lawyers) flew to Patna from Delhi and reached Jehanabad around 2.45pm. We handed over the summons to Sharjeel after which he appeared before the Delhi Police team with us,” Sharjeel’s counsel Ahmad Ibrahim told TOI. He added that Sharjeel was formally arrested after being taken to Kako police station.

“Sharjeel has been brought to Patna by Delhi Police. We will prove in court that he did not say anything seditious,” Ibrahim said, adding, “The FIR lodged by Delhi Police is for several speeches delivered by Sharjeel between December last and January this year.”

Reacting to the arrest, CM Nitish Kumar said, “Anyone who acts like this will be arrested. Nobody should go against national interest and the Constitution. Giving opinion is one thing but saying that they will break the country is impossible,” Nitish said, adding, “No one in this world can break India.”

Locals said Sharjeel’s family is associated with the ruling JD (U). One of them recalled, “Sharjeel’s father, the late Akbar Imam, had lost in the 2005 assembly election when he fought from Jehanabad on a JD (U) ticket. His uncle, Arshad Imam, is a block-level leader of JD(U) at Kako. His brother, Muzammil, is a social worker.”

Title: Revenue mop-up: Soon, pay power bills at ration shops in UP
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: Now, you can pay your electricity bills while buying ration at fair price shops in your neighbourhood. This is part of the energy department’s innovative strategy to swiftly mop up revenue, particularly in rural areas, by making ration shops double up as bill payment kiosks.

Once executed, the proposal will allow approximately 80,000 FPS (68,000 in rural areas and 12,000 in urban areas) to act as one-stop bill payment centres.

Talking to TOI, principal secretary, energy, and chairman of UP Power Corporation Limited, Arvind Kumar said since ration shops are frequented by both urban and rural folk, this will allow seamless bill payment through electronic point of sale (e-POS) machines. “The procedure will be transparent and help the corporation boost revenue,” he said.

According to department’s proposal, the collection process will come with incentives to FPS operators. UPPCL proposed that the fair price shops would receive one per cent of the amount paid in every bill. The corporation has fixed the upper limit of Rs 500 per bill. “This would augment income of FPS,” Kumar said. UPPCL also plans to rope in agricultural cooperative societies and self-help groups (SHGs) for collection of electricity bills. “For this, the department would be working in coordination with the rural development department,” said Kumar.

UPPCL’s move to rope in multiple agencies for collection of electricity bills comes in the backdrop of massive power arrears of around Rs 82,000 crore, which have piled up over 20 years since the erstwhile UP State Electricity Board (UPSEB) was disbanded to form three companies relating to power generation, transmission and distribution system in the state.

Kumar said the number of electrified households in last two-and-half years has gone up from 1.8 crore to around 2.8 crore. A major contributor has been schemes like Deendayal Updhayay Rural Electrification Scheme and Saubhagya, which envisages free power connection to rural households. At the same time, cost of power has risen by 15% because of the increase in prices of coal and oil.

Title: Will move legally if resolution fails, says Chennithala
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kannur: Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala has reiterated that the UDF is steadfast to the resolution it plans to introduce in Kerala assembly, urging the President of India to recall governor Arif Mohammed Khan , alleging that he has become the megaphone of the BJP.

Flagging off the ‘Sahana Samara Padyathra’, an anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act campaign against the Centre and the state government, led by DCC president Satheesan Pacheni, at Mahe on Tuesday, Chennithala also said that there is an understanding between the government and the governor. If the resolution fails, the UDF would go ahead with legal measures, he added.

“Though other states, including Rajasthan and West Bengal, passed the resolution against CAA, the governors there did not humiliate it but here the Kerala governor has become the megaphone of the BJP, and he is publicly humiliating the resolution by talking against it all over the state. The governor has completely ignored the sentiments of Keralites, and also humiliated them,” Chennithala said.

Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan is silent about it and hence we decided to move the resolution demanding the recall of the governor, said the opposition leader.

“I thought the chief minister would speak against the governor, who rebukes the resolution against CAA, as he has the responsibility to uphold the status of the House. So I waited for one week, but when he remained silent and failed to uphold the status of the House, I, as the opposition leader, decided to give a notice for the resolution,” he said.

If the government is sincere in the campaign against CAA, it should support the resolution planned in the assembly’s budget session, he added.

Meanwhile, K Muraleedharan, MP, who also addressed the function, said the real colours of the chief minister would come to the fore when the governor delivers the policy speech in the budget session.

He too alleged that the chief minister has reached an understanding with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, as he is afraid of the verdict in SNC-Lavalin case.

Title: Coordination committee reviews programmes
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Coimbatore: The district development coordination and monitoring committee (DDCMC) conducted a meeting at the district collectorate on Tuesday to review implementation of programmes. Coimbatore MP P Natrajan presided over the meeting in the presence of collector K Rajamani. The aim of the committee is to enable coordination between the Centre, the state government and panchayats officials for successful implementation of schemes. The committee has been monitoring the implementation of the ministry of rural development’s schemes. During the meeting, the status of the programmes was discussed, said a press release. Rajya Sabha member S R Balasubramanian and Pollachi MP K Shanmugasundaram and several MLAs participated in the meeting. tnn

Title: Engineers asked to use ropes to stop strays during CM Yogi Adityanath’s visit
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

CM Yogi Adityanath

LUCKNOW: To ensure smooth passage for chief minister Yogi Adityanath ’s cavalcade during his proposed visit to Mirzapur, a PWD executive engineer deputed nine teams to stop stray cattle from breaching the CM’s security cordon and VIP movement.

The order may have gone down as just another directive before CM’s visit, except that junior engineers in the district were asked to stand along the VIP route with their teams and armed with ropes to keep stray cattle at bay.

Executive engineer Kanhaiya Jha ’s order went viral on social media, triggering embarrassment to the district administration. Finally, Jha was forced to withdraw the order. “Ukta avar abhiyanta apne gang ko sath 8-10 rassi lekar ingit karyasthal par upasthit rahenge. Yadi awara pashu sadak par ayen toh unko baandh kar rakhein taki mukhyamantri ke avagaman mein koi vyavadhaan na utpan ho. (Junior engineers will remain present with their teams and 8-10 ropes on the designated spot. They must catch hold and tie up stray animal coming in way of the CM’s convoy).

Reacting to the order on Tuesday, Engineers Association of Mirzapur wrote UP PWD official, stating that their engineers were not trained to catch animals. “Who will be responsible if any of them were injured while executing their duty,” the letter stated. “It would be better if the administration deputes this work to some other agency or persons who have the expertise,” the association suggested. The order also gave Opposition parties ammunition to corner BJP on two counts — first inability of the administration to deal with stray cattle and deployment of government employees on bizarre duty.

“BJP is responsible for the stray cattle menace. Apprehending that CM may fall prey to his own folly, the officers went overboard and issued a bizarre order,” said Ajay Kumar Lallu , UP Congress president.

After the embarrassment, DM Sushil Patel directed Kanhaiya Jha to revoke the order. “I came to know about the order on social media and ordered its rollback,” Patel said. In his defence, Kanhaiya Jha said: “The move aimed at ensuring seamless movement of the CM’s cavalcade and those deputed are managers who can multi-task. But now the order has been revoked.”

Title: Bar council opposes move to shift tribunal out of state
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Chennai: The Centre’s decision to shift the Intellectual Property Appellate Tribunal ( IPAB ) out of Chennai to any north Indian state has come in for flak, with the Bar Council of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry adopting a resolution against the proposal. The Madras Bar Association (MBA) also passed a similar resolution against the controversial proposal.

“IPAB is functioning in Chennai since 2003. Now, it appears that there is a proposal to move the principal bench of IPAB from Chennai to outside of Tamil Nadu. As we have received representation from various bar associations against the move that it would affect the interest of public and the legal fraternity in the state, the council has passed a resolution requesting the Union government not to shift IPAB but to fill the vacant chairperson’s post for its effective functioning,” the council’s chairperson P S Amalraj said.

Expressing a similar view, senior counsel and DMK Rajya Sabha MP P Wilson said: “IPAB exercises powers under the Patent Act, Trade Mark Act and the Geographical Indication Act. Its principal bench has been effectively functioning from Chennai for the past 16 years.”

P Sanjai Gandhi, advocate and president of Intellectual Property Rights Advocates Association, said the IPAB’s track record had been good and there was no compelling reason to disturb it location.

Justice Jagadeesan was the first chairman of IPAB preceded by Justice Prabha Sridhevan and Justice K N Basha. After the term of Justice Basha, the same was not filled for a long period prompting the Bar to move the Supreme Court to direct the Centre to make the appointment immediately. The apex court extended the term of Justice Maninder Singh as chairman by one more year, and asked the Centre about the location of IPAB.

Title: Kochi: Shaheen Bagh protest will be replicated across India, says Rajaratna Ambedkar
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Rajaratna Ambedkar, Dr BR Ambedkar's great-grandson

KOCHI: Samvidhan Suraksha Aandolan , a platfrom formed for protection of the Indian Constitution would replicate Shaheen Bagh-like agitations across India, said Rajaratna Ambedkar , great grandson of B R Ambedkar.

Addressing a press conference here Ambedkar, who is also the president of the Budhdhist Society of India, said the Aandolan was formed in the backdrop of CAA-NRC-NPR agitations. “From January 26 onwards we have been travelling to every state to explain the ill effects of this act, which is not just againt minorities but against each and every citizen,” said Ambedkar.

Stating that CAA is not just against Muslims, Ambedkar said, in Assam, most of the people who lost citizenship are Hindus. “Only 4.5 lakh people among them are Muslims. Scheduled castes, scheduled tribes and adivasis are mostly the ones to lose,” he said.

According to Aandolan organizers, the aim of the movement is to save the nation and the Constitution by liberating India from the control of RSS and BJP. The 10-member presidium formed by Aandolan has Justice B G Kolse Patil as president. M K Faizy, national president of Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) and Chandrasekhar Azad, chief of Bhim Army are members of the presidium. Muhammad Shafi, national general secretary of SDPI has been appointed general secretary of the Aandolan while E M Abdul Rahiman is the national council member.

The Aandolan would organise a people’s march to Rashtrapati Bhavan on February 12.

Title: Man found in Abu Dhabi after 1 year
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Hyderabad: A person from Hyderabad, who went missing in Dubai in January last year, was found in Abu Dhabi in a mentally unstable condition.

Mohammed Abdul Wahab, 34, with his dishevelled appearance was recognised by another person from Hyderabad who immediately called up his roommates in Dubai to inform them about Wahab found in Abu Dhabi on Monday. He last spoke to his family on January 17 last year.Wahab’s father Mohammed Abdul Gani had written a letter to external affairs minister S Jaishankar to help trace his son.

Wahab worked as a telecom technician in a company and stayed at Mitsubishi building, Daira Dubai. He suddenly disappeared from his room and did not take any of his belongings. Wahab had gone to Dubai three years ago.

“Wahab is unable to speak and is incoherent. He is unable to even recognise us when he was made to speak on the phone with us,” brother Mohammed Abdul Rauf, a resident of Chintal basthi in Khairatabad, told TOI.

According to social worker and MBT leader Amjed Ullah Khan, the Consulate General of India (CGI), Dubai, should step in to help Wahad return to Hyderabad. After Wahab was traced, the company where he worked said it would withdraw the case it had filed against him after he went missing.

“Wahab’s family is poor and cannot afford his return fare. We have written to CGI to help Wahab so that he gets legal clearance as his passport is with his employer. Since he has overstayed, a penalty of Rs 5 lakh will have be paid to the government there. The issue should be taken up by CGI,” Amjed Ullah Khan said.

Title: Kerala govt offers Rs 100 crore loan guarantee to KSWDC
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kerala health minister KK Shailaja

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: As part of offering more loans to women, the government has offered Rs 100 crore additional loan guarantee for The Kerala State Women’s Development Corporation(KSWDC), said health minister K K Shailaja .

The guarantee has been assured by the government so as to obtain more loans from National Backward Classes Finance and Development Corporation ( NBCFDC ). The corporation originally had only a guarantee of Rs 140 crore to avail loans from the national financial corporations which the present government enhanced by an additional Rs 350.56 crore, the minister said. The minister added that the corporation also began offering loans to women from scheduled tribes during the current government’s tenure.

With more guarantee provided by the government, the corporation will be able to avail more loans and thereby disburse more loans to women for self-entrepreneurship at reasonable interest rates, the minister said. The state women’s development corporation is the channelizing agency of multiple agencies of Centre and state government to ensure financial empowerment of women in the state through providing loans at affordable interest rates for the past 30 years.

After the present government came to power, the corporation has been able to offer various services to as many as six lakh women through various schemes.

Title: State has given nod for new theatre: Pawar
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

CLEARED SKHER

Kolhapur: The state government has approved the proposal to set up a new drama theatre with a seating capacity of 2,000.

Deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar , after a meeting with the district authorities, declared that several proposals pertaining to the city’s development had been accepted. “There was a proposal to develop a new drama theatre in Kolhapur . We have approved it and the provisions for the funds will be made,” he said.

Last year, a delegation of the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation had met Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar and sought funds for new drama theatre. Pawar had agreed to take up the issue with the state government and asked the KMC to draw a plan and design for the theatre in the meantime.

At present, there is only one theatre — Keshavrao Bhosale Natygruha — in the city. It was recently renovated at a cost of Rs 6 crore in the first phase.

Civic officials said the new theatre could come up in the E ward, near the government circuit house. Land in its vicinity had been identified for the purpose, an official said, requesting anonymity.

On Tuesday, district guardian minister Satej Patil said the work to develop the theatre will start in next three months. “The theatre will be a multi-purpose complex having facilities to hold several activities in its premises,” he said.

Patil added that artists have suggested some changes to the Keshavrao Bhosale Natygruha, for which, a comprehensive meeting will be held soon.

Among other announcements, Pawar said that Rs 5 crore would be released to develop facilities at Mahalaxmi temple. Also, the plan to beautify the Rankala and Kalamba lake will be drafted. Pawar said that he would personally speak with chief minister Uddhav Thackeray regarding the proposal to build a memorial of Shahu Maharaj at abandoned complex of Shahu Mill in the city.

Title: Tamil Nadu: First branded loco flagged off at Dindigul railway station
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

SALEM: Southern railway general manager John Thomas flagged off the first branded loco at Dindigul station on Friday. The loco features the advertisement by SKM Feeds . He was on a drive to inspect various railway stations in Salem division.

He dedicated platform number 2 at Eriodu station to passengers, besides inspecting the newly-inaugurated engineering rest room and track machines at the station.

At Karur junction, the officer unveiled a battery-operated car, multipurpose stall, LED backlit passenger amenity board, renovated circulating area, CCTV camera units, vertical garden and an ATM booth. He also dedicated Braille board to visually challenged passengers and released a hand booklet for operating staff and safety department staff.

In Namakkal, John inaugurated reserved cum unreserved booking counter, new parcel office, LED backlit passenger amenity board and a park. Speed trial was also conducted on Namakkal-Salem section.

At Salem junction, he inspected the renovated Hindi bhavan, children's park at east railway colony, pulse kiosk, massage chair and Brallie board. He was also appraised on works on platform shelter at platform number 5 and provision of lifts and escalators.

The officer was accompanied by divisional railway manager U Subba Rao, principal heads of Southern Railway departments, chief commissioner of railway safety and other officers.

Title: BJP’s first protest march for complete loan waiver
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kolhapur: The Bharatiya Janata Party’s (BJP) district unit took out a huge protest march from Dasara Chowk to Collectors Office demanding complete loan waiver for farmers affected by floods last year.

The state government has decided to waive off loans of up to Rs 2 lakh. The BJP; however, claims that before coming to power, Shiv Sena, Congress and Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) had assured complete loan waiver and that they are not keeping their promise.

The march was attended by farmers from the district. Huge police security was deployed along the route and at the Collectors Office. This was the first protest march of BJP after the Maha Vikas Agahadi came to power.

BJP state president Chandrakant Patil said, “Chief minister Uddhav Thackeray should tell us difference between hectare and acre and what does FRP (fair and remunerative price) mean. The loan waiver decision has been taken without any study or calculation. The affected farmers have got no relief. When we were in power, we gave Rs 50,000 grant to those farmers who paid the loan amount regularly. The farmers who suffered crop loss due to untimely rains have not been considered in the loan waiver.”

BJP district president Samarjit Ghatge lashed out at ministers Satej Patil and Hasan Mushrif stating that they both have not provided satisfactory answers to the questions raised over the loan waiver scheme.

“We expect remuneration up to Rs 1 lakh to the farmers paying the loan amount regularly. Guardian minister Satej Patil requested us to discuss the issue before taking out the protest march. We have requested him that if the government comes up with a resolution to waive off the entire loan amount of farmers, we will take back the protest march. If our demands are not met, we will protest outside Mantralay under the leadership of former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis.”

The protesters demanded that the terms and conditions such as no loan waiver for the person who both working in a co-operative institute as well as carries out farming, loan dues with micro-finance companies should be withdrawn.

Title: Commercial properties on rent to undergo scrutiny
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Done

Kolhapur: The Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) is going to initiate random scrutiny of commercially-rented properties after receiving several complaints regarding less tax being charged on such properties.

The KMC has found two such commercially-rented properties for which the tax has been charged less as per the rates decided by the civic body. The tax for commercially-rented properties is more in comparison with commercial and residential properties that have not been given on rent.

Charging less tax for commercially rented properties leads to huge loss of revenue to the KMC. A senior official of property tax department said, “We have received complaints of around 80 commercially-rented properties where the tax charged was as per the properties that have not been given on rent. This leads to loss of revenue. We have found two such properties. Officials ignoring such cases will be fined and tax will be recovered from the owners of the commercially-rented properties.”

Properties rented for the commercial purposes are banks, ATMs, shopping outlets and offices of the private firms. Recently, civic activists claimed that the property tax department staff runs a nexus with owners of the commercially-rented properties.

“Changes are edited in the online software by designating the property as owned property rather than commercially-rented property which automatically reduces the tax bill,” a civic official said.

“We have stopped the online system for a while. We will scrutinise all commercially-rented properties and if we find any discrepancies, a bill of the additional amount will be issued to the owner,” he added.

Last year, after demand from the trader’s body, the KMC had reduced property tax on the commercially-rented properties.

Title: Human chain fallout: IUML suspends leader
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kozhikode: IUML has suspended a party leader who participated in the anti-CAA human chain organized by the LDF on Sunday.

K M Basheer, vice-president of the IUML’s Beypore mandalam committee, was suspended from the party, pending inquiry, by the state committee for violating party discipline.

Party leader M K Muneer said that disciplinary action was taken against Basheer as his statements violated party discipline. “He justified it and said that he would repeat such activities. Such remarks violated party discipline, necessitating the disciplinary action,” Muneer added.

IUML Kozhikode district president Ummer Pandikasala said that besides participating in the LDF’s human chain, Basheer made public statements through news channels against IUML and UDF, and behaved in a manner challenging the party which is why Beypore mandalam committee recommended disciplinary action and the party district committee endorsed it.

Meanwhile, Basheer reiterated that there was nothing wrong in participating in LDF’s human chain against CAA as IUML had not issued any direction to party workers against attending it.

“Everyone will have to join together in this agitation, today or tomorrow. IUML leader M K Muneer and opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala had stood together with chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan in the joint agitation against CAA held in Thiruvananthapuram. The people of Kerala wish to have that kind of unity and do not favour attempts to disrupt it for vote bank politics,” he added.

CPM district secretary P Mohanan said that the controversy revealed the uncertainty within IUML over the issue. “If IUML starts disciplinary action against party leaders and workers for participating in the LDF’s human chain, then it will have to act against thousands,” he added.

Title: Trans couple runs from pillar to post to register their marriage
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Coimbatore: Despite the Madras high court ruling in their favour nine months ago, a trans couple in the city has been running from pillar to post to get their marriage registered for the past two years.

On April 22 last year, the Madras high court ruled that the term “bride” under the Hindu Marriage Act includes transwomen and directed authorities to register a marriage between a man and a transgender.

But register offices in the city have been turning away the couple claiming that the computing system has still not been changed to allow registration of a transgender as a bride.

R Manikandan and Surekha, a transgender, tied the knot at Paranjothi Mariamman Temple on Mettupalayam Road in 2018.

“A few months after our wedding, we decided to get it registered. We first approached the district register office within the collector office and submitted an application for the registration,” says Manikandan.

“We submitted all documents including both our Aadhar cards, voter ID cards, our photographs from the temple and a certificate from the temple, but they sent us away stating they will get back to us,” says the 25-year-old who works as an autorickshaw driver.

Surekha, who works in a dairy farm in Narasimanaickenpalayam, says she has also submitted the other documents like proof of name change and getting it printed in the gazette, certificate and proof of the sex change surgery she underwent among others.

“We received no reply from them. After the court ruling, we again went four times, but they said they have not received a government order yet and once they receive it, they will contact us themselves,” she said. After giving up on the district register office, the couple approached the Vadavalli register office on January 21 and applied again for registering their marriage. On the next day, the Vadavalli register office wrote to the couple stating that they cannot register their marriage because under Section 5(111) of the Indian Marriage Act, the word bride literally means a woman who just got married or is going to be married. “The word transgender finds no place in the act,” they added.

“They replied saying that they can’t register the marriage but have advised us to approach the collector and the district register office, and get a special order directing them to register the office,” Manikandan said.

The couple says they want the registration because it gives them and their relationship legal protection. “I don’t have my parents or any siblings, because I left home as a child. I also need some legal family,” says Surekha.

“They ask for marriage registration certificate for even small things like applying for an electricity board connection, a passport, opening a joint bank account,” says Manikandan. “Importantly we want to adopt a child and start a family in a few years after we are more financially settled. That too can’t happen without registering our marriage,” he said.

Title: Cong corporator’s query reveals demand to split Jayprabha land
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kolhapur: A proposal to divide the land of Jayprabha Studio into two parts — one open space purportedly for development and another part as a heritage site — has been made to the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC).

The proposal has angered local artists and actors. Former actor and Congress corporator Surekha Shah had sought information about the proposal from the town planning department. The department has accepted that a proposal to divide the Jayprabha Studio land has been made by power of attorney. Deputy town planner Narayan Bhosale confirmed that such a proposal has been made and the department has prepared a report that will be tabled before the general body.

Already, the general body has decided to not to allow non-film activities at the Jayprabha Studio. The studio and the land are owned by veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar. She had moved a petition in civil court that granted her permission to develop the open space last year. Akhil Bhartiya Chitrapat Mahamandal had demanded that Mangeshkar not be allowed to develop the site, claiming that already seven acres of the 10-acre site has been developed for residential and commercial purposes and there should no further encroachment.

Congress corporator Shah said: “The studio is a heritage building and we want the site to be used only for film-related activities. The site should be protected. Once the development activities start, no one can be able to protect it. I will raise the issue in the GB meeting.”

The local court had upheld Mangeshkar’s that the property was bought by her in an auction. Her legal counsel then maintained that no other person, institute or the government can claim the right over the property and that the heritage site has not been damaged nor the property is sold to another person.

Title: Government considers capping number of floors in high-rises in core Bengaluru
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Government says limiting the height of highrises will ease stress on existing infrastructure

BENGALURU: The government is in the process of formulating a policy to limit the height of high-rises in core areas of Bengaluru city — the entire area within the Peripheral Ring Road — in a bid to ease stress on existing infrastructure. The decision appears especially driven by the slow pace of building mass transit systems such as the Metro. Bengaluru has a population density of 4,381 per square km as per the 2011 population census.

Urban development department (UDD) officials say they are considering “limiting the number of floors” permitted for construction. “However, this is in correlation to the government’s policy of transit oriented development (TOD) and challenges with regard to stress on basic infrastructure within city limits,” said a senior UDD official.

UDD sources say a decision on capping the number of floors in high-rise structures will be taken in consultation with the fire service department, which must sign-off on multistory constructions. Another criterion is the extent of public transport available and the load-carrying capacity.

“As per the TOD policy, depending on available public transport and the extent of carriageway, we will allow an increased number of floors. But this has to be matched with the basic infrastructure challenge,” said the UDD official.

However, urban experts believe sanction for high-rise structures must be in correlation with the extent of public transport available. Urban expert RK Misra told TOI it will be far more difficult for the government to provide infrastructure if the city expands horizontally.

But Misra did sound a word of caution, saying: “However, vertical development will work only with efficient transport infrastructure.”

Some urban experts were derisive of the move, saying decisions with regard to high-rises is purely based on pressure from the real estate industry, which cannot afford land in core city areas and thus want to develop on the outskirts.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Visit nearby hospitals first, not us, says PGI
Content:
Representative image

CHANDIGARH: PGI director Prof Jagat Ram on Tuesday wrote to the chief secretaries of adjoining states of Punjab, Himachal Pradesh and Haryana, requesting them to contain transmission of coronavirus by asking patients to first visit a nearby hospital instead of directly coming to the premier medical institute.On Monday, a suspected case of the virus from Mohali was admitted to the institute. The PGI daily sees around 10,000 patients in OPDs. “Patients should not travel far and in the process transmit any infection. Nearby hospitals must first examine them,” said Dr Vikas Suri, department of internal medicine, PGI.The sample of the 28-year-old patient was on Monday sent to the National Institute of Virology, Pune. “We had sent throat swab and blood samples. They were received on Tuesday. We expect the report by Wednesday,” said Dr Suri.So far, eight passengers who had travelled to China have visited hospitals in Punjab. “They are from Ropar, Amritsar, Patiala and Mohali. None of them had any symptoms,” said Dr Gagandeep Grover, state programme officer, Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme, Punjab.All the three government hospitals in the city have already set up their isolation wards for H1N1 and coronavirus. “There is no need to panic. We are prepared to contain the virus. There were some queries regarding the virus on our helpline,” said Dr Upendrajeet Singh Gill, state surveillance officer, ChandigarhAll the health workers posted in the communicable disease isolation ward have been provided N95 face masks and other protective covers. “All the districts have state surveillance units and they send the sample for testing to the laboratory in Pune. Therefore, patients can come on their own to these hospitals if they have a China travel history,” said Dr Suri.The UT health department said since January 1, a total of 56,475 houses have been surveyed and members of the households sensitized about H1N1 and coronavirus with pamphlets in both Hindi and English. Till now, awareness lectures have also been delivered in 14 schools and colleges, wherein 3,286 students have been sensitized about the two viruses.

Title: Prashant Kishor exit certain after spat with Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
Content:
Prashant Kishor

.@NitishKumar what a fall for you to lie about how and why you made me join JDU!! Poor attempt on your part to try… https://t.co/GGeMOPY17E — Prashant Kishor (@PrashantKishor) 1580222705000

PATNA: Chief minister Nitish Kumar and senior JD (U) leader Prashant Kishor seemed all set to part ways after they indulged in a war of words on Tuesday. The former said the poll strategist is “free to leave” and the latter hit back calling his party boss “a liar”.It all began when Nitish, while talking to the media here, said, “I don’t have any problem if he (Kishor) wants to leave the party. But if he wants to stay, then he will have to follow the basic structure of the party.”He added, “Rahega to theek, nahi rahega to theek.” He further said, “Someone (referring to Varma) wrote a letter and I responded to it. Someone is tweeting, let him (Kishor) tweet. What can I do about it? People can stay in the party till the time they want. They are free to go whenever they feel like.”Nitish reminded Kishor that he was inducted in the JD (U) on the recommendations of Union home minister Amit Shah . “Amit Shah Ji told me to take him in the party. But he (Kishor) works for different kinds of people as a (poll) strategist. He is now working for Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). He might have ambitions to go places. He is free to go,” the CM said.Soon after this, Kishor, in a tweet, hit back at Nitish, saying, “@NitishKumar, what a fall for you to lie about how and why you made me join JDU !! Poor attempt on your part to try and make my colour same as yours! And if you are telling the truth who would believe that you still have courage not to listen to someone recommended by @AmitShah? (sic).”Earlier also, Nitish, on many occasions, had said, JD (U) admitted Kishor in its fold in September, 2018 at the “advice of Amit Shah.” He even accused Kishor of not losing any opportunity to attack the Centre’s policies, including CAA, NPR and NRC.

Title: Kerala government liable to implement apex court verdict: HC
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

KOCHI: The state government has the responsibility to implement the Supreme Court’s verdict in the Orthodox-Jacobite fued over church control without losing its spirit, the high court said on Tuesday.

The government cannot raise an objection to implementing the apex court’s verdict in favour of Orthodox faction citing law and order issues and it should issue clear directions for implementing the verdict, Justice A Muhamed Mustaque directed.

A petition seeking police protection for conducting religious rituals at St Stephen’s Church at Koothattukulam is being considered by the court. The petition was filed by Kochuparambil Geevarghese Ramban and priest Rajan George, who belong to the Orthodox faction, through senior advocate S Sreekumar.

Ordering the government to provide police protection to conduct religious rituals, the court said police should not prevent believers of the parish who peacefully attend the services at the church.

In the petition, it was alleged that police are not providing protection despite there being a judgment in favour of the Orthodox faction. Therefore, the high court should issue an order granting police protection for entering and conducting religious services at the church, the chapel, and the cemetery.

During the hearing, the court pointed out that as the apex court’s order exists, the lower court should be moved for implementation of the order, instead of filing a separate civil suit. However, petitions seeking police protection are being regularly filed. It is the state government that has to implement the SC judgment and it cannot desist from implementing the judgment citing law and order issues.

Further, the court said the government should be aware about the law and order issue that may arise while trying to implement the right of one faction. The issue won’t be solved by the court issuing an order for providing police protection. Police should be willing to extend support in implementing the order. As it is a law and order issue, the government should inform its stance, the court directed while scheduling a hearing on February 11. State government, district collector, and state police chief should inform their views regarding the demands made in the petition, the court said.

Title: ‘Suspected case was 800km away from Wuhan’
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Chandigarh: The suspected patient of novel coronavirus (nCoV) admitted to PGI is stable and no organ dysfunction has been reported, doctors said on Tuesday. The patient will remain in the hospital till the National Institute of Virology, Pune, sends its report.

Dr Vikas Suri, internal medicine department, PGI said, “The patient has travelled to various provinces of China from January 16. He was 800km away from Wuhan, the epicenter of the virus. He returned to India on January 22 and developed fever on January 26.

He said, “The patient had recurrent fever and he reported to the emergency with his wife. His vitals were fine. We took his family detail and quarantined his daughter, wife and mother at home.”

“As the family members have no symptoms, as per the protocols, we have home quarantined them,” said Dr Suri.

The Pune institute has received the throat swab and blood samples of the patient. “We have sent the samples for both H1N1 and nCoV tests. This is the season for influenza as well,” said Dr Suri.

“The blood samples will try and find the antigens. As this is a new virus, it is not known if it will enter the blood stream or not,” said Dr Gagandeep Grover, state programme officer, Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme, Punjab,

The suspected patient is under observation in the communicable diseases and isolation ward in PGI. “There are some recent studies in the Lancet and the New England Journal of Medicine, which report that unlike the H1N1, this virus does not affect the throat but causes pneumonia. However, this is in a very small sample and cannot be generalized,” said Dr Suri. He said, “We can only focus on prevention by maintaining hygiene and regular hand wash.”

The NIV is the only authorized laboratory for testing the virus in the country. “We had a video-conferencing with the Union health secretary on Monday. It was informed that the NIV is receiving daily around 50 samples from all states,” said Dr Suri.

Title: Anti-CAA rally gridlocks city for two hours; BRTS suspended too
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Hubballi: A massive protest rally against the Citizenship Amendment Act brought traffic to a halt in the central business district for two hours on Tuesday. Scores of commuters, especially rail and bus passengers, were stranded as bus services were suspended until movement eased.

The rally against CAA, National Register of Citizens and National Population Register was organised by various Dalit organisations under the aegis of Vividh Dalit Sangha-Sansthegala Mahamandal. Addressing the protesters, Hubballi-Dharwad East MLA Prasad Abbayya said the Centre was trying to divide the country on religious and caste lines.

Offering garlands to Ambedkar’s statue, hundreds of agitators set off from Ambedkar Circle and passed through Lamington Road, Sangolli Rayanna Circle and Channamma Circle to reached Mini Vidhana Soudha.

“The government is playing a game with the Dalits and minorities of the nation. It says CAA was amended in the past also. But the Centre should remember that Congress never amended it on grounds of religion and caste,” Abbayya said.

Mahamandal convener Gurunath Ullikashi alleged that the NDA government had implemented CAA to cover up its failure on development. “Amit Shah, during his recent visit to Hubballi, said 70% of refugees are Dalits. By issuing such a statement, he is again trying to divide Dalits, who are deprived of jobs, healthcare and other rights,” Ullikashi said.

Dalit leader Pitambarappa Bilar, former minister AM Hidasgeri, former mayor Venkatesh Mestri, former corporators Ganesh Tagargunti, Altaf Kittur, Congress leaders Anilkumar Patil, Altaf Hallur, NWKRTC former chairman Sadanand Danganavar, Samvidhan Suraksha Samiti’s Vijay Guntral, Anwar Mudhol, Ashraf Ali, Ismail Kalebudde and Devanand Jagapur were present at the rally.

Police diverted vehicles arriving from Gadag road at railway underbridge via Keshwapur and vehicles arriving from Hosur at Swimming Pool Complex. As buses were stopped, passengers headed to the Old Bus Stand and railway station ended up getting fleeced by auto-rickshaw drivers.

BRTS Mess

Though BRTS services were suspended, staff of BRTS counter at Yatri Hotel near BSNL office had issued tickets to passengers. “BRTS staff issued tickets, saying we could travel by any BRTS or NWKRTC bus, whichever comes first. But when the NWKRTC bus arrived, they did not allow us to board and said we should wait for BRTS bus. This is just their way of making money,” said Veeranna Raichur, a passenger. No refund was offered and passengers were forced to wait for the BRTS buses.

Traffic controller GR Renake said tickets were issued since BRTS buses were expected to ply. “We were helpless as buses were halted on way due to the protest,” he said.

Title: 39 gram panchayats told to prepare sewage treatment plan
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kolhapur: Aman Mittal, the Kolhapur zilla parishad’s chief executive officer (CEO), has warned the gram panchayat officials of around 39 villages — that are located along the Panchaganga river and are mainly responsible for the river’s pollution — to prepare a plan for sewage treatment by February 10.

He said if these gram panchayat officials fail to comply, they will face strict action.

Mittal told TOI that the villages have been given the deadline to produce the sewage treatment plan , which will be approved by month-end.

Uday Gaikwad, an environmental activist, said various industries are responsible for 10% of Panchaganga’s pollution. Almost 90% of the pollution is caused by effluents from the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC), Ichalkaranji municipal council and 174 gram panchayats. Out of these 174 gram panchayats, 39 need immediate attention and, therefore, the officials have been asked to prepare the plan.

“The pollution from sugar mills and other industrial units has dropped a lot in recent times. But when it comes to the villages, there needs to be an effective way of treating the sewage water. Unfortunately, the villages have not taken any initiative so far. This needs to change. The pollution control board had served notices to these villages in the past,” he said.

“The District Planning and Development Committee (DPDC) has already allotted around Rs 22 crore for the STPs, so there is nothing to worry about in terms of funding,” he added.

It has to be noted that the Panchaganga originates from Prayag Chikhali, 8km from Kolhapur, and is formed by four tributaries — Kumbhi, Kasari, Tulsi and Bhogavati. Around one million people from urban and rural areas are dependent on Panchaganga for their daily water needs.

Title: IRB gets land in Nandwal, new training centre in pipeline
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Kolhapur: After a long wait of ten years, the Indian Reserve Battalion (IRB) has finally got the land for setting up a training centre at Nandwal village in Kolhapur district.

The state government has sanctioned 115-acre land from Karveer taluka to the IRB. In October 2010, several villages from Kolhapur district were identified but everyone objected to the plan of setting up a training centre.

The government has, however, put some conditions which include making available the 12-meter road to the identified site. The social forestry department has done tree plantation at several places in the identified location and the government has asked the concerned authorities to do the construction activities without harming the plantation done in the region.

The IRB will conduct a survey of the land through a government surveyor and get approval of the construction plan from the concerned department. The will be further looking after the growth of these plants.

After the state government decided to set up an IRB unit in Kolhapur, the Kolhapur Zilla Parishad had identified Rendal village from Hatkanangle for setting up the unit. The area was around 175 acres and was identified for the training centre.

However, the villagers were adamant to only lease the land. The government officials then chose land from Dindnerli village but here too villagers denied land for the project. Even after repeated attempts to convince the villagers, they remained adamant.

Later the villagers from Radhanagari taluka came forward with a proposal to set up the IRB unit but the proposal was not accepted due to the geographical location of the unit as it was necessary for the unit to act quickly during emergency situations in the district.

There were also options of Majale village (Hatkanangle taluka) and Tamdalge village (Shirol taluka) but things didn’t materialise on those aspects. Finally, the land from Nandwal village was chosen for setting unit of IRB.

According to sources, the IRB unit in Kolhapur is a must as it will act as an additional force of trained personnel in maintaining law and order during emergency situations.

Title: Class VIII student drops dead at bus stop
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Chandigarh: A Class VIII student was found dead at a bus stop in Sector 21 here on Tuesday.

Rajbir (14), a resident of Bapu Dham Colony, was waiting for a bus after school hours with a friend and his brother. Suddenly, he fell on the road, his friend said. The two raised the alarm and a passerby took him to Government Multi-specialty Hospital, Sector 16, in his car, where doctors declared him brought dead and informed the police.

Cops from Sector 19 police station reached the spot. Police kept the body at the morgue for post-mortem. Police said there were no injury marks on the body of the boy. Cops said the student might have died due to a cardiac arrest. but the autopsy report would reveal the exact cause of death. The post-mortem would be conducted on Wednesday. Rajbir was studying at Government Model Senior Secondary School, Sector 21, along with his younger brother.

On August 22, 2019, a student of BA first-year at Post Graduate Government College (PGGC), Sector 11, died under mysterious circumstances on the campus. Garima, 18, a resident of Manimajra had fainted in her classroom. College authorities took her to Government Multi-specialty Hospital, Sector 16, where doctors declared her brought dead.

Title: Chandigarh: 540 autos challaned, 311 impounded in two days
Content:
The impounded autos at the Sector 23 traffic park in Chandigarh

TimesView Overloading of students in vehicles ferrying them to school is a big problem and poses danger to the lives of kids. There has been no end to violations on this count despite various directives by courts from time to time. The authorities crack down on violators for some days, but the drives peter out soon. Consistent vigilance and efforts are a must to make certain that the rules on the number of children per vehicle are followed. Apart from the schools and the authorities, even the parents should check whether the auto/bus that their child boards confirms to the seating limit rules.

CHANDIGARH: The police have challaned 540 auto-rickshaws and impounded 311 for violating various traffic norms in two days following the directions of the Punjab and Haryana high court to ensure the safety of schoolchildren and stop three-wheelers from carrying more than four children at a time.The traffic cops challaned 69 autos of other states for plying on city roads without having valid permits, seven for stopping on roads at Madhya Marg, Dakshin Marg and Udyog Path, 11 for wrong parking, and 11 for using mobile phones while driving on Monday. More than 90 challans were issued for ferrying more than four schoolchildren in an auto. Challans were also issued for running diesel-operated autos.On Monday, as many as 263 auto drivers were fined and 135 three-wheelers impounded. On Tuesday, 277 challans were issued till 6pm and 176 autos impounded.Traffic cops said they were receiving hundreds of complaints on its Facebook, Twitter and Whatsapp number regarding autos stopping randomly on roads leading to traffic congestion.More than a week back, the high court had passed orders related to traffic issues in the city. The HC had ordered that traffic police should ensure that just like ambulances, priority be given to school buses too. The court had banned ferrying more than four children in autos, observing that it’s a common sight that autos are overloaded “dangerously” with 10 to 12 schoolkids.

Title: Kolhapur: 14 KMT workers cooperative society directors booked
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: Karveer police have registered a case against 14 directors of KMT workers cooperative society from Pachgaon for allegedly siphoning of Rs 7 lakh by submitting fake bills .

Police have registered a case against them under sections 406 (punishment for criminal breach of trust), 408 (criminal breach of trust by clerk or servant) and 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property) of the Indian Penal Code.

According to police, the alleged scam took place between the years 2016 and 2017.

“The suspects were directors of the cooperative society when the fraud has been reported. The incident came to light after the government approved auditor conducted the audit of the society for the financial year 2016-17 and found the discrepancies in the accounts of the society,” a police officer attached with Karveer police station said.

“The suspects withdrew money from the society by showing some works and expenses but did not submit proper bills. They had also constructed a temple on the premises of the society, but had not taken prior approval from the authorities concerned. The expenses cannot be included in the audit of the society as per the rule,” he said, adding that they are investigating the case in detail and will take appropriate action against the suspects.

Title: After 144-day delay, Metro’s Aqua Line makes a splash
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nagpur: After a delay of 144 days, Reach III of Nagpur Metro (Sitabuldi to Lokmanya Nagar stretch) was flagged off by chief minister Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday. The first train on the Aqua Line, as the East-West corridor is called, chugged out of the Subhash Nagar station for Sitabuldi inter-change.

The line was to open on Sept 7 last year by prime minister Narendra Modi but the function was put off following heavy rain warning in Nagpur. MahaMetro has since been waiting for dates from VIPs to open the line.

The 11-km stretch between Lokmanya Nagar and Sitabuldi inter-change was thrown open for public commencing Nagpur Metro’s East-west run that was named Aqua as it runs along the scenic Ambazari lake and Nag River, before passing by Gandhisagar.

Like Thackeray, Union minister for housing and urban affairs Hardeep Singh Puri too participated in the flagging off ceremony through video link. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari, Home minister Anil Deshmukh, minister of urban development and public works Eknath Shinde, dairy development and animal husbandry minister Sunil Kedar, guardian minister Nitin Raut, leader of Opposition Devendra Fadnavis and mayor Sandip Joshi were also present.

The first commercial run on Aqua Line started at 2pm on Tuesday. From Wednesday onwards, trains will run from 8am to 8pm. Initially, they will depart after every 30 minutes in both directions. Only 6 stations — Lokmanya Nagar, Vasudev Nagar, Subhash Nagar, Institution of Engineers, Jhansi Rani Square and Sitabuldi Interchange — are operational.

Under Maha Vikas Aghadi government, the inaugural function saw potpourri of politicians of different parties sharing the dais. Everyone tried to take credit for Metro’s achievement. Kedar, who belongs to Congress, reminded the gathering the Metro was planned during the tenure of CM Vilas Deshmukh. Raut, also from Congress, gave credit to Prithviraj Chavan for bringing Metro to Nagpur. Former CM Devendra Fadnavis from BJP thanked the people of Nagpur for bearing with the his government as the Metro work was under way.

Deshmukh, Shinde and Raut also took a ride in the inaugural train post the flag off event.

Thackeray, while addressing the gathering via video link, urged Union minister Nitin Gadkari to support the current government in more such developmental works. “Works like Samruddhi Mahamarg, which we (Shiv Sena and BJP) started during our previous regime, would be carried on with equal vigour. Though we (Sena and BJP) aren’t boarding same trains, we can at least halt at same stations and plan things,” the CM said.

Emphasizing the word ‘Majhi’ in ‘Majhi Metro’, the name given by the agency to Nagpur Metro, Thackeray urged the Nagpurians to keep Metro clean as it was their property too. Congratulating Nagpur Metro for being the greenest, the CM also added the development should be done but not at the cost of harming the environment.

Gadkari heaped praises on MahaMetro MD Brijesh Dixit and said that he would soon felicitate the MD in a public function.

Durga Shankar Mishra, secretary, Housing and Urban Affairs, read out a message from Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulating MahaMetro and citizens of Nagpur. “The expansion of Nagpur Metro Rail Project will bring new areas of Nagpur on Metro map. This will help fulfil the collective aspirations of the region and also open new vistas of opportunities for the people,” Modi wrote.

While politicians took potshots in their speeches, there was also camaraderie on display. When Dixit was about to welcome Fadnavis with a bouquet, the former CM urged Dixit to go by the protocol and welcome Kedar first. The Congressman, however, refused to stand up and urged Dixit to welcome Fadnavis first. The healthy banter carried on for a few more seconds until Fadnavis accepted the bouquet from Dixit.

Title: Nagpur, Chandrapur, Wardha dist plans cut by Rs446.88cr
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nagpur: The shift in centre of power back to Western Maharashtra in the state has begun to show. Unlike previous Devendra Fadnavis government that favoured the backward region of Vidarbha, the new government has made massive cuts in district plans for at least three Vidarbha districts, including Nagpur. Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government has reduced the annual plan expenditure for Nagpur, Chandrapur, and Wardha districts by Rs446.88 crore for 2020-21 compared to previous year. Nagpur districts plan size was slashed by Rs225.48 crore, Chandrapur’s by Rs151.4 crore and Wardha’s by Rs 70 crore.

Deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar, who addressed media in city on Tuesday, justified the cut saying Fadnavis and former finance minister Sudhir Mungantiwar had diverted funds meant for other districts to favour their native places against the norms. He blamed BJP for allocating Rs112 crore more to Sindhudurg, as one of the BJP’s ministers of state hailed from there. He later clarified his government didn’t cut allocation of both districts for this financial year (2019-20).

In recent District Planning Committee’s (DPC) meeting under guardian minister Nitin Raut, a proposal to increase the expenditure by Rs 125 crore in addition to already allocated Rs 525 crore was sent to the government. As against this, Pawar, who holds finance minister, allocated Rs104.22 crore more to his Pune, where he is the guardian minister, as per reports. Earlier government had granted Rs520.78 crore for Pune, which Pawar increased to Rs625 crore.

Pawar said Fadnavis government had reduced the funds of Mumbai by Rs37 crore, Pune by Rs310 crore, Nashik by Rs196 crore and Aurangabad by Rs91 crore, totalling Rs651 crore.

Speaking after DPC review meeting, Pawar admitted guardian minister Nitin Raut, home minister Anil Deshmukh and other ministers were upset over cut in Nagpur’s pan size. “All three ministers expect their constituencies should get good allocation compared to what last government gave, as voters would otherwise question them for reduced funds. Though, I was unable to meet their expectations, I managed to satisfy other guardian ministers in state.”

Pawar added the allocation proposed by his department wasn’t final until approved by the cabinet and CM Uddhav Thackeray. “The proposed expenditure is fixed taking into the consideration population (30%), area (30%), human development index (HDI) (20%) and other factors. Last government had proposed an expenditure of Rs9,000 crore which we proposed to increase to Rs9,500 crore in next fiscal.”

The Baramati MLA said among all districts Gadchiroli, Washim, Osmanabad and Nandurbar were found with less capita income. MVA government would be allocating special funds to them to bring them at par with other districts.

“We have decided to give sufficient money to Naxalited affected Gadchiroli district as demanded by its guardian minister Eknath Shinde and other public representatives. Similarly, three towns in Chandrapur and Gondia, where Maoist presence is there would also get increased funds. Shinde pointed out Gadchiroli cops were finding it difficult to move in absence of sufficient vehicles, so government has decided to allocate up to Rs2 crore for vehicles. We are allocating Rs15 crore more for building homes for families of policemen so they can effectively fight the Naxalites.”

On Wardha, despite the cut, the deputy CM said since the nation was celebrating Mahatma Gandhi’s 150th birth anniversary, the government had decided to earmark more funds to the district. “Even centre has planned some programmes to celebrate the occasion. Wardha had close relations with the Father of the Nation,” he said. However, officials from his department disclosed Wardha’s funds were reduced from Rs190 crore to Rs120 crore.

Stressing that no injustice would be caused to Vidarbha and Nagpur, the second capital of state, Pawar said government needed to ensure equal distribution to all 36 districts as per set formula. “I was finance minister for four years and Jayant Patil for nine years but we never granted more funds to particular districts by reducing allocation of others,” he said.

* District annual budget 2020-21:

District --------- Actual --------- Allocated ----------- Proposed ---------- Reduction

Nagpur -------- 248 ------------ 525 ------------------- 299.52 -------------- 225.48

C’pur ---------- 215 ------------ 375 ------------------- 223.60 -------------- 151.4

Total ---------- 463 ------------ 900 ------------------- 523.12 -------------- 376.88

S’durg -------- 113 ------------ 225 ------------------- 118.65 -------------- 106.35

(* Amount in Rs crore, * Allocated by BJP govt, * Proposed by MVA govt * All figures given by Ajit Pawar)

Title: Metro BG to Gadchiroli will help end Maoist terror: Shinde
Content:
This story is from January 29, 2020

Nagpur: Extension of the proposed broad gauge (BG) project of MahaMetro to Wadsa will offer faster connectivity to mofussil areas in the region which in turn will help eradicate Maoist terror, which has plagued Gadchiroli district for over three decades, said urban development and public works minister Eknath Shinde.

Shinde, who is also guardian minister of Maoist-affected Gadchiroli, was speaking at the inauguration of AquaLine of MahaMetro Reach III in the city on Tuesday.
